loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina D. is a married woman. She is 42 years old and has five children. Some of her children are in tertiary school, while others are in junior and senior high school. It is her desire to help her husband sponsor all their children to the tertiary level. 

Ernestina has been a baker for over 12 years. She distributes her freshly baked bread to retailers in her community. Ernestina buys her materials including flour, margarine, and sugar, from Kumasi, a nearby city. She wants the loan so that she can buy ingredients in bulk to meet the increasing demand of her clients. Ernestina belongs to a Trust Bank group called “Adom Bi Apue.” The members in the group guarantee each other's loans.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and margarine in bulk

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
H. Shuhratjon is 24 years old, married and has two children. For the last two years, he has made a living as a taxi driver using his own vehicle. Shuhratjon's goal is to provide high-quality service at a reasonable price. He works hard to make his business stable and profitable, as he is the main bread-winner in his large family, which includes his parents. He is always ready to work, from early morning till late at night, in order to keep his current customers and win new ones. As with any business, Shuhratjon must make investments from time to time. And at the present moment, his car needs repairs. To make this possible, Shuhratjon is applying for a $800 loan for 12 months. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. Please help him improve his family's life.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: For repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị A.  năm nay 32 tuổi. Chồng chị không may mất sớm, chị hiện đang sống cùng 1 con còn nhỏ. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003.Trước khi tham gia Quỹ chị A. buôn bán quần áo trẻ em tại nhà. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị A. đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ dùng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh hàng ăn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị A., 32 years old, lives with her one young child. Unfortunately, her husband passed away at A. early age. Mrs. A. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. Before becoming a member of the Fund, she sold children’s clothing from her home. When she joined the Fund, Mrs. A. opened a business selling breakfast, and now this has become her main source of income. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND (350 USD) to buy supplies and equipment for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Améyo Élisabeth

texts.fr: Z. améyo  est une dame qui habite le quartier d’agoè Zongo, elle a pour activité la vente de charbons de bois en gros et quelques fois en détail. Elle fait ce commerce dans le marché local d’agoè zongo et ce depuis 1999, elle s’approvisionne au marché de gbadagbo. Actuellement son stock a diminué et c’est pour pouvoir augmenter son stock qu’elle sollicite  un crédit auprès de wages pour acheter 10 sacs de charbons. Elle est divorcée de son mari et a 05 personnes à charges, c’est avec ce commerce qu’elle arrive à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Z. Améyo is a woman who lives in the Agoè Zongo district. Her work involves selling charcoal wholesale and sometimes retail. She has been in this business since 1999 at the local marketplace of Agoè Zongo. She supplies herself at the Gbadagbo marketplace. Right now, her inventory is reduced. To increase it, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy 10 sacks of charcoal. She is divorced from her husband and has five people to support. This commerce of hers is how she manages to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Yatim

texts.en:
S. Yatim has a mobile shoeshine and shoe repair business in the streets of Somoni, mainly in the neighborhood of the main market. He is married and has three children. He works hard to support his family. He has been working at this business for 8 years. Today he has an urgent need to purchase more of the same shoeshine products and for this reason Yatim has been working with IMON International for the last 3 years. He feels very satisfied with the timely credit that has been granted to him, helping him to supply the needs of his business and obtain the products to keep repairing shoes.

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials for his business

loans.name: Kodir

texts.en:
G. Kodir is 44 years old. He is married with three children. Kodir is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today Kodir is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $400 USD in his business. In order to receive this amount, Kodir has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Исмоилов Рустам житель  города Куляб . Возраст 39 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. По специальности радиотехник. Работает на рынке "Саховат" . Имеет точку , где стоит аппарат по производству дубликатов ключей.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет ему в течение долгого времени обслуживать клиентов по доступным ценам.
texts.en:
Rustam I. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 39 years old, married and has three children. He has a secondary-technical education and is a radio technician by trade. He works at the Sahovat market. Rustam has a retail outlet with a key duplication machine. He has been in this business for 10 years. Rustam plans to obtain the loan in order to purchase raw materials. This will help him over a long time to serve his clients at affordable prices.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 35 years old.  She is married with 8 children. She sells palm oil, and is seeking a loan of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. 

She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Lidia es casada tiene 37 años, 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal 
Lidia tenia un negocio con su esposo de carpintería, pero hace dos años lo cerro por que su esposo viajo a  trabajar España, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el mercado, es ambulante y  ofrece a sus vecinos, los fines de semana vende comida en la puerta de su casa,
Desde que Lidia esta en Finca los créditos han ayudado a su negocio, le esta yendo muy bien. 
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar ropa y la preparación de sus comidas.
El sueño de Lidia es tener una boutique en su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of San Judas Tadeo Bancomunal. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 children who are 15 and 12 years old and go to a state school.

Lydia had a carpentry business with her husband, which she closed two years ago when her husband moved to Spain to work. She sells clothes in the market, and door to door to neighbors. She also sells meals on the weekends at the door of her house.

Finca loans have helped Lidia's business, she is doing very well. She needs a loan of $425 to buy clothes and prepare meals to sell. Her dream is to have a boutique at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar S., 44, is a married man who has three children aged between 7-20. His family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has been running a sales business related to livestock, traveling to neighboring provinces and purchasing raw materials. He has a Russian vehicle that is used for his business. He drives around the countryside to purchase wool, cashmere, leather and furs directly from local herders at a cheap prices. Then he transport these raw materials to the center of the province to sell to retailers at wholesale prices.

Sometime he goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to sell raw materials for higher prices. With the profit he has been building a house on the plot of land he owns. His eldest daughter Narangarav, 20, is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Second child Mendgarav, 18, is just graduating from high school and is planning to enroll in university this year.

Ganbaatar is working hard to complete the building of a house for his family needs and to save small amounts for his two children’s tuition. With this loan, he plans to purchase wool and cashmere at cheap prices.

loans.use: To purchase wool and cashmere for his business

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Gracsa Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Gracsa está conformado por María Isabel Chávez M. y Eligia María D. Chávez ambas con diferentes actividades económicas. María tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia, ya anteriormente su esposo le ayudaba con esta actividad, y fue por la forma tan dinámica que el poseía para ofrecer los nacatamales de María que obtuvo los clientes. Pero María tenía problemas respiratorios, debido al humo. Pero a pesar de este tipo de dificultades por las que enfrento no la detuvieron para que siguiera adelante con su negocio, y fue con la ayuda de María que decidieron realizar mejoras para sus negocio. La Señora Eligia tiene 32 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Decide incursionar en negocio por su amiga María Isabel ya que ella le ayudo al inicio con muy pocos productos como perfumes, calzado y cremas. Por lo que poco a poco fue que logro independizarse y obtener su propia actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en invertir el dinero en la compra de nuevos productos. El sueño que las dos comparten es preparar a sus hijos para que no sufran todas las cosas por las que ellas atravesaron.
texts.en:
The Group Solidario Gracsa is formed by Maria Isabel M. and Eligia María D. Chávez. Both of them have different businesses. Maria is 49 years old, her business is the selling of nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). She has been working in this business for over 10 years. She began selling on her own and her husband helped her with this activity. It was Maria's dynamic personality and her way of selling her nacatamales that gained her many loyal customers. But Maria had respiratory problems due to the smoke.Despite the difficulties she faced, she carried on with her business and decided to make improvements to her business. Eligia is 32 years old, she is a married woman with 2 children. She sells cosmetics and has been working in this business for more than 9 years. She decided to start her business because of her friend Maria Isabel, who also helped her to start with a few products like perfumes, shoes and creams. Little by little she was able to gain her independence and run the business on her own. The loan is for working capital to buy new products. Both women share the dream of preparing their children so that they will not suffer the things that they themselves have suffered.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for their businesses

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely helps her husband manage their furniture-making business. Her husband, Dorio, is very hardworking and that makes her very proud. They are blessed with three children, namely: Jimmy, Juvie and Ofela. Fely is happy that she has a family that is very cooperative with each other. Her eldest is now working in Manila as food-chain crew, the second child is helping them in their furniture business, while the youngest is still in college.

Fely also manages being a direct seller of Avon products in their village to earn extra income for their daily needs. She is hoping that her family will become successful in their individual goals to achieve the welfare of their family in the future. Fely also supports her children’s ambitions in life and thus lets them do what they think is best for themselves.

To provide for the development of good and quality furniture products, Fely is asking financial help from Kiva amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Essi Mawuli

texts.fr: Cette femme a ouvert dans son quartier Adidogomé à Lomé une boutique de prêt-à-porter pour subvenir à ses propres besoins. Elle exerce cette activité depuis deux ans et sa boutique est très fréquentée non seulement par les gens du voisinage mais aussi par des clients venant de loin. La plupart de ses commandes viennent d’Europe à cause des exigences de sa clientèle. Pour faire une nouvelle commande, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des balles de pantalons moulant pour dames, mais aussi des chemises à la mode et des produits cosmétiques de différentes catégories pour dames. Elle n’est pas mariée et est sans enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who opened a ready-to-wearing clothing store in her district of Adidogomé in Lomé in order to support herself.  She has been in this business for two years.  Her store is very busy, not only with people in the neighborhood, but also with customers from afar.  Most of her orders come from Europe because of customer requirements.  To order anew, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy bales of form-fitting pants for women, and also stylish blouses and cosmetic of various types for women.  She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Zrou

texts.fr: Zrou D. est un mécanicien âgé de 31 ans marié avec un enfant. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il a réalisé qu’il obtiendrait plus de bénéfices s’il associait la vente de pièce d’occasion des voitures à son atelier. Avec ce prêt il souhaiterait aussi acheter les outils de travail afin de recruter beaucoup d’apprentis qui obtiendront à la fin de leur apprentissage une prestation de service. Avec ses bénéfices, il pense construire un garage mécanique et assurer d’une meilleure manière la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zrou D., age 31, is a mechanic who is married and has one child.  He lives and works in Adéta, a town located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  He realized he would have bigger profits if he added the sale of used car parts to his shop.  With this loan, he would also like to buy work tools in order to recruit many apprentices, who will actively serve at the end of their apprenticeship.  With his profits, he thinks he will build a mechanic's garage and will better ensure that his children are educated.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Gracel

texts.en:
Gracel S. is from the village of Danao. She is 22 years old. Gracel is married. To make a living, Gracel owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Gracel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gracel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gracel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Gracel is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gracel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 09.1.3 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Tỵ N. Thị (24) is a 58 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Tỵ is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09.1.3 Nam Ngạn (02.09.1.3).


Tỵ is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Tỵ owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Tỵ has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tỵ is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is now requesting a new loan of 3.000.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tỵ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. Thị Đào (25) is a 57 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  N. Thị Hòa (26) is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Lê Thị Mai (27) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nhữ Thị Hương (28) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


5.  Lê Thị T. Linh (29) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tỵ N. Thị (24) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Tỵ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09.1.3 Nam Ngạn (02.09.1.3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tỵ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tỵ kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Tỵ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tỵ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về N.ng Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. Thị Đào (25) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  N. Thị Hòa (26) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Lê Thị Mai (27) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nhữ Thị Hương (28) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


5.  Lê Thị T. Linh (29) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho N.ng người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa Del Carmen R. de 60 años de edad, es madre soltera vive junto a su única hija quien es el orgullo de esta madre, residen en la capital del país el departamento de San Salvador. Rosa posee una tienda de productos de consumo donde ella genera las ganancias necesarias para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Rosa solicita de este crédito comprometida a pagar de manera puntual, el destino del crédito será para surtir el negocio de Mirna.
texts.en:
Rosa Del Carmen R. is 60 years old, a single mother, and a resident of San Salvador. She lives with her only daughter, who is very proud of her mother. Rosa manages a store where she sells consumer products and generates income to cover her living expenses. She is requesting a loan to restock her business and promises to submit her payments in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with additional merchandise

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng C., 51, has a business making and selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province. The brooms are made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Leng C. learned how to make brooms from her neighbors and she started doing this business in 2000. She earns around $3 US each day. Her husband is a wedding chef and makes $1 US every day. This couple has two children, both employed as garment factory workers.

Leng C. told a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around $30 US on food and $5 US on utilities. She is asking for a loan from Kiva via CREDIT, the local partner, to purchase long grass in bulk. This will save money and allow her to make more brooms. She plans to distribute the brooms to other small sellers. In the future, if possible, she wants to have a small truck to transport the brooms.

loans.use: To make brooms

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en: A. Dilovar is 42 years old. She is an experienced businesswoman and a loving mother to three children. She has her own sewing machine and runs her business from her home. Dilovar is a well-known seamstress in her community, since she has been working there for more than three years. Through word of mouth, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Now she is requesting a loan of $1500 USD to purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics for sewing traditional dresses. This will help improve the quality of life of her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new sewing machine and fabrics for sewing the national dresses.

loans.name: Sénévé Plus Group

texts.en: Sénévé Plus is a Community Bank made up of 25 micro entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Getou M.. These members are united for the same goal. They wish to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. Getou sells soft drinks in her area, located in the northeastern area of Kinshasa. She began her business in 2002 with initial capital of $80.00. After hard work and good management, she has succeeded in making her business thrive, thanks to the accumulated profits. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and she has already received four different loans. These previous loans have been fully repaid. She intends to reinforce her capital with the next loan by adding five crates of soft drinks. This business gives Getou a profit of $60.00 every week. Getou is 42 years old, single and the mother of a 17-year-old daughter who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase five crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta sells bags of poultry feed at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. She is 35 years-old and married with five children. Her husband sells timber to support the home. She is an honest and faithful Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client.  Kiva partner LAPO is committed to improving lives in Africa particularly in Nigeria.  Benedicta has been in this business for a long time and she is a very focused business woman with strong determination. She is requesting a loan of  NGN 50,000 to purchase more bags of poultry feed to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of poultry feed.

loans.name: Maribel Tania

texts.es:
La señorita Maribel E. P. tiene 22 años y vive en la zona de Sumumpaya en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Maribel aun no se caso y vive en casa de su madre. Maribel se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y con esa leche elabora queso que vende en el mercado de Cochabamba y también se dedica a vender junto a su madre fruta, también en el mercado. En su casa tienen 3 vacas lecheras que fueron la herencia que le dio su mama para que ella se haga cargo, ya que su madre se dedica a la elaboración de queso hace muchísimos años.

Maribel quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos, pero ella nos cuenta que hace dos años una inundación destruyo la casa de su madre y apenas están terminando de construirla de nuevo y mientras ella no este cómoda, feliz y tranquila en su casa ella seguirá junto a ella. El crédito será destinado a la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos.

Maribel nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a su madre para que sea feliz y ya no sufra por falta de una casa. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Maribel E. P. is 22, and she lives in the Sumumpaya area in the area south of the city of Cochabamba. Maribel has not yet married, and she lives in her mother’s house. Maribel’s business is the production of raw milk. She uses this milk to make cheese to sell in the Cochabamba market. She also sells fruit in the market with her mother. She has three dairy cows at home that her mother gave her to take care of because her mother has now been making cheese for many years. Maribel would like to have a family, children, and grandchildren in the future. She tells us that two years ago a flood destroyed her mother’s house, and they are just finishing building it again. She will continue to stay with her mother while her mother is not comfortable, happy, or at ease in her house. The loan is to buy another dairy cow. This way she will be able to increase her milk production and her income. Maribel tells us that her greatest dream is to be able to give all of the comforts that she can to her mother. She wants to do this so that she will be happy and not suffer from not having a house. She also tells us that with the next loan she would like to be able to improve the conditions of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam P. is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Enclaro, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling nipa (palm leaves that are woven together and used as roofing material for native huts) and operating a fish pond. Meriam’s husband Tirzo helps in running the business, concentrating most of his efforts in the management of the fish pond. They have 5 children who all go to school but, as part of their daily chores, also assist their parents in their business activities. 

Meriam joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope of improving her family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase the family income and now earns an average of Php 10,000 a month from her business activities. She is a member of good standing who used her last loan of Php 29,000 to fund her nipa business. This had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 29,500 (her 18th loan) to continue improving her business. Meriam is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" — a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Bernadette Baï

texts.fr: S. Bernadette Baï est née le 11 Juillet 1970 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Il a environs 16 ans que Bernadette Baï s'est installée au quartier Womey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Mariée à GBOCOGO Claude, un agent de la COGESSA au Bénin, Bernadette Baï est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Bernadette Baï vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Bernadette Baï n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Bernadette Baï mène comme activité, la vente de condiments (oignons, piments, tomates fraîches, épices : poivre, ails, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Bernadette Baï vend également divers produits (oeufs, poissons fumés, etc.). Bernadette Baï s'approvisionne à Glazoué et au marché Djoda au Bénin. C'est depuis 12 ans que Bernadette Baï mène cette activité. Bernadette Baï a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Bernadette Baï voudrait agrandir son activité et ouvrir une seconde boutique dans le marché de son quartier, afin d'accroître son revenu et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est ce qui amène Bernadette Baï à solliciter un deuxième prèt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Bernadette Baï S. was born on July 11, 1970 in Abomey, historical town of Benin. About 16 years ago, Bernadette Bai settled in the neighborhood of Womey, in the town of Abomey Calavi. She is married to Claude Gbocogo, an agent of COGESSA in Benin. Bernadette Bai is the mother of three children, all attending school. She lives alone with her children and she alone supports them. She only attended primary school. To meet her needs and those of her children, Bernadette Bai sells condiments (onions, hot peppers, fresh tomatoes, spices: pepper, garlic etc…) in her store located in her home. She also sells various products (eggs, smoke fish etc…). She gets her supplies in Glazoue and at the Djoda market in Benin. She has been practicing this activity for 12 years. Bernadette Bai has already received a loan from ALIDé, the loan was reimbursed fully. She would like to expand her activity and open a second store in her neighborhood’s market place, in order to increase her income and to better meet the needs of her customers. This brings Bernadette Bai to request a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 2 baskets of hot peppers and vegetables, fish.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina sells milk in Bwaise, along Kampala Gulu road. She buys milk from dairies in Kawempe and so incurs little transport costs to and from her suppliers. She serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has had this business for over 30 years. Her main challenges are defaulters and the rainy season, because she works from a very open place and on a retail basis only.

Regina is 55 years of age and widowed with seven children between the ages of 16 and 38. Three of her children go to school. The rest are working at petty jobs in Kampala city. The family owns a four room house where four of them live. Regina takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. They eat three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for children and grandchildren, medication and food for the family, and rent.

Regina has been with MCDT for over 12 years, now on her 36th loan working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of milk. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to own a dairy.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie C. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lenie owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Lenie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Lenie joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve her business

loans.name: Babie Jane

texts.en:
Babie Jane A. is from the village of Highway Lawis. She is 24 years old. Babie Jane is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Babie Jane has a furniture making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Babie Jane has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Babie Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Babie Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. Babie Jane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Babie Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Akim Christel

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a ouvert sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale qu’il a appelé « Ets BAS prix »,  sa clientèle est composée de toutes personnes et grandit tous les jours, pour les satisfaire convenablement il doit rehausser son stock, raison pour laquelle il s’adresse à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en divers produits d’alimentation générale.
Il est marié et père d’un enfant, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This man keeps his own grocery shop called « Ets BAS prix » [“LOW prices too”]. His customer base is very diverse and grows day by day. In order to properly satisfy customer demand he needs to increase his stock, which is why he has turned to WAGES in order to be able to stock up on grocery items. He is married and the father of one child. It is with the income from his shop that he supports his family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various grocery items (for resale)

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rem U. is a 25-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province. Mrs. Rem U. is a leader of a group loan. She was selected by the nine group members. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Rem U. is a pig breeder at home. For her pig business, Mrs. Rem U. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Noeun Soem is an iron welder who earns a small income to support his family. This couple has two children; one is attending a local school and youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparing and serving food

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es: Elena Marisol tiene la edad de 32 años, Ella en la actualidad necesita su crédito para comprar artículos, porque de esta manera sus clientes pueden ver la rapidez que tiene para conseguirles el producto. Su sueño es establecer una tienda en donde pueda ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos. Fue así con su esfuerzo que dio inició con un catalogo y hoy, para poder diversificar su oferta, maneja diferentes productos. Gracias a este negocio pudo ayudar a que sus hijos sigan adelante. El financiamiento será para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Elena is 32 years old and she needs this loan in order to buy products so that her customers can see how quickly she is able to fill their requests. Her dream is to open a store where she can offer a large variety of products. It was with this effort that she began her catalog sales and now she is able to offer a more diverse selection of products. Thanks to this business she was able to help her children get ahead. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Jessica is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jessica owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, tiene 39 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco de Perú.  

Martin nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a  la venta de zapatos de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude comprar más mercadería. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Martin, 39, belongs to the Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa group in the Peruvian city of Cusco. Martin tells us, "My community bank has 10 members and they chose me to talk about my business. I work as a street vendor selling shoes. I have worked with Asociacion Arariwa for some years and it has been a successful partnership. The loans and help that they have given me have allowed me to buy more merchandise. I want a loan now so that I can buy more merchandise that I will resell."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, gracias a su desempeño como docente ha logrado  apoyar a su familia.
Con ahorros han logrado  hacer su casa, con lo caro que esta toda, ahora con la iniciativa del financiamiento han mejorado la infraestructura de su casa.
Con el préstamo anterior logro hacer la cocina, que hoy en día esta en mejores condiciones de espacio. 
Como trabajadora activa lo que desea es poder preservar su trabajo, para lograr el objetivo de seguir haciendo las mejoras  a su casa.
Con este préstamo seria su segundo financiamiento que podrá comprar puerta y ventana que están malas y quiere mejor seguridad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 45 year-old woman, married and the mother of 3 children. Thanks to her work as a teacher, she has managed to support her family. With her savings she has built her house, with the care that she gives to everything. Now, with the incentive of financing, she is improving the infrastructure of her house. With previous loans, she has added space to her kitchen. As an active worker she wants to preserve her job, in order to achieve the objective of continuing to improve her house. With this loan, her second, she will be able to buy a door and a window to replace damaged ones and improve the security of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a door and a window to replace ones damaged by age and thus improve the security of her home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business making furniture. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make furniture. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw materials to make furniture. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B., age 47, and her husband Nicomedes, work hard to cover their daily expenses and pay for the education of their two children, one who is in elementary school and the other who attends college.  For the past six years Wilma has been direct selling branded apparels, cosmetics, footwear, and accessories, as well as operating an Internet cafe.  Wilma would like to keep her business current and hopes to buy more products for direct selling, one new computer, and to pay for maintenance on existing computers.  For this purpose she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan.  Wilma has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2008 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.  She hopes that the loan will help to grow her business and continue to provide for the education of her daughter and son. 

About the Center for Community Transformation (CCT):
CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missionary work in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.  Locally, all CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products for direct selling.

loans.name: Ofik

texts.en:
Ofik G. is an experienced seamstress. For several years she worked from home. Last year Ofik has rented a booth in one of the city markets from where she sells self-made and purchased women’s clothing, as well as tailoring locally purchased cloth according to the client’s needs. Ofik also sews custom-ordered tablecloths and bed linens. 

Ofik has applied for the loan to purchase fabric and accessories to offer her customers a wider variety of options.

loans.use: purchasing fabric and asscessories

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher B. is from the village of Brgy. Payawan, Lamut, Ifugao. He is 36 years old. Christopher is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Christopher runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Christopher has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Christopher joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christopher is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Christopher from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the town of Siayan. She is 61 years old. Norma is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Norma plants and harvests rice for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 16,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Norma is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be Norma's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Editha Modesta

texts.es:
Editha de 38 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura llamado “Rohi”. vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Inicio con el taller de confección hace dos años atrás con una maquina de coser vieja pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Desde ese tiempo confecciona pantalones, vestidos, blusas. Trabaja con ayuda de una de sus sobrinas desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días.  

Para continuar con su taller de confección de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y maquina de coser, en el futuro quiere trabajar con empleados y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Editha is 38 years old and she has a dressmaking and sewing studio called "Rohi". She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an area where most residents are informal traders). 

She started her dressmaking studio two years ago with an old sewing machine and she was able to establish enough clients to cover her costs. Since that time she has been making trousers, dresses and blouses. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and is helped by one of her nieces. 
 
To progress with her dressmaking studio she wants to use this loan to buy material and a sewing machine. In the future she would like to have employees and to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy material and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine T. is a 38-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   a ready-to-wear clothes business, a peanut butter business, and a general store business. 

She lives in Margarita, Brgy. Calumangan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes, peanut butter, and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Josephine is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell.   This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Josephine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase stocks for resale

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson W. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He is married with three children, aged nine, five and two.

Nelson has been in the farming business for ten years and sells products such as maize, tomatoes, cabbage, and milk at a local market. He is requesting a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

With the expected increase in income, Nelson hopes to be able to better support his family. Five years from now, he hopes to have expanded his business and own at least five dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán vive en la zona de llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es artesano, preparador de calzados y su esposa elabora todo tejido en lana.
Es casado y tiene tres hijas
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora, que le servirá para los estudios de sus hijas ya que una esta por entrar a la universidad y dos están en colegio nivel secundario.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Hernán lives in the Llojeta neighborhood in the city of La Paz.
He is a craftsman who makes footwear, and his wife crochets a wide variety of items from wool.
He is married and has three daughters.
This loan willl be used to purchase a computer for his daughters' school work.  One is entering the university, and the other two are in high school.
This is the second time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO (local lending institution), and the second time that he has requested the help of Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for his daughters.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and married to John, who also contributes to the family income. They have two children. Jane has been in the knitting business for a period of six years, with an income of 10,000 KES per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to stock more yarn and buttons. She hopes to open more knitting shops in the area and to manage a wholesale shop. She also hopes to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy yarn and buttons

loans.name: Nereyda Del Socorro

texts.es: Nereyda tiene 44 años, es madre de 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Desde hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida, a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en materia prima como aceite, arroz, frijoles, verduras entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Nereyda is 44 years old.  She has three children who work independently.

Through her own efforts she started her business over five years ago.  When she was very young, her mother taught her how to earn a living for herself.  She learned how to do this in spite of the difficult situations she has faced in this business activity.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients like oil, rice, beans, and vegetables, among other things.

She dreams of improving her house because she still does not have certain basic services.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. has been selling cereals, sugar and bags of charcoal in Takoradi for three years. Sarah has received senior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Sarah assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of charcoal for sale. She anticipates using the new profit to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mbocayá Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mbocayá Poty es de la zona de San Ignacio Misiones, la presidenta es la sra. Sonia M., ella es empleada doméstica, como muchas de sus compañeras, y desean poner un puesto de ventas de comidas, ya que algunas des D. grupo se dedica a eso, ya sean comidas típicas D. país, frutas y comidas rápidas.
Gracias al crédito han podido aumentar sus ingresos económicos dentro de sus propias casas, ya que la mayoría de ellas tienen hijos en edad escolar.
El deseo de ellas es fortalecerse como grupo y llegar a los niveles más altos D. programa.
texts.en:
The Mbocayá Poty committee is in the San Ignacio Misiones zone.  Its President is Mrs. Sonia M..  She is a domestic employee like many of her fellow members.  They want to set up a food selling stand because some of the group members are in this line of work, be it typical national dishes, fruit or fast food.

Thanks to the loan they have been able to increase their income within their households since most of them have school age children.

Their wish is to strengthen as a group and reach the highest program levels.

loans.use: To buy fruit (pineapples, bananas, oranges, apples, plums, peaches), vegetables (bell peppers, tomatoes, onions, potatoes) and baked goods.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Mr. Edgar R. is from the village of Tabid, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. Edgar has owned and operated a piggery business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In January 2011, Edgar joined PMPC under the pension loan program to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgar is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials to construct a piggery. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and in saving for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase material to construct a piggery

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 33-year-old married man with four children and llves in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely responsible for looking after his children and his dream is to educate them up to university level. For eight years Geofrey has been operating a retail shop. He faces minimal hardships in his business, such as high rental costs. Geofrey is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Selifatou

texts.fr: Madame Selifatou est née en 1964 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales qu’elle achète à Anié. Elle a commencé en 1989 et revend les céréales au marché de Hedzranawoé. De plus, elle avait eu un crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter  2 sacs de riz, 3 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs d’haricot, 3 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de soja et 2 sacs de petit piment.
texts.en: Selifatou was born in 1964 in Lomé. She is married and mother to three children. She retails cereals which she buys in Anié. She began doing this in 1989 and resells the cereals at the market in Hedzranawoé. She has had a loan which she has already repaid and is now requesting a loan to buy two bags of rice, three bags of corn, two bags of beans, three bags of millet, two bags of soya and two bags of small peppers.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora  C. A. Patricia tiene 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de  6 años y de 20 años, la señora por motivos económicos no pudo seguir en la secundaria, tuvo su primer hijo muy joven a los 16 años de edad, es una mujer que se ha casado 2 veces.
Patricia es una mujer muy trabajaradora, responsable, emprendedora .Ella vino a la Fundación por que la recomendó una amiga y desde hace 5 años ha mantenido  crédito, en los anteriores créditos ha tenido una excelente moral de pago.
La solicitante con el crédito piensa invertirlo en mercadería para su negocio como perfumes, electrodomésticos para vender, ropa, etc.También piensa hacer una remodelación en su casa para su negocio. Patricia tiene más de 11 años de dedicarse al comercio empezó vendiendo medias y ahora vende más productos, ella cuando empezó  su primer obstáculo fue no tener capital de trabajo y ser madre adolecente
La clienta se levanta temprano hace las labores domesticas,  después se dedica hacer tareas con sus hijos y  atender a su esposo que llegue del trabajo,  después en la tarde se dedica a vender y cobrar. Con este crédito la señora podrá tener más capital de trabajo para generar ingresos en su casa, será de gran ayuda para seguir apoyándola en su negocio
texts.en:
Patricia C. A. is 36 years old.  She lives with her husband and her two children aged 6 and 20.  For financial reasons, Patricia could not finish her high school studies.  She had her first son at a very young age, when she was 16, and has been married twice. 

Patricia is a very hard-working, responsible and enterprising woman.  She came to Fundación Mujer because a friend recommended us to her.  She has now been taking loans for 5 years and has repaid all her loans perfectly.

Patricia is planning to use this loan to invest in buying merchandise for her business.  She will buy products such as perfumes, clothes and small electrical appliances to sell.  She is also planning to remodel her home for business purposes.

Patricia has been a saleswoman for more than 11 years.  She started out selling panty hose and then added more products.  When she started out in business her first obstacles were not having working capital and being a teenage mom.  Patricia gets up early, does her housework and then does some tasks with her children and waits for her husband to come home from work.  In the afternoon, she goes out selling her products and collecting payments.  With this loan, Patricia will have more working capital which she can use to make income for her household.  This will be a great help and support to her in her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to remodel her home/business

loans.name: Shamil

texts.ru: Shamil B. 23 qoda. On jenat i imeyet odnu dochku. Shamil jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimoy dochkoy. Shamil uje 2  qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom on razvodit korov. Tak kak u neqo bizness noviy on imeyet maloye kolichestvo korov poetomu on seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta kotoroye on pradayet v magazini dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Shamil B. is 23 years old. He is married and has one daughter. Shamil lives in the Absheron region together with his wife and beloved daughter. Shamil has been doing animal husbandry and breeding cows for two years now. Because it's a new business he has a small number of cows and this is why he now needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase milk products which he sells to the stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: 55-year-old Patrick M. has been a poultry farmer for the past 6 years in Kyamagwa-Jinja. He sells chickens and eggs. Prior to the poultry business, this happily married father of 7 was engaged in farming. He still carries out his farming though on low scale compared to before he began the poultry business. He says his monthly sales profits amount to 400,000 shillings. With this loan money Patrick says he is going to purchase more chickens to resell and also chicken mash for his growing chicks.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to resell and chicken mash for his growing chicks

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Jeune homme dévoué de 26ans, Mr Kokou réside à Baguida (un quartier situé environ 20km de la ville de Lomé). Il a 04 enfants en charge et marié à une cultivatrice. Il vend du sodabi (une boisson locale faite à base de palmier appréciée par la population), ce prêt l’aidera à parfaire sa production .il s’approvisionne en matière première a Notsé et revend après transformation  à BAGUIDA et à la population environnante.il  a commencé depuis 2006 cette activité et espère  un jour  la voir grandir en usine de production de boissons locales pour plus tard l’exporter.
texts.en: A dedicated 26 year-old young man, Mr. Kokou resides in Baguida (a neighborhood located about 12 miles outside of Lome). He has 4 dependent children and is married to a farmer. He sells sodabi (a very popular local drink distilled from palm). This loan will help him to perfect his production. He procures his raw materials in Notse and resells after transformation in Baguida and to the neighboring population. He started this activity in 2006 and hopes to one day see it grow to become a local beverage production factory and later to export it.

loans.use: to purchase palm and sodabi (palm-based drink) jerrycans

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
El señor Pedro  es padre de familia, tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es el cemento, varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Ya que a su casa le esta haciendo falta el techo porque actualmente lo tiene de madera y lamina.  Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
 Solicita el préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagar con sus ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo.
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Pedro is a father with three adolescent children who are currently in school. 

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials such as cement and reinforcing bars and pay the person who will carry out the work. This is because his house needs a roof; it is currently covered with wood and metal sheeting. He plans to construct a concrete slab roof so that his house will be more secure and durable. 

He is requesting the loan for this construction, and he plans to pay for it with the income he obtains from his work. 

His desire is that his children can have their own room and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a concrete slab roof for his house.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. 
Juliet has a retail shop that sells a variety of fruits. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different kinds of fruits, like watermelons & mangoes.
Juliet is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fruits, like watermelons & mangoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 36 years old and lives in Otavalo, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband. Dolores is a calm and peaceful person with desires to overcome the social and economic obstacles in her life. She is a seamstress who sews blouses and she sells livestock. Dolores seeks this loan to purchase cattle and material for the creation of blouses. She began making blouses by hand after learning the tradition from her mother. She has been dedicated to this business for 10 years. Her first loan was used to purchase a sewing machine that has allowed her to make blouses more rapidly. Dolores reports that her blouse-making business is going well and that she receives orders every week. Dolores believes that her loan will help her attain economic stability. Her dream is to purchase an embroidery machine and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase material to make blouses and to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 45-year-old woman, who is married and has one son and two daughters. Her husband is an employee in a factory, and she owns a shop selling clothes in a lively commercial area and she wants to purchase seasonal clothes as the customer demand is getting higher. 

Mariam's husband doesn't have enough cash money to pay, so Mariam took out a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN which can be repaid on an easy monthly basis.

Mariam's husband Mahmoud is photographed here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres e hijos de 15 y 20 años, en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
