La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

María se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.
 
Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios. 

Le gusta escuchar música, y realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
María Esther is 42 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and her two children, 15 and 20 respectively, in the town of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The Ninth of April Rural Bank is located in the San José del Tambo parish in Chillanes. The members of this rural bank work in agriculture mostly growing corn and cocoa. 

María grows corn and cocoa. She buys and sells her products at the market in San José del Tambo.

She is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies for her crops. The loan will help her cover her expenses and improve her agricultural activities. She faces many challenges like drops in commodity prices and working with middlemen. Her dream is for her children to complete their studies.

In her free time she listens to music and does housework.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and lives in Sebucao, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has 1 child.

Gina operates a business raising hogs and selling livestock, earning approximately PHP 6,000 monthly. She has requested this loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase livestock. Gina has been a member of PMPC for more than 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have her own piggery and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de 5 filles et d'un garçon.Les quatre filles sont à l'école.Sa principale activité est la location de planches en bois pour le coffrage des bâtiments et la location de baches.Il a démarré cette activité depuis 1999 et compte aujourd'hui 173 planches et 4 bâches.Il entretient sa femmes et ses enfants avec les revenus de ses locations.Afin d'acheter une cinquième bâche, il sollicite un pret de 250 000F auprès de l'UIMCEC.Son ambition est de construire une maison sur son terrain acquis avec ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This borrower is married man, the father of five girls and a boy. Four girls are in school. His main work involves the renting of boards for formwork in the building industry and the renting of tarps. He started this business in 1999, and today he has 173 boards and 4 tarps. He takes care of his wife and children with the income on rents. 

In order to buy a fifth tarp, he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs from U-IMCEC. His ambition is to build a house on his plot of land acquired with his savings.

loans.use: to buy a tarp

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Aniceta requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Aniceta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Asunción se unieron con el propósito D. obtener mayores beneficios para su familia por medio del trabajo en conjunto D. las mismas. Actualmente ellas se encuentran en el décimo ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y por sobre todo muy comprometidas.
La Miryam es una D. las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta D. muebles. Este negocio la ayuda con la manutención D. la casa, como así también D. los otros gastos que surgen día a día. Comenta que tiene buenas ventas ya que sus muebles son D. muy buena calidad. Desea poder seguir con el negocio y D. esa forma seguir manteniendo a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. algunos muebles para abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Seventeen women from the city of Asunción joined together with the aim of obtaining more money for their families by working together.  They are currently in their tenth loan cycle as part of the 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) program run by Fundación Paraguaya.  They are very hard-working, tenacious and, above all, very committed.

Miryam is one of the members of this group.  Her business is selling furniture.  This business helps her to support her household and to cover other expenses that come up on a day-to-day basis.  She tells us that she makes good sales as the furniture she sells is very good quality.  She would like to be able to continue in her business and thereby continue supporting her family.

Miryam is requesting this loan to buy some pieces of furniture with which to stock her business.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving her as this loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 38 years old and married with seven children.

Ligaya works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell for her sari-sari store.

Ligaya has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling chicken and fish.

Ligaya aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional item to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Minh City. Her husband works for an electricity company.  In 2008, Chi opened a beauty shop in her house to serve people in her community. Her business has gone well and helps her to cover family expenses as well as the education fees of her children. 

Chi is requesting a loan to buy good quality cosmetic and beauty products to attract new customers and better meet her existing customers' needs. She hopes that her loan will increase her income and help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and beauty products

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with two children and only one child goes to school. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She operates a retail shop at the market. She also bakes chapatti as her other source of income. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.  She works seven days a week .She has requested for a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her shop into a supermarket. Her major business challenges are seasonality, off and on electricity and transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, rice, maize flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Gina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: 02.01.04 Đông Hải -Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên has a service business carrying sand. She is requesting a loan to purchase gas to run a boat to carry sand for community.

Liên is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hóa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the group leader of the 02.01.04 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase gas to run a boat to carry sand on the river for community

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 49 years old. She is a member of An Tap cluster. She has three children. Not only does she grow rice, she also grows sprouted beans to sell in the market. She has had this job for two years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time, she borrowed VND 8,288,000 and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 9,184,000 to buy beans.

loans.use: to buy beans.

loans.name: Dolores Patricia

texts.es:
Dolores, nuevamente se ha decidido a obtener un nuevo préstamo para su negocio ya que quiere comprar más mercadería para ropa, ya que  le ayudado mucho a mantener a su familia por los créditos que adquirido y comprar la mercadería necesaria para tener más variedad como faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Ella se siente contenta por los créditos anteriores y le ha ayudado a mejorar su negocio y sobre todo su familia vive en buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores has decided to take out a loan again for her business. She wants to buy more merchandise, such as clothing. The loans she has had  have really helped her support her family, buying merchandise she needs to have more variety, such as skirts, blouses, pants, shorts and underwear. This helps her attend to her customers' needs.  

Ella se siente contenta por los créditos anteriores y le ha ayudado a mejorar su negocio y sobre todo su familia vive en buenas condiciones de vida.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 50 years old. She is married to Joseph. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling steel wool for the past eight years with a monthly income of 6,500 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Faith will use the loan to buy more steel wool for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  steel wool for her business.

loans.name: Betha De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Betha Originaria de la comunidad llamada las cuevas Esteli , de oficio comerciante, madre de dos niños. Nos cuenta despues de su primera experiencia vivida atraves del prestamo Kiva que fue muy positiva para ella, hizo una choza nueva en donde vende comida y pasteles hechos por las mujeres de su comunidad ya que ella promueve la participacion de ellas tanto en campo atraves de los huertos, elaboracion de rosquillas como en las chozas donde vende el alimento que producen. 
Ella requiere un segundo credito para comprar material de construccion tales como cemento ,arena ,pago de mano de obra para arreglar mas choza , hacer mejoras a su casa en invertir en mercaderia en general para vender.Por lo pronto piensa seguir incentivando el trabajo comunitario entre las mujeres de su comunidad sacar adelante a su negocio y priorizar la educacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha is from a community called Las Cuevas, Estelí.  She’s a merchant and the mother of two children.  She tells us that after her initial experience with Kiva loans which was very positive for her she built a new hut where she sells food and cakes made by women in her community since she promotes their participation both in farming and in making ‘rosquillas’ [traditional pastry] to sell in the huts where the food they make is sold.

She needs a second loan to buy building materials like cement and sand and to pay labor costs to fix up the hut more and to make some home improvements and also to invest in general merchandise to sell.  For the moment, she plans to continue to encourage communal work among the women in her community to move their business forward and to prioritize the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Los Trabajadores De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
ROSA ALEJANDRINA, tiene 65 años de edad, tiene dos hijos ya adultos que viene a ser en la actualidad su apoyo. Rosa Alejandrina forma parte del grupo "Los Trabajadores de Juan Pablo" formado por siete socios.
Desde hace tres años Rosa Alejandrina se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, ofrece menú donde sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de una obra de construcción, donde ella lleva o les hace llegar el almuerzo a los trabajadores. Los fines de semana aparte de ofrecer menú ofrece a su clientela tamales, los cuales tienen mayor acogida en horas de la mañana para servirlos en el desayuno.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los alimentos, del menú que ofrece a la venta.
texts.en:
ROSA ALEJANDRINA is 65 years old, and has 2 adult children who have now become her support. Rosa Alejandrina is part of the "Los Trabajadores de Juan Pablo" group made up of six members.

For three years, Rosa Alejandrina has worked making and selling food. She has a set menu that she offers and her primary customers are construction workers at the worksite where she brings or has someone bring the lunch to the workers. On the weekends, apart from offering a set menu, she offers tamales, which are most sought after in the morning to serve them with breakfast.

The received loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies to make the food on the menu she offers for sale.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Sedjroadjagbo Group

texts.fr: SEDJROADJAGBO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houéfa Justine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34  ans. Houéfa Justine a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Houéfa Justine est mariée à un certain Cyprien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Houéfa Justine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Houéfa Justine vend de l'huile végétale, du sodabi (boisson locale) et du gari (farine de manioc) depuis trois ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Houéfa Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Houéfa Justine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SEDJROADJAGBO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de l'huile végétale, du sodabi et du gari.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 71 years old, married five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresa has an oyster culture business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase binder, fishing net and other materials needed for her oyster culture.

Teresa has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase binder, fishing net and other materials needed for her oyster culture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify her business

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa lives in the Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with one child. Issa sells used clothes and shoes at Tandika market. The market is well known and famous for selling used clothes.

Issa thanks all the lenders of his first loan with Kiva. With the loan he was able to add shoes in line with clothing sales. Shoe sales have helped him earn more income.

Issa is now requesting a second with Kiva. With this loan he is planning to add a stock of used clothes and shoes. He is expecting higher sales in this coming Easter season. Issa requests a loan of USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Bilkis

texts.en:
Bilkis B. of 30 years old (ID-1000 – G), wife of Khorsed Alam, is a member of Janani Mohila Somity. Being a member of this group/somity she much more aware of herself position in the family. She wishes if she can contribute financially to the income of her husband. She also obtains different training like cow rearing, goat rearing, poultry and livestock. She purchases a milking cow of high breed and rears it one home base. She gets 4 liters of milk daily. She sells it locally @ Tk. 30 = US $ 0.44 per liter so her income is US$ 1.76

Now she is glad that she is able to contribute financially to her husband’s income. Her husband is also happy. She is interested to buy another cow of high breed quality. For this purpose she is in need of US $ 900.

loans.use: Purchases of Cow

loans.name: Yaa Marie

texts.en: Yaa Marie K. is twenty years old with two children. Uneducated, her husband works as a self-employed electrician whose income depends on when he is contracted by local businessmen and households to do wiring in their houses and vehicles. To supplement her husband’s income, Yaa Marie runs a small shop selling utensils in the town of Magburaka, Sierra Leone. She does this in addition to selling vegetables during the harvest seasons. Her goal is to expand her current business and use the profit to better educate her children. She is therefore requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: Yaa Marie would like to increase her stock of utensils and kitchenware for her small stand.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
To earn a living, Iknit woolen caps and my husband makes plastic reels used to wind threads. The income from these ventures is just enough to send our children to school and meet the cost of living.

Winter is right around the corner, hence, I would like to take a loan of $175 USD to buy greater amounts of raw materials. These materials will allow me to make woolen caps in sufficient quantity. With this loan and ability to produce more, our income will increase and we will be able to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy wool required in making sweaters

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith belongs to the Community Bank "Las Saposoínas". She lives in the San Martón region, in the Huallaga province and the Saposoa district. Her business is located in Avenida Loreto No. 425. She sells a variety of prepared foods.

Thanks to her effort and the good service she gives to her clients she is succeeding in her goal of increasing her sales. She now sells ceviche (a typical Peruvian seafood dish), groceries and vegetables. She also now owns her own premises; she used to sell her products in a rented stall in the market.

With this loan of S/2000 (Peruvian sols, equialent to $666) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 6 months, Judith will buy a glass case in which to display her food, mirrors for her restaurant, dishware (dozens of plates, glasses and coffee cups, along with silverware and cooking utensils), as well as wholesale quantities of shellfish and fish, and raw ingredients for the prepartion of her products. With these purchases she will be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Judith is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. She works daily, demonstrating in this way that she is an enterprising, goal-oriented woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Saposoínas, vive en la región San Martín, provincia el Huallaga y distrito de Saposoa, su negocio está ubicado en Av. Loreto No. 425, y se dedica a la venta de la comida variada.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y al buen trato que da a los clientes está logrando aumentar sus ventas, ahora también vende cebiche (comida típica), abarrotes y verduras, por otro lado ahora tiene su local propio ya que antes vendía en un puesto alquilado en el mercado.

Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.2,000.00. ($ 666.00),el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una vitrina de vidrio para exhibir sus comidas, espejos para su local, vajillas (docenas de platos, vasos, tasas y cubiertos y utensilios de cocina) además pescados y mariscos al por mayor e insumos para la preparación de los alimentos y así poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.

La señora Judith tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, trabaja diariamente demostrando así ser una mujer emprendedora y con metas.

loans.use: Purchase of a glass display case. Wholesale purchase of raw materials.  Purchase of dishware.

loans.name: Jazmina

texts.es:
Jazmina lives in the Hialeah district of Managua where she owns a small grocery store that she runs herself. She is 40 years old and needs to buy more products for sales because at this time of year it is important to have variety of inventory so that she can offer more to her customers. This will be important in the future so that she and her family can get out of poverty and she can establish her business as a prosperous one with commercial stability.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jazmina vive en el barrio Hialeah de Managua en donde tiene un pequeña pulpería administrada por ella misma. Tiene 40 años y requiere comprar más productos para su venta, ya que en esta época del año es cuando más necesidad de variedad de inventario necesita en su negocio, y así poder contar con una mejor oferta para sus clientes que en un futuro será clave para que ella y su familia puedan ir saliendo de la pobreza y establecerse como un negocio próspero y con estabilidad comercial.

loans.use: To purchase food products for her grocery store

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
From a very young age, Aydee learnt to work and to develop her skills in the fruit-selling business as best as she could. Now married with three children, she has not stopped her continued dedication to her work buying and selling fruits, as well as teaching her children the responsibilities of the job and the tricks of the trade. The children of Aydee undoubtedly have new perspectives concerning their personal development and want to secure a profession in order to help their dear mother.

For this reason she is asking for a loan in order to increase production and marketing with the aim of realising her children’s dreams. We are counting on your help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Aydee, desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar y a desenvolverse adecuadamente en el negocio de la venta de frutas y es lo que mejor puede hacer. Ahora casada y con tres hijos, no deja de seguir dedicándose a su trabajo de compra y venta de frutas y enseña a sus hijos los gajes de este oficio y el manejo de toda esta comercialización.Sin duda los hijos de Aydee tienen nuevas perspectivas para su desarrollo como personas y desean alcanzar una profesión y ayudar a su querida madre.

Por esa razón solicita un préstamo para aumentar su producción y comercialización con el fin concretar los sueños de sus hijos, contamos con vuestra ayuda

.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve sales

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en: Z. Marifat lives in the Khujand. She is 48 years old and has been in business for 10 years. Mrs. Z. sells an assortment of clothing for children and men. She is a serious business woman with a stable income that has allowed her to repay her previous loans on time. Now Mrs. Z. requests a loan of 3100 TJS ($900USD) for importing new goods and expanding the assortment of clothing she offers.

loans.use: Expand selection and import new goods

loans.name: Leonto Leonel

texts.es:
Leonto R. is described as a hard-working gentlemen who has for quite a while dedicated himself to agriculture in his home town of the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León.

Mr. R. and his family are currently in need of assistance: since they live in an area where there is no conventional electricity, they have requested the installation of a solar panel to help out with household chores and the children's studies. That's why they're turning to Ceprodel to earn credits that will permit them to get out of the debt they acquired with the panel; that way he can provide his family with better conditions in life so that his children can study in the afternoon and evenings, become great professionals, and make their dear father's dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Leonto R. se caracteriza por ser un caballero muy trabajador que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al negocio de la agricultura en su local de habitación en la ciudad de León específicamente en el municipio de El Sauce.

Una necesidad por la que transcurre el señor R. y su familia es que a pesar que viven en un local donde no se cuenta con energía eléctrica han solicitado que le instalen un panel solar para apoyarse con los quehaceres del hogar y el estudio de sus hijos por tal razón acude a Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita salir de esta deuda que contrajo con la adquisición del panel y así poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida para que sus hijos puedan estudiar por las tardes y noches para llegar a ser grandes profesionales que es el sueño de su querido padre.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for their home.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is 34 years old and lives and works in the southern Lebanese town of Saida. He makes a living selling groceries and vegetables. Ziad has applied for his third loan from A. Majmoua, which he will use to buy new merchandise to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Sugiarti

texts.id:
Sugiarti lives with her family on Pulau Pinang Street in Denpasar, Bali. She has a land contract for 3,000,000 Rupiah per year for 1 acre of land. On the land she has built 9 rooms which she rents out for 130,000 Rupiah per month each. For her everyday work, Sugiarti has a shop called Warung Sembako which sells basic supplies to families like rice, cooking oil, flour and other items. ("Sembako" is a shortened version of the term "Sembilan Bahan Pokok" which means the "9 necessities of life" . These necessities consist of rice, sugar, fuel, salt, salted fish, cooking oil, coffee, eggs, and flour.) She also has a motorcycle which she uses to shop for additional inventory if her supplies run out. Sugiarti would like to receive this loan so she can further increase her business funding.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Sugiarti tinggal bersama keluarganya di Jl.Pulau Pinang Denpasar. Dia mengontrak tanah sebesar Rp.3.000.000 per tahun dengan luas 1 acre. Dari tanah ini dia membangun 9 kamar yang kemudian disewakan per bulannya sebesar Rp.130.000. Kegiatan sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual bahan-bahan pokok kebutuhan keluarga seperti beras, minyak goreng, tepung dan lain-lain. Sarana yang dipakai adalah sebuah sepeda motor, yang digunakan berbelanja jika dagangannya habis. Kali ini Sugiarti bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: to increase funding for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Donatilde

texts.es:
Donatilde sells basic foodstuff in her small general store for a living. She is 34 years of age and has 4 children. Nothing is impossible for Donatilde because she is an extremely active woman who is good-humored with her children and customers. Her partner, Mr. Teodulo, supports all of her decisions and lends a helping hand with the business. Donatilde is full of desire for success and self-improvement. She tries her best to do everything she can for her children, who will grow up to be decent men and women in the future. Aside from her general store, she also looks after children for a living. She has been designated as a mother caretaker for wawa wasi (a daycare center for the children of low-income, working mothers). She needs capital in order to expand her general store. She would also like to improve her house’s condition so that she can take better care of the children, thus obtaining her goals little by little. She turns to you for a loan, promising to repay it in a timely manner and with a grateful heart.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Donatilde se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su pequeña bodega, ella tiene 34 años y 4 hijos. Para Donatilde no existe nada imposible ya que es una mujer súper activa y sobre todo jovial con sus hijos y clientes. Su pareja, el señor Teodulo, la apoya en todas sus decisiones y brinda su ayuda dándole la mano en su negocio. Donatilde es una mujer con ganas de superación y deseos de éxito, ella se esmera en todo por sus hijos quienes serán hombres y mujeres de bien en un futuro. Muy aparte de su bodega, se dedica al cuidado de niños, designada coma madre cuidadora de wawa wasi (guardería para los niños de las mamás trabajadoras de escasos recursos) Para ampliar e implementar su bodega requiere de un capital que la ayude, también desea mejorar los ambientes de su vivienda para la atención a sus niños y así poco a poco ir cumpliendo sus metas de superación. Ella recurre a ustedes para que le brinden el préstamo que solicita con la promesa de un pago en la fecha indicada y un corazón agradecido.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store and improve the conditions of her home, which is used as a daycare center

loans.name: Lightness

texts.en:
Lightness is 27 years old. She is married with two children, ages five and one. She's owned a small general store since 2006. She works at her business from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Lightness now hopes for a loan to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Dioum

texts.fr: M. Dioum est née le 03 mars 1955 à bambey.Elle vit au quartier DVF avec sa famille et s'active dans le commerce de chaussures depuis six ans.Ce pret lui permet de mieux préparer la fétes de Korité et la Rentrée des Classes.
texts.en:
Dioum M. was born on March 3, 1955 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF district with her family. She has been in the business of selling shoes for six years. This loan will allow her to be better prepared for the Ramadan Holiday and the start of the school year.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. Yoem K. lives in Trapaing Chrey village in Kandal Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She and her husband, Mr. Chheng Chhoern, are farmers. They are now facing a problem because their field is infertile and they do not have enough money to buy seed rice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yoem K. decided to ask for a loan to buy seed rice and fertilizer to make her crop more productive. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children; one is a construction worker, another one attends the local school, and the other two children are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy seed rice and fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai N. was born in 1954 and she lives in Krodas Kor Village in Kampong Cham Province. Hai has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a translator and the youngest one is attending the local school. She is a farmer who has 2 hectares to cultivate rice to earn her living. In this plantation, she now has an obstacle because of infertile soil. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sein Sim, helps her on the plantation, and he is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Hai would like to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
Maria, tiene 40 años  está acompañada con  el señor   Pablo Riveros que trabaja como seguridad privada y es  madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres aun son criaturas y dependen de sus padres y uno que es mayor de edad y trabaja de forma independiente. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como ser ropas y zapatos, remeras, blusas, jeans, pantalones, championes, sandalias entre otros.

Maria se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de dos años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa, dónde para esto, realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial.

Maria, con sus ganancias de las ventas aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su compañero hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Maria, comenta que tiene muy buena  venta. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de ropas de la temporada primavera - verano, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde sale a hacer su venta.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and is partnered with Pablo Riveros who works as a private security guard. She has four children, of whom three are still young and dependent on their parents and one who is an adult and is working. She sells a variety of merchandise such as clothing and shoes, shirts, blouses, jeans, pants, slippers, sandals among others. Maria has been in this business for more than two years and she sells out of her home, to which she had to make modifications in order to be able to have the space she needed for her commercial enterprise. Maria contributes to household income with the revenues for her sales, and together with her partner she shares the household expenses. Maria tells us that sales are good. Because of this, she wants to acquire more Spring and Summer clothing so that she will be ready for the strong demand from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for ladies, men, and children

loans.name: Fozila

texts.en:
Fozila is an enterprising woman with a great desire to improve the quality of life for her family. She is married and the mother of two children. Fozila has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's shop. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own shop at her home and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today, Fozila is applying for her fourth loan through IMON International. She is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (US $1150) for the term of 12 months for purchasing new, modern fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Fozila and her children are grateful for your generosity and support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing the national dress

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Dụng năm nay 41 tuổi,  Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại huyện Quảng Xương - Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại hàng tháng nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị  là từ việc chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu và lương thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phụcvụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Dụng is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two children đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Quảng Xương district in Thanh Hóa province. Mrs. Lê has been participating in TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, the main source of her family's monthly income is from rearing livestock, weaving mats, and her husband's construction worker salary - totally 2,500,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND to invest in purchasing more raw materials for their mat weaving business to improve the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw Materials for Weaving Mats

loans.name: Dolnad

texts.en: Dolnard  K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and business man . He runs a food shop in Lumo ward of Dar es Salaam. Shop businesses are very common in Tanzania. He is married with three children. He sells a variety of items to customers, including serial crop products such as beans, groundnuts, wheat flower, maize flower and cashew nuts. He has been in this business for six years, Income generated from his food shop is used to meet daily family expanses including paying school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more items for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beans, groundnuts, wheat flower, maize flower and cashew nuts to resell

loans.name: Otaboy

texts.en:
Otaboy O. is a 51 year old farmer who lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is very experienced in his business as he has been farming since 1994. He is married with two children. His elder elder son and wife help him with the business. Unfortunately, Otaboy's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of $2500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants to use on his wheat and potato crop.

Otaboy hopes the loan will allow him to increase his rice yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university, get good jobs, and be an important part of the wellbeing of this humble family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра - молодая женщина 26 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока. Муж - пастух. Пасет свой скот в горах. Сайёра откармливает скот и доит молоко. Часть молока они используют для своей семьи, а часть она продает, перерабатывая молоко на кефир, каймак и творог. Её потребители - это соседи. Иногда она сдает, тем, кто приезжает в город, чтобы они продали ее молочные изделия. Этим она зарабатывает деньги, хотя и небольшие. Она хочет взять кредит для покупки еще одной дойной коровы, чтобы расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sayora is a young woman of 26. She is married and the mother of two children. She raises cattle and sells dairy products. Her husband is a herder, and grazes the cattle in the hills, while Sayora feeds and milks the cattle. She uses part of the milk for her own family, and sells the rest in the form of kefir (a yogurt-like fermented dairy drink), kaymak (similar to clotted cream) and tvorog (curd cheese). Her customers are her neighbors. Sometimes she has someone take her dairy products to town to sell. Sayora earns money in this fashion, although not a lot. She wants to take out a loan to purchase another milk cow in order to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of dairy products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, Lebanon. Ali owns a barber shop and requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his shop; like scissors, hairdryer, etc.. This is the first time Ali has requested a loan.

Ali knows how to treat his clients and is always aware of the new collection. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $70. She works at her business for eight hours a day. Aisha is 38 years old, married, and has two children: ages 15 and 12.

Aisha is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use. She belongs to Hatuyumbishwi Group loan (Group code 2025).

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89366&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Ana tiene su  continua con su tienda de venta ropa para dama y caballeros.
Lo que le gusta Ana del bancomunal es el compañerismo y que ha aprendido muchas cosas para su negoció.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de ropa , para su tienda.
El sueño de ana es tener una tienda propia, la que tiene es alquilada.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89366&_tpos=... Ana continues to have her store selling women’s and men’s clothing. What Ana likes about her community bank is the companionship. She also likes that she has learned many things for her business. Ana needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy clothes for her store. Ana’s dream is to have her own store. The one she has now is rented.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes for her store

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita G. lives with her husband and two daughters. Her older daughter is studying in Grade 4 and her younger daughter is studying in pre-primary school. Sunita lives in Thecho and has a vegetable shop in Kalimati bazaar, to which she travels 40 minutes every day. She sells different types of vegetable such as potatoes, onions, cauliflowers, greens vegetables, and so on. She set up her shop to improve her family's standard of living.

Sunita is asking for a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy more varieties of vegetables for her shop. Nowadays in Nepal the cost of all vegetables is increasing due to the late monsoon. So now is the right season for Sunita to invest more money in buying large quantities of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Eliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Puerta”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su impulso y empeño de ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia. En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es ella misma quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Elianita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con mucha fuerza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad de salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Eliana belongs to the community bank "Virgen de la Puerta," in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martin department, in Peru. She is married, 37 years old, and is the mother of three children, all of whom depend on her and are studying.

She was motivated to open her own business by her determination to see her children become professionals. She sells groceries from her own home, a site that is well-equipped for receiving customers.

The profit that she earns contributes to her family's income. She is well-liked by her regular customers who come to her shop every day to buy things, because she has the products that a housewife needs, and she shares her attention and charisma with them.

With this loan of PEN 2,500, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of beans, boxes of milk and preserved fish in a variety of brands, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene items to continue serving her customers.

Elianita, as she is called affectionately, strongly wishes to continue working hard. Day after day, she gives thanks for the great opportunity to move forward as a woman. She also thanks the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist movement) for helping her to become a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, in order to increase and stock up her products

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
MRS. ELNA P. is 43 years old, married with 3 children and a resident of Purok Paglaum, Brgy Atipuluhan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 12 years ago, she learned that poverty is not a hindrance to success and she lived by these words - she strived harder in order to improve her family's quality of life.

She started by selling a variety of delicacies and later ventured into pig fattening to supplement her income. Now on her 14th loan cycle, Elna is borrowing PHP 15,000.00 to buy more piglets to raise and sell.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL FOR HER HOG RAISING VENTURE

loans.name: Mensah Ahouaga

texts.fr: Cet homme a appris comme métier l’imprimerie. Ceci lui a permis de mettre sur place depuis 1993 dans son quartier TOGO 2000 à Lomé son atelier d’imprimerie. Il est marié et cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses 02 enfants. Il a besoin actuellement d’acheter des papiers rames ; pour cette raison il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 cartons de papier rames. Les grandes entreprises et sociétés de Lomé constituent sa clientèle.
texts.en:
This is a man who learned the trading of printing.  This enabled him to establish his print shop in 1993 in his district of TOGO 2000 in Lomé.  He is married, and this business allows him to provide for his two children.  He currently needs to buy reams of paper;  for this reason, he's requesting a WAGES loan, so as to buy 20 boxes of paper in reams.  The major enterprises and companies of Lomé constitute his customer base. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy printing paper

loans.name: Suititi

texts.en:
Suititi T. is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Maagiagi. She is married and has seven adult children. Suititi owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting decorative plants for sale. Suititi has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

Suititi joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Suititi has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Suititi is now requesting a loan of 1200 WST which will be used for the same purpose. The loan will be her third loan from SPBD. Suititi plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en:
Jamileh has been working at sewing since 1991. She is a 73-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Jamileh knows how to treat her clients and has a lot of experience. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Jamileh decided on this business because of her experience. 

Jamileh requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread and repair her sewing machine. Jamileh has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase thread and repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Beatrice Nekesa

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and is operating a retail business at Seregeya centre. Her kiosk's name is World Turning. 

Beatrice was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan she is receiving from KADET, she intends to add more stock to her kiosk. In the future she intends to grow her retail business and buy a plot of land.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more stock to her shop.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with a 10-year-old son. She is an entrepreneur from Zhidachev where she sells cosmetics and fancy goods in the local market. She has been in this business for 9 years. One of the main attractions of her business is the variety of items Nataliya offers for sale. Presently she makes about 25,000 UAH in gross income while her net profit amounts to 5,000 UAH.

Nataliya is requesting a loan of 9,750 UAH to increase her assortment of merchandise. She would like to use additional financial assistance to grow her business even further. Nataliya loves what she is doing and looks forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business provides to sustain her family. We believe Nataliya's natural optimism and determination along with her responsibility and serious business approach will help her make all her dreams come true.

loans.use: To re-stock her merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are all living in Prek Reang village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Ol S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They will all use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Ol S. is a farmer and he also raises pigs. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy some more piglets to raise. He would use the rest of money to buy some chickens to raise. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family’s standard of living with this loan.

Mr. Ol S. is 44 years old and the father of seven children, five of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Sruoy Et, is a housewife.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and some chickens to raise

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba K. is 37 years old, married and has two children. She is a teacher in a local school. Considering the low wages teachers earn, Nasiba started her own business of processing and selling apricots nine years ago. Dried fruit, especially dried apricots, are very popular in Tajikistan and are good for one’s health as well. Considering the constant demand for these dried fruits, Nasiba’s apricot business is quite successful and has resulted in a significant and stable income benefitting her household and the education of her dear children.

Today Nasiba is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. She is going to use the loan to purchase more apricots with the purpose of expanding the range of apricot products she sells. Nasiba expresses her gratitude to everyone who supports her. Help this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture and new Western cultures and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional apricots for her business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. sells used clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to buy clothes in bulk to sell.  Sabina is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 2 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Lolo sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames au quartier Babemba  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursé. 
Elles font la vente  du   bois de chauffe, de savons, des pagnes wax, des condiments alimentaires etc.   
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, un chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 38 cartons de savons, 15 pièces de pagnes wax  et 6 paquets de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de Médine, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers et à domicile, au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Lolo group are mainly married women with an average age of 39 and an average of four children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in the Babemba neighborhood of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their clientèle. They are now on their fifth group loan. All their previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid. These women sell firewood, soap, 'wax pagnes' (colorful West African cloth), food condiments etc. With their new loan, they intend to buy a truckload of firewood, 38 cases of soap, 15 bolts of 'wax pagne' and six packets of food condiments. They stock up at the Sikasso market and in neighboring villages. They sell their goods at Médine market, walking around various neighborhoods, and from home. They accept cash, and often credit, from a clientèle of both men and women. Each of them expects to make an average monthly income of 32,500 FCFA, one part of which will be used for savings and for family needs, and the other part will be invested in their business activities.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted items

loans.name: Aidee Margarita

texts.es:
Aidee es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Aidee es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Aidee tiene una chicharroneria llamada El Sabroso, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Aidee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, carne y manteles.
Los sueños de Aidee son tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Aidee is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She 42 years old and is married with three children. Aidee operates a “chicharroneria,” a restaurant specializing in “chicharrón,” fried pork rinds. The restaurant is called “El Sabroso” and is located in the city center. It is open every day. Aidee requires a loan of 2000 soles to invest in soft drinks, meat, and tablecloths. Her dreams are to have her own house, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, meat, and tablecloths for restaurant.

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La señora C. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, ella va a utilizar el crédito para surtir su negocio.
Ella quiere comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, 1000 rajas de leña, golosinas, etc. Su negocio comenzó cuando muy joven vivía en Masaya y tenía una tienda de ropa,  después vendió su casa en Masaya y se vino a vivir al viejo donde puso la pulpería que es ahora la que le da su alimentación diaria. 
Doña Meris es una señora de 63 Años, acompañada no tiene hijos, solo vive con su marido.
Este es el crédito No. 23 que tiene con CEPRODEL los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma y ella dijo que sus créditos con CEPRODEL le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Señora C. has a grocery store in her home; she will use this loan to stock her store. She needs to buy rice, beans, sugar, 1000 pieces of firewood, sweets, etc. Her business started when she was young living in Masaya and she had a clothing shop. Later she sold her house in Masaya and came to live in El Viejo where she put the shop that now provides her daily bread. Doña Meris is a lady of 63, without children, living only with her husband. This is Loan #23 that she has through CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid in good time with no problems, and she says that her loans through CEPRODEL have helped her to increase her business and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana, a 25-year-old married woman and mother of one child, has been working in home-based clothing sales since 2004, receiving clients at her home where she presents the clothes. With her business income, she is able to cooperate with her husband in the household and to satisfy her child's needs.

Since she always tries to offer new clothes and collections to her clients, Diana is requesting a loan of $1,200 to expand her inventory for the new season and present a larger choice of clothes to her clients.

loans.use: To expand her inventory for the new season

loans.name: Mrs. Chheng Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan, all of whom are villagers in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chheng K. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Chheng K. is a mother of four children, two of whom are construction laborers while the others attend a local public school. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land to grow rice and crops to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Chory, is a construction worker. On her the farm, Mrs. Chheng K. has some problems because her field is infertile and is also far from an irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve her rice production, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. With the rest of the loan, she wants to hire farmers to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to hire someone to plow her field

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. María Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos todos independientes.
María Elena, es una mujer trabajadora, que se siente capaz D. cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró, Cajas en leche, conservas D. pescado y otros.  Así empezó su negocio con lo poco que tenia y poco a poco fue ahorrando y ahora cuenta con una tienda granD., cuenta con clientela fija, amigos del barrio, vecinos y otros. 
Con este préstamo D. S/1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara más productos para surtir su negocio cómo, aceites en litros, fideos en paquetes, leche,  galletas dulces y saladas en cajas, bebidas como gaseosas y agua mineral en paquetes.
María Elena, esta orgullosa por su trabajo que realiza día a día  manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
María Elena, 46, is a member of the "Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) communal bank, which is located in Tarapoto, San Martín province and department. She's married and has three children, all of whom are independent. María Elena is a hard-working woman who feels capable of reaching her goals and dreams. Several years ago she began selling groceries. She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to buy such items as: boxes of milk and fish preserves, among others. This is how she started off, with few items but, as she gradually saved up, her store grew. Now, she has a large store, a fixed base of regular customers, who are her neighborhood friends, neighbors and others. She will use this, 1500 new sol, loan to buy more stock items for her store; like: liters of cooking oil, packages of pasta, milk, boxes of cookies and crackers, packages of soft-drinks and mineral water. María Elena is proud of the work she does every day and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for making it possible for her to grow both as a woman and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Joy is single. Joy owns & operates a food production/sales business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Joy is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Máximo Javier

texts.es:
Es el crédito numero catorce que obtiene el señor U. en CEPRODEL, teniendo un buen historial crediticio,  limpio de mora se dedica  a la ganadería y la agricultura tiene 20 años  experiencia.
 El señor U. es casado jefe de familia, tiene dos hijos los cuales ha sustentado con esta actividad.
texts.en:
Es el crédito numero catorce que obtiene el señor U. en CEPRODEL, teniendo un buen historial crediticio, limpio de mora se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura tiene 20 años experiencia. El señor U. es casado jefe de familia, tiene dos hijos los cuales ha sustentado con esta actividad.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de ganado

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Even before Agripina J. became a member of ASHI in 2008, she realized that she needed to have her own small business despite her age (73 years old) so that she could help her six children support her many grandchildren. With this goal in mind, she established a small “sari-sari” (or variety) store in which she sells various types of food, beverages, and other basic commodities. She also has able to buy a piglet which she will raise and sell in four months. These businesses are possible because of Agripina’s membership in ASHI and the help she has been receiving. Her husband’s small pension would not have allowed her to help her family, but the small revenue her businesses makes allows her to provide this support.

Agripina is happy to provide this help, gets a good deal of satisfaction from managing her own store, and hopes to increase the number of items she has to sell so that she can gain more costumers and more revenues. To reach this goal, she has applied to ASHI for a new loan to grown her business and and help it bring greater happiness to the entire family.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: Don José es un hombre de negocio, tiene la edad de 43 años, casado y con dos hermosos hijos estudiantes, su negocio lo administra desde hace cuatro años, pues día a día sale al campo a vender sus producto el cual comenzó solo con venta de productos plásticos, con poco dinero, ahora ha invertido en electrodoméstico, ropa, productos plástico en mayor cantidad, lo cual vende al contado y al crédito, con el financiamiento logro la inversión a mayores productos y mayor captación de clientes lo que se siente sastifecho por que ha logrado mejores beneficios al mejorar su casa. Su esposa lo apoya con las ventas en su casa, con este préstamo comprara electrodoméstico como: plancha, abanico, licuadora, dvd, sillas plásticas, pana, entre otros ya que para estos días festivos del día de la madre aumentan las ventas lo que espera lograr vender a mayor cantidad y reponerse ya que las ventas han estado bajas. Debido ala economía del país.
texts.en:
José, 43, is married and has two beautiful children who are in school. He has had his business for four years; he goes out daily to sell. At first, all he merchandised was plastic items and had little money to invest. Now, he has invested in home appliances, clothing and larger amounts of plastic items that he sells both for cash and on credit. Financing allowed him to invest in larger quantities of merchandise and to acquire more customers which make him very satisfied because he has attained better benefits to improve his home. His wife supports him with his home-based sales. He will use this financing to buy home appliances like: iron, fan, blender, DVD, plastic chairs, corduroy, among others whose sales increase for Mother’s Day. He hopes to sell more and recover from the diminished sales lately caused by the country’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances: fan, blender, iron, dvd, etc.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um V. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Um V. has been married for years and has eight children. Two of her children are married and six are single. Most of her children are working at different jobs. In addition, her husband is skilled at making furniture by hand. He turns the wood into furniture and sells the furniture to people who need it to decorate their houses. Um V. sees that her husband’s business is profitable, and she hopes to sustain it by accumulating a larger quantity of essential accessories using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To accumulate more essential accessories

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita M. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Tita is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Tita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Tita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El señor Richard es casado vive con su esposa e hija en casa de sus suegros en la zona Alto Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Richard es policía, trabaja en la policía boliviana; su esposa es ama de casa y con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una computadora portátil y mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Richard is married and lives with his wife and daughter in their in-laws' house in the Alto Obispo Bosque zone of La Paz city. Richard is a police officer in the Bolivian police force and his wife is a homemaker. With his salary, Richard is able to maintain his home and family. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a laptop for work. This is the 2nd loan he has requested and a socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Doña Maria es madre de tres hijos, casada, desde joven a prendió a trabajar en las ventas junto con su mama.
Hace varios años vende en su propio cafetín y venta de variedades que inicio con el objetivo de poder apoyar  a su familia, y ahorrar para hacer su casa.
Con los años ah adquirido clientela y ah aumentado sus ventas a través de estos financiamientos.
También con ayuda de su esposo han logrado hacer su casa toda de concreto, educación  a sus hijos y lo necesario ya que todo esta caro, y la demanda es mucha en los mercado lo que para ella es de gran necesidad poder tener los productos que se venden mas para lograr ventas altas.
Con este préstamo comprara: un termo grande para lograr aumentar su venta de gaseosas y frescos, comprar más cajillas de coca cola, golosinas asi como variedades de cola, prensapelos, trabas, pulseras, anillos, de fantasía que se vende mucho a los adolescentes. 
Que a través de estos financiamientos esta logrando el objetivo de aumentar su inversión para tener mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Maria is married and the mother of three children. Since she was a girl, she learned to work in sales together with her mother. For the past few years, she has operated her own small café and has also sold variety goods. She started this work with the aim of helping her family and saving up to build a house. Over the years, she has attracted a customer base and has increased her sales with the help of loans. Also, with her husband's help, she has been able to build a house made of concrete, pay for children's education, and provide them with what they need, since everything is expensive. Since demand is high on the market, it is necessary for her to keep the most popular products in stock in order to achieve high sales volumes. With this loan, she will buy a large cooler so she can increase her sales of soft drinks and fresh foods; more cases of Coca-Cola; snacks and other varieties of soft drinks; and hair bands, hair clips and costume jewelry such as bracelets and rings that sell very well among adolescents. This financing will help her achieve her goal of increasing her investment to gain greater benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a large cooler and merchandise such as soft drinks, hair accessories, etc. to expand her investment

loans.name: Nemesia
