texts.en:
Nemesia D. is from the town of Villa Rose Cabarroguis, Quirino. She is 38 years old. Nemesia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nemesia owns & operates a manufacturing business, making and selling charcoal. Nemesia has been involved in the charcoal business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nemesia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nemesia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Nemesia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the second loan taken out by Nemesia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is the wife of Z. I. and resides in Multan, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small house with two rooms where she has lived with her family for the past 10 years. She is 35 years old and works in a factory on a monthly wage. She is a very caring lady who manages her household chores before going to work. Shahnaz works to pay off the educational expenses of her five children. She has three sons and two daughters. Her elder son runs a food stall in the market selling samosas which are very famous among the people. The others are enrolled in a local school and are in 4th, 2nd and kindergarten respectively.

Her husband is involved in a dairy business. He has a buffalo at home from which he gets about 8-10 kgs of milk. He sells 1 kg of milk for 45 PKRs and earns on 10kg milk approximately 450 PKRs which helps him to cover the expenses of the family.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy another buffalo and increase the productivity of milk. She is hopeful that this investment will bring a positive change in her husband’s business and that he will be able to earn a good income and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
This is Eliza N., 31, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Richienel N., a businessman, and mother of five children, all of whom are enrolled in elementary school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to continue sending them to school and all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Eliza as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Eliza operates a buying and selling business and has a sideline retailing electronic cellular phone load. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of that sort. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Eliza dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Khorn Oum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn O., who was born in 1959, is the village bank president selected by its twelve members from Trapeang Kak village in Takeo province. They will each use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Khorn O. and her husband, Mr. Oeun Mut, are farmers who own a 2 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is the mother of a child who is a farmer. She also owns a general store in the village and her husband is a village chief. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Khorn O. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato P. is from the village of Natappian West, Solana, Cagayan. He is 50 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Renato owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling aluminum products such as windows to local businesses and community members. Renato has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Renato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renato is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Renato from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the business

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
En  Caapucu-Yere distante se formó mediante el deseo de las señoras  de integrar un comité está integrada por 17 señoras muy trabajadoras y activas, este Comité está en el cuarto ciclo con calificación excelente.
 Este grupo es muy unido y trabaja en forma conjunta ellas no presentan inconvenientes con el pago de sus cuotas ni en relacionamiento entre ellas.
Buscan un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida. Una de las integrantes es la señora Antonia quien se dedica a la venta Joyas.
Esta actividad lo realiza hace un buen  tiempo para aumentar los ingresos de su familia y de manera ayudarle a su marido.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de joyas de plata ya que de acerca la temporada de mucha compra por parte de la gente.
texts.en: In far Caapucu-Yere a group formed out of the desire of some women to integrate a committee; it's made up of 17 very hardworking and active women. This committee is on its fourth loan and has an excellent reputation. The group is very united and works together. They never have trouble making their payments or getting along with each other. They're looking for a little more support to fund their family expenses and improve their quality of life. One of the members is Antonia, who sells jewelry. She's done this work for quite a while to supplement her family's income, and as a way to help her husband. She's requesting this loan for the purchase of silver jewelry because they shopping season is approaching.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “EL ARBOLITO”
La Sra. Carmen Rosa S. A., ejerce el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía, tiene 44 años vive en el AA.HH los Heraldos de Motupe, distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, dos independientes y un pequeño  de 5 añitos.
  La alcancía esta  formada por 10 entusiastas y forjadoras  socias, un grupo solidario muy unido y comprometido con los propósitos que tienen tanto a nivel grupal como familiar; ellos vienen trabajando con nosotros hace dos años y están  agradecidos por los logros obtenidos porque  vieron cada una de ellas sobresalir a sus familias y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
  Carmen se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado cercano a la casa donde vive, hace seis  años que viene realizando este negocio, pero  gracias a este trabajo y los apoyos que recibe de EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD al otórgale  los  créditos logró  darle  una mejor educación a sus hijos y  construir el segundo piso de su casa.
  La Sra. Mery sueña con tener su restaurante en su propia casa, equipado  y con todas las comodidades que pueda tener un restaurante;  por  eso como  toda madre luchadora y entusiasta ella no ven tan lejos este sueño, porque con el reciente préstamo adquirido lo utilizara para terminar con algunos acabados en su  casa  y así  poder empezar con el sueño que tanto anhela.
 Mery en la foto se encuentra de pie, viste un polo de color blanco, buzo de color azul.
texts.en:
“EL ARBOLITO” (THE LITTLE TREE) COMMUNAL BANK

Mrs. Carmen Rosa S. A. is the President of the communal bank.  She is 44 years old and lives in Los Heraldos de Motupe, San Juan de Lurigancho district.  She is married and has three children, two who are independent and a little 5-year-old.

The communal bank has 10 enthusiastic, pioneering members.  It is a much unified, mutually supportive, group that is committed both to the group and family goals they have set.  They have been collaborating with us for two years and are grateful for the accomplishments they have reached because each has seen her family stand out and have better living conditions.

Carmen sells food in a market near her home.  She has been in this business for six years.  Thanks to the work and financial help through loans from EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD she has managed to provide better education for her children and to build a second story on her house.

Mery dreams with having a restaurant in her home equipped with all the comforts a restaurant can have.  Because of this, like all fighting, enthusiastic mothers, she sees this dream within her reach because she will use the recently granted loan to complete some of the house’s finishing touches to start toward the dream she so desires.

In the photo, Mery is standing wearing a white polo shirt and blue tracksuit.

loans.use: To complete some of the finishing touches on her house in order to start working toward her dream of having her own restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilmer Jesus

texts.es:
Wilmer de 41 años, tiene una panadería en la parte delantera de su casa y vende los panes a $ 0.10. Vive con su esposa y tres hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.
  
Toda su familia se dedicaba a hacer panes y como el necesitaba un mejor ingreso hace 10 años el decidió comprar un horno para tener su propia panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja en la madrugada con su esposa haciendo la masa de los panes hasta que estén listos y los comienza a vender a las  07h00. Vende cada pan a $ 0.10 según sea su forma. 

El quiere comprar con el préstamo levaduras, harina, lácteos para su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener arreglada su casa y que sus 5 hijos de 14, 12, 6, 4, 2 años sean algún día profesionales.
texts.en:
Willmer is 41 years old and operates a bakery out of his home where he sells bread for $ 0.10.  He lives with his wife and three children in Guasmo, an urban area where the majority of the population is involved in retail business.
  
His entire family has always baked bread.  In an effort to increase his income, ten years ago he decided to buy an oven and set up his own bakery in the front part of his home.  Currently he and his wife work in the early morning hours preparing the dough.  By 7:00 a.m. they begin selling the bread, which comes in different shapes, at $0.10 a loaf.

He plans to use the loan to buy yeast, flour and dairy products for the bakery.  His aim is to improve his home and help his five children, ages 14, 12, 6, 4 and 2 to become trained professionals.

loans.use: Flour, dairy products, yeast

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony B. is from the town of Banga. He is 31 years old and married. To make a living, Anthony owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Anthony wants to have children so he works hard to have savings for the future.

Anthony joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Anthony has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El Senor Jose C., tiene 35 anos de edad, originario de La Concordia, Esteli, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a la siembra de Tomates; con mas de 15 anos de experiencia en el sector agricola.
Desde los 8 anos de edad ayuda a sus padres con las actividades agropecuarias, el se dedicaba a cuidar a los bueyes. Sus estudios llegaron hasta el 6to grado de secundaria, debido a la falta de recursos, pues sus padres no podian a veces ni facilitarle el pasaje para que pudiera ir a estudiar al Coyolito, que era la escuela mas cercana que tenia.
Se caso a la edad de 20 anos, por lo que de ahi en adelante se independizo, pero viviendo siempre con sus padres; con sus primeros ingresos, logro ir recogiendo dinero y poco a poco fue haciendo su casita.
Realizo este prestamo para la compra de insumos para sembrar Tomates, espera obtener buenas ganancias de esta produccion.
El desea que sus hijos se preparen y que tengan un mejor nivel de vida, es un sacrificio que el esta haciendo, para ofrecerles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Mr Jose C., age 35, is from La Concordia, Esteli. He is married, has 4 children, and sows tomatoes. He has over 15 years of experience in agriculture. At the age of eight he started helping his parents with agricultural work; he took care of the oxen. He studied until the sixth grade of secondary school, because of his family's lack of resources. His parents could not always fund his ticket to study in Coyolito, which was the closest school. He got married at the age of 20, and from then on was independent, but still living with his parents. With his first earnings, he was able to save money and he has been building his house bit by bit. He has taken out this loan for the purchase of tools to sow tomatoes. He hopes to make a good income from this harvest. He wants his children to be educated and to have a better quality of life. He is making a sacrifice to offer them a better future.

loans.use: the sowing of tomatoes

loans.name: Ana Valeska

texts.es:
Doña Valeska T. R. es Trabajadora en el Hospital de Mujeres Bertha Calderón En Managua, ya tiene 7 años de trabajar en esta empresa.

Ella es casada soltera con 1 hijos a cargo en edad escolar. Este es su tercer crédito en CEPRODEL, lo utilizará para compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda. Ella está Satisfecha con el servicio que le brinda CEPRODEL ya que estos créditos le permiten mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Valeska T. R. has been working in the Bertha Calderón  Women’s Hospital in Managua for the past 7 years.

She is single with one son who is a student.  This is her third loan with CEPRODEL, and she will use it to buy construction materials to improve her house.  Valeska is satisfied with the services that CEPRODEL offers since these loans have  given her the opportunity to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: Money to buy construction materials

loans.name: Roxana Maria

texts.es: Roxana Maria es una Madre de familia que tiene 26 años y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Se dedica desde hace más de 1 años a la venta de ropa, adicionalmente ofrece su mercadería en todos los mercados, pues no importan las distancias que tiene que recorrer, con tal de ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que ella no la pudo tener.  Desea ampliar su negocio para captar más clientes y así poder percibir más ingresos que le permitan salir adelante. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima en su negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana Maria is a 26 year old mother who lives with her husband and a young child in her care. For more than a year she has been selling clothes. In addition, Roxana offers her merchandise at all the markets no matter how far she has to travel. This allows her to provide her child with an education, an opportunity that she did not have.

Roxana wants to expand her business so that she can attract more customers and generate more income that will allow her to get ahead. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more inventory

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 49-year-old single man, living in Tayouneh, owner of a household products store since 1975. He likes his work a lot, and he enjoys choosing the new products he's going to sell in his shop. As Adnan states this business is joyful, because every day you can find something new, that's why he has to stay up to date. 

Adnan's clients like to come and shop from his place, because he knows how to attract clients. Although Adnan has a problem talking, many of his clients understand him quickly because they are used to talking to him and seeing him often. 

Adnan sells plates, silver gifts, spoons, kettles, cups and many other useful household products. Adnan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to increase his capital and to buy and register a motor cycle that's necessary for his business, since it eases transportation from/to wholesale shops. His previous loan helped a lot since he used it to buy special offers he got on special stocks, and he proved he was a good-standing borrower.

loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy and register a motorcycle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: N. is currently in the business of selling flour and tea. She is 25 years old,  married to a Sultan,  With   3 children and all them go to school. N. has borrowed a loan to stock more flour and tea. In the future, she hopes to buy cattle and build a place for her business with extra profits.

loans.use: To stock more flour and tea.

loans.name: Mónica Adela

texts.es:
Mónica Adela P. P. tiene 20 años, es soltera vive con la madre en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería y otros son comerciantes de carne.

Mónica se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta. 

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es tener éxito en su negocio.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Mónica Adela P. P. is 20 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She doesn't have any children.

The 'ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA' community bank is located in Ventanas canton.  The members meet in '24 de Mayo' neighborhood.  They work in commercial activities such as selling perfume, clothes and costume jewelry.  Others sell meat.

Mónica sells cosmetics such as Yambal cosmetics to order through catalogs.  She buys her products with a telephone call and sells them through her catalog door to door.

Mónica is requesting this loan so that she can acquire products through her catalog and have them in a store.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  The challenges she faces in her business are the competition and high prices.  Her dream is to be successful in her business.

Mónica enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to acquire products through a catalog

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es: Aura Estela tiene 51 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Inicio este negocio por que siempre le ha gustado trabajar, pues ella es una persona muy emprendedora. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, tratamientos, lápiz labial, sabanas y toallas. Ella se siente muy agradecida con este financiamiento que le ayudara a comprar los productos necesarios para su actividad. Le gusta este negocio a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias está en plena comunicación con las personas. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo económicamente.
texts.en:
Aura Estela is 51 years old and sells general merchandise.  She has one child in her care.

Aura Estela started her business because she has always enjoyed working and she is a very enterprising person.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy bags, footwear, treatments, lipsticks, sheets and towels.  She feels very grateful for this loan which will help her to buy the products she needs for her business.  Aura Estela likes her business because she earns good profits and gets to communicate with people.  The plan that she has is to continue growing financially.

loans.use: to buy bags, footwear, treatments, lipsticks, sheets and towels

loans.name: Ranel

texts.en:
Ranel A. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 31 years old. Ranel is married and has 1 adult children. To make a living, Ranel owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" services to local community members. Ranel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ranel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ranel is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ranel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.es

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa de su madre. Hace más de 10 años prepara platos típicos de su zona, entre ellos Lechón al horno, por lo que expende de manera ambulante en una de las calles principales de su ciudad. Desde entonces se dedica todo el día a esta actividad, y cuando se acaba, regresa a su casa para comprar todos los ingredientes y volver a hornear otro lechón. Por la calidad y higiene con que prepara su platillo  hace de que  sus ventas sean continuas, ya que su clientela confía en el platillo que ella ofrece. En adelante desea tener un local amplio donde pueda dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, significa bastante para ella el hecho de ser integrante de su banco comunal porque confía en las demás personas de su grupo y además porque aprende con ellos a trabajar adecuadamente sus ingresos por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en el aumento de capital para comprar más carne e ingredientes, con ello espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sabina is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in her mother's house.  She has been making traditional dishes from her area for more than 10 years.  These dishes include roasted suckling pig.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in one of the main streets in her city.  She works in her business all day and, when she finishes work, she returns home to buy all the ingredients she needs and to roast another suckling pig.  Sabina has continual sales due to the quality of her food and the hygiene which she employs in preparing it.  Her customers can have confidence in the dish that she offers.

In the future, Sabina would like to set up a large sales location where she can provide her customers with a better service.  This is her second loan from MFP.  Being a member of her community bank means quite a lot to her because she trusts the other members of her group and, with them, she learns how to make good use of her income.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  Sabina will use the loan she is requesting to increase her capital in order to buy more meat and ingredients which she hopes will allow her to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy more suckling pig and ingredients

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años, es soltero vive con la madre en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

José se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, trigo cebada y papas. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener más trabajo y seguir con el mejoramiento de ganado y agricultura.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old, single, and he lives with his mother in the canton of Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar. He does not have children.

The members of the communal bank "Grupo Nucanchi Kawsay" live in the community of El Rayo, district of Guanujo, in the Guaranda canton. It is at a distance of 25 minute from the office of the Cooperative. They have different businesses, including: agriculture, farming, commerce, raising livestock, construction, and a sawmill. 

Jose is in agriculture and he cultivates corn, wheat, and potatoes. He makes his purchases in the market in Guaranda and he makes his sales at the wholesalers' market in the same city. 

He requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and feed for the livestock. The loan will help him to supply for his needs and it will help him faces challenges such as plagues, diseases, and the changing climate. His dream is to have more work and to keep improving his farming and agriculture business.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and livestock feed.

loans.name: Voice Of Women Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Voice of Women” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Adama is the leader of this group. Adama is 46-year-old and married with six children. Three of her children are attending secondary schools. Adama sells market food including margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), frying oil, tomatoes, peppers, salt, etc. She has been doing this business for six years now. With the help of this loan, Adama will invest in her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy margi, palm oil, frying oil, tomatoes, peppers, salt, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is a 51-year-old man from Tulkarem, married and a father of three daughters and two sons. He is a construction worker. Othman's wife works at home; she has an old sewing machine that she uses to make clothes for neighbors.

Othman who is photographed here took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a new sewing machine that would help his wife produce better quality clothes and work faster.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine for his wife's sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 40 years old.  She is married and has 3 children aged 6, 9 and 12. In 2007, she established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to promote health services and help her husband provide for their family.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business.   This borrower has successfully repaid 2 previous loans.  She would like a new loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 to buy essential pharmacy items, especially syrup by the carton. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to build a house, educate her children, open another pharmacy, and hire health workers. She is very determined and hardworking.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy pharmacy products

loans.name: Rosi

texts.es: Rosi tiene 27 años,  reside en la ciudad de Huancayo hace 9 años con sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Trabajó en talleres de artesanía donde aprendió todos los pasos necesarios para la elaboración de objetos artesanales y hace 5 años instaló su propio taller, elaborando mates burilados, logrando hacerse muy conocida en su zona. Es así que trabaja todo el día con la ayuda de sus hijos, y del que produce semanalmente la cantidad necesaria de mates burilados para luego ser vendidos al por mayor a los comerciantes de artesanías. Por tanto procura abastecerse periódicamente de materiales esenciales para la elaboración de estos objetos, uno de ellos son los calabacines que se consiguen en el norte de su país. Disfruta el trabajo que realiza porque es un arte manual que domina y por tanto desea tener más clientela para aumentar sus ganancias. Un día recibió un folleto informativo de MFP y decido pedir informes acerca de las condiciones de crédito la cual considero adecuadas y que se ajusta a su necesidad y decidido trabajar  con préstamos de las cuales ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos por lo que renueva su compromiso de trabajo. Con el dinero comprará una cantidad considerable de calabacines y necesita pagar también el transporte hasta su ciudad.
texts.en:
Rosi, who is 27 years old, lives in her own house in the city of Huancayo with her two children. She has lived there for 9 years. She worked in artisan workshops, where she learned all the necessary steps to make artisan objects,. Five years ago she set up her own workshop where she makes carved gourds, and she has succeeded in becoming very well known in her area. In this way she works all day with the help of her children, every week producing the necessary quantity of carved gourds to then be sold wholesale to the dealers in artesania. 

Therefore she manages to supply herself periodically with the essential materials to make these objects. One of the materials is the gourds, which she obtains in the north of her country. She enjoys the work that she does because it is a manual art that she has mastered, and therefore she wants to have more customers to increase her earnings. One day she received an informative pamphlet about MFP, and she decided to ask for information about the conditions of the loan, which she thought were suitable and fit her needs, and so she decided to work with the loans. She has shown herself to be punctual in her payments, therefore she has renewed her working agreement. With the money from the loan, she will buy a considerable quantity of gourds, and she also needs to pay for their transport to her city.

loans.use: to buy gourds and pay for transportation to go to the northern part of the country.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, a 27-year-old married mother of two children, has been selling vegetables to earn a living for four years now.  She also does poultry farming to earn additional income for her family.  Since joining Faulu Kenya, Ruth has improved her business and hence her living standards. Hoping to expand her enterprise in the future, she has requested a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sweet potatoes, carrots and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila  tiene  treinta cinco  años  de edad , se dedica a la venta de servilletas es una señora con mucha creatividad  ya que elle misma las elabora las servilletas.
Se ha dedicado  desde hace  seis años a la elaboración  de las servilitas , tiene  dos hijas  Juana de  dieciocho años de edad y Margarita de quince años de edad  quienes le ayudan a tejer .
Esta muy contenta  por que  le va muy bien en su negocio, cuando las personas tienen  una fiesta o comida la contratan para que les elabore sus servilletas y manteles.
La señora Zoila  cada semana  va a realizar sus pagos   a la  microfinanciera, le gusta mucho su trabajo y lo hace con gusto ya que a sus clientes le gusta  su mercancía.
Pidió el préstamo para  comprar mas hilo y manta para  elaborar sus  servilletas.
Le  gustaría hacer manteles ya que ocasiones los  a ello pero no se venden igual de rápido que las servilletas.
Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijas terminen sus estudios  ya que ella solamente estudio  la primaria por falta de recursos , es por eso que trabaja  elaborando servilletas para ayudarles  en lo que ellas necesitan, también lava ropa  para  tener un dinerito extra.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Zoila, age 35, makes napkins.  She is a woman with a lot of creativity because she makes the napkins herself.  She has been making napkins for six years.  She has two daughters.  Juana is 18, and Margarita is 15.  They help her weave.

She is very happy because her business is going very well for her.  When people have a party or a banquet they contract her to make the tablecloths and napkins.

Zoila makes her payments to the microfinance institution every week.  She really likes her work, and she does it with pleasure because her customers like her merchandise.

She requested the loan to buy more yarn and fabric to make her napkins.  She would like to make tablecloths at times, but they do not sell as quickly as the napkins.  

One of her dreams if for her daughters to finish their education because she only went to elementary school due to the lack of resources.  That is why she works making napkins in order to help them with what they need.  She also washes clothes in order to have a little extra money.

She is grateful to the Fundación for the support they have given her in order to get ahead and to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to make napkins.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married with three children. Judith is 46 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City.

Judith sells AVON and NATASHA products, viand (dishes) and snacks, and she operates an Internet café to earn a living. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP18,000 to buy meat and food ingredients for her viand and snack-vending business.

Judith has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Judith hopes to expand her Internet café shop.

loans.use: To purchase meat and food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de agua, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Maritza desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de la zona, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar aves de corral y alimento balanceado para que se incremente la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Maritza es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio salga adelante para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 26 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house. It has only running water and is located in the rural district of Mórrope in the department of Lambayeque. This area is dedicated to agriculture, livestock and tourism.

Maritza has raised and sold livestock (cows) for several years. Her cow pen is located at the back of her house and she feeds them nutritionally-balanced food and fresh fodder to get a good supply of milk. She then sells the milk to the locals in the area or takes it to the local market. With the income she is able to cover her family expenses.  

She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy poultry and nutritionally-balanced feed to increase the milk yield of her cows and so get a better price to cover her loan and give her family a better quality of life. Maritza is a hardworking and responsible person whose only desire is that her business succeed so that her children can have other educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy poultry and nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
This is Belen, 38, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eugenio, a laborer, and is mother to their seven children.  Two are in college, four are in high school and the youngest is still staying at home. 

Belen, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Belen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also earns additional income from a room that she offers to be rented in her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP  41,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Belen hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es: Ketty tiene 33 años, es una mujer alegra y muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, de 14 y 9 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, en donde reina la alegría y la unidad familiar, pero sobre todo las ganas de salir adelante. El trabajo que realiza es la costura, en donde compone cierres, vestidos, pantalones y blusas; así como confecciona nuevos diseños en lencería. Éste trabajo lo aprendió desde muy niña, pero viene ejerciéndolo hace tres años, y hasta el momento esta a gusto con lo que hace, además que le permite tener tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos. Su mayor prioridad es comprar una remalladora, de esa manera le facilitaría la confeccion de prendas intimas y que tengan un buen acabado. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar trabajado. Con el monto solicitado, comprará una maquina remalladora y algunos materiales para continuar confeccionando.
texts.en:
Ketty is 33 years old.  She is a cheerful and very hard-working woman who lives with her partner and her two children aged 14 and 9.  They live together in their own home where happiness and family unity reign.  Above all, they have a desire to get ahead in life.

Ketty's business is sewing.  She makes dresses, pants and blouses, and also makes new designs in lingerie.  She learned this work when she was very young and has been working in the business for three years.  Up to now, she is happy with what she does.  In addition, it gives her time to look after her children.  Her main priority is to buy a hemming machine which will help her to sew her lingerie and enable her to finish the garments off well.

This will be Ketty's third loan from MFP.  She hopes to be able to count on your cooperation so that she can continue working.  Ketty will use the sum she has requested to buy a hemming machine and some material so that she can continue sewing.

loans.use: to buy a hemming machine and materials for making lingerie

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with eight family members; four of them work.

Zaman has been an owner of a barber shop since 2004. He has more than seven years' experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers and he has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.


He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to renovate his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and repair his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 42 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 20 and 16.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children. Two of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon.  She sells her products from home and works on all categories of people. She sells popcorn as her other source of income.  She has been in business for the last year. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and weaves. Shamim's goals and aspirations are own a bridal salon and to buy a plot of land. Her major business challenges are defaulters, and on and off electricity. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and weaves

loans.name: Pasar Lontar Group

texts.en:
Enung continues to sell toys from her shop. She is taking another loan with VisionFund Indonesia to expand her business. Because this is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia, she can borrow more money than before and expand her business faster. Her last loan helped the business by adding more toys. It also helped improve her family's standard of living.

After the group paid back their first KIVA loan, one of the group members left because she no longer needed a loan for her business.

loans.use: to pay for children's toys like cars and rackets to sell in her children's toy store.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married with three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sabreen wants to improve her family's home living conditions by purchasing necessary new home furniture such as bedroom furniture for her children, living room furniture, a kitchen table, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for it, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Sabreen gets the loan, she will purchase what furniture the family needs to live in better home conditions. Sabreen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.


About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Rani Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rani Bibi is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family: a husband and a daughter. Rani’s days are focused on making progress with her business. She is involved in embroidery works. Her work is home-based. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes. Her excellent embroidery skills enable her to receive good orders from her clients and generate good revenue.
 
Rani's husband’s economic mainstay is selling fruit. He has good selling skills and he is renowned for his business. He has been operating his business for over 8 years. Rani is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He intends to use the loan to purchase fresh seasonal fruits for reselling. She hopes that her husband will grow the business more and improve the quality of services after the loan investment.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani Bibi”.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for re-selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy perfumes for men and women.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with 2 children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soap, sugar, and groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 14 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, sugar, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Iacinta

texts.en:
Iacinta is sixty years old and married with six children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has many years of experience in this business. Iacinta needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Iacinta  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Iacinta 's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim is the mother of three school-aged kids. She lives in Reussey Keo commune and works selling Chinese noodles every day in a local market. Mrs. Kim typically earns an average of 2.50 USD per day. Her family also gets income from her husband, who is a construction foreman working around the country. Unfortunately, some of his construction materials are ruined and he also needs more necessary tools to improve his business. 

Mrs. Kim is requesting a loan to purchase construction supplies to support her husband's business. She hopes that this loan will improve her family's living conditions. In the future, Mrs. Kim wants to expand her store and sell more food to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Abi Noemí's Group

texts.en: Abi and Gerenia and their families live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In el Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days during whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through saving on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes when there are blackouts. Both women contribute to their families income by producing clay products that they sell in nearby tourist spots and in nearby commerce centers. They belong to a cooperative of women that is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras de Tiltepec” (Working Woman from Tiltepec) and they participate in different exhibits and that is starting to sell their products to different Foundations and bigger crafts shops.  A loan for a solar home system will allow this working women to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work and generate higher incomes for their families.

loans.use: Abi and Gerenia each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and gain 4 hours more to produce clay products

loans.name: Adin

texts.en:
Adin is 26 years old and married with one child. Adin works very hard to provide for them.

Adin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Adin has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Adin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela has more than 13 years of experience in the production and selling of clothing. She learned the trade from her mother and set up her own business after saving up money from a job as a housekeeper. She has a very modest workshop that is in need of more fabrics and other materials, but she works long hours in order to make ends meet. As a single mother, she relies heavily on this business and a part time job cleaning houses in order to feed and educate her 2 children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and other materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
R. is 22 year old with one daughter. Before becoming MBK member, R. could only rely on her husband to earn money for the family. R. is hoping that by becoming an MBK member she can help her family's finances by opening a small kiosk that sells various snacks, cigarettes, soap, medicines, shampoo, etc. She will use the $50 loan from MBK to open her kiosk. R. can now earn Rp. 75,000 (about $7.50) per day. She hopes to obtain larger loan to expand her kiosk.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

R. berusia 22 tahun mempunyai satu orang anak perempuan. Sebelum menjadi anggota MBK, R. hanya mengandalkan suaminya sebagai tulang punggung keluarganya, namun setelah menjadi anggota MBK, R. dapat membantu perekonomian keluarganya dengan membuka warung kecil yang menjual anek makanan kecil, rokok, sabun, obat-obatan, shampoo dll. Pinjaman dari MBK sebesar $50 seluruhnya digunakan untuk membuka warungnya. Sekarang R. dapat memperoleh penghasilan Rp. 75,000 per hari. Dia berharap dapat memperoleh pinjaman yang lebih besar lagi sehingga dapat memperbesar warungnya.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her store

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is married with four children all in primary school. He has not undertaken any training but hopes to enroll in college soon. He started his business in 2000 in order to support his family. He also sells bicycle spare parts.

With the proposed loan from PEMCI, Evans plans to improve his stock to be able to supply goods to other shopkeepers in the area. Through his business, he has been able to supply the local boda-bodas (bicycle transporters) with easy access to spare parts. Boda Boda bicycles are an essential mode of transport in this area and very popular. Evans is providing an important service to the community in facilitating movement of goods and people. Well worth the support of PEMCI and Kiva partners.

loans.use: Buy Bicycle Spare Parts

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T. is a working mother of four children. Her husband is a tailor and they both work hard to provide an education for their children. Rebecca is very proud of her two girls who have just started in the local college. She proudly says, “I spend my income on my children’s education with the hope that they will take care of me when I am old”. Rebecca is forty-five years old and plans to diversify her business for more income and to save more profit for her children’s school requirements. She is requesting a second loan of $175.

loans.use: Rebecca would like to to diversify her business selling vegetables so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.name: Izattoy

texts.ru:
Izattoy G., 46 is divorced. She has an associate degree. Izattoy has been selling for 20 years. In the past, she sold clothing, but then she gradually switched to selling fabrics. When she learned of MicroInvest, Izattoy applied for a loan to expand the volume of goods. The loan helped Izattoy to increase the inventory and add curtains to her assortment of goods. Izattoy’s business continues to expand, so now she wants to expand the store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиева Изаттой 46 лет, разведенная, образование среднее специальное. Вот уже 20летзанимается торговлей. Раньше торговала одеждой, постепенно перешла на продажу материи. Узнав о программе МЗФ «Микроинвест» она решила получить кредит и тем самым увеличить товарооборот. После получения займа она постепенно величила товар, добавила в свой ассортимент занавески. Сейчас её активы увеличились, в будущем она хочет расширить место деятельности.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Angelica De

texts.es:
Angelica de C. A. is 43 years old and she has a grocery store, located in the Villa Adela neighborhood of the city of El Alto, and it is open Monday through Sunday. She has been living in a rented house for six years, also in the Villa Adela. She has two children, both of whom are studying in the neighborhood high school. Her husband works as a salaried driver.

Angelica has been working in the grocery business for 12 years and is a punctual client of our institution. Though she faces competition in the market, she has her own clientele because of her gift for good customer service. There is not a fixed price, and because of the variety of grocery merchandise the customers buy the following types of products: sugar, rice, noodles, corn starch, oatmeal, cremola, etc.

Angelica does not have negative credit history according to the Risk Center and the INFOCRED Bureau. She was not present at her business the day photos were being taken, so that is why there are two photographs (one of her, one of her business).

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ANGELICA ES UNA SEÑORA DE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD QUE TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES UBICADA EN EL PLAN 560 MZNA 307 #16 DEL BARRIO VILLA ADELA DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO CON LA VENTA DIARIA DESDE EL DIA LUNES A DOMINGO. LA CLIENTE VIVE EN ANTICRETICO DURANTE SEIS AÑOS, UBICADO EN EL PLAN 560 MZNA. 307 #16 DEL BARRIO DE VILLA ADELA TIENE DOS HIJOS LOS CUALES ESTUDIAN EN EL COLEGIO DEL MISMO BARRIO, EL ESPOSO TRABAJA DE CHOFER ASALARIADO. LA SRA. ANGELICA A. DE C. TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO COMO 144 MESES DEDICADO AL NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES,SIENDO UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, ELLA TIENE SU PROPIA CLIENTELA YA QUE TIENE EL DON DE ATENCION AL CLIENTE. NO EXISTE UN PRECIO FIJO, YA QUE POR LA VARIEDAD DE MERCADERIAS EN ABARROTES LA CLIENTE COMPRA LAS SIGUIENTE VARIEDAD DE ABARROTES (AZUCAR, ARROZ,FIDEO,HARINA MAIZENA, AVENA,CEMOLA,ETC). LA CLIENTE NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURU DE INFOCRED. SE HACE NOTAR QUE LA SEÑORA NO SE ENCONTRABA EN SU PUESTO POR ESA RAZÓN SE PRESENTAN DOS FOTOGRAFÍAS.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a grocery business

loans.name: Eliana Caridad

texts.es:
Señora Eliana Caridad T. R. is 30 years old. She finished high school. She has 2 children whom she supports. They live in the district of El Porvenir, in the town of T. in the state of La Libertad.

Señora Eliana has worked since she was 8 years old helping her mother sell fruits and vegetables. This is why she knows a lot about this business because she also sells fruits and vegetables at the local market in the city of T..

She is a founding member of the local community bank called "Victor Raul". She insisted in forming a bank because she's very knowledgeable in the general functions of a community bank since her mother is also a member of a community bank. She obtained her first loan through this bank which was in the amount of $300 Nuevo Soles. She used this money to fix up the space/stand which she leases at the local market.

With this loan of $450 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale price so that she can hopefully make a good profit.

Señora Eliana dreams of owning her own locale at one of the bigger markets in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eliana Caridad T. R. tiene 30 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 2 hijos a los cuales todavía mantiene. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de T., departamento de La Libertad. La señora Eliana trabajaba ayudando a su mamá desde que tenía 8 años, por eso es que conoce del negocio. Tiene un puesto de verduras y frutas en un pequeño mercado en la ciudad de T.. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl”. Ella fue las más empeñosa en formarlo porque también tenía conocimiento del funcionamiento de los bancos comunales, debido a que su mamá es socia de un banco de la sierra de La Libertad. En este banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con lo cual terminó de acondicionar su puesto que no estaba en buen estado cuando lo alquiló. Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará verduras y frutas al por mayor para obtener mayores utilidades. La señora Eliana sueña con tener un puesto propio en uno de los mercados grandes de la ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silva is a valued mother who makes a daily effort to ensure that the needs of her three sons are met. Her husband also works hard to support the family. She sales sweets and ice cream from her home, which does not look like a store, but is well known because of the quality of her product.  She also gets financial help from renting out her car. However, despite these businesses, she is not able to open a store due to the expenses of having a family. Now, Silvia is asking for a loan so that she can buy everything necessary to open her own store in the future.  Please help her to achieve her dream.

loans.use: Upgrades of store

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.en: K. Kholniso was born in 1959 in Khujand and is married with four children. Mrs. K. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. She was first engaged in selling clothes but for the last five years has worked as a realtor of apartments and rental homes, as well as buying and selling property.  She has repeat customers and a good reputation as a realtor. Currently, however, she has insufficient financial resources to expand her business, so Mrs. K. has applied to  MicroInvest for a loan of 4100 TJS ($1,200) for developing and expanding her business.

loans.use: Business development.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en:
Libertad S. lives in the jungle city of Tarapoto, San Martin, where she bakes and sells delicious empanadas, pies, and cakes. She bakes her treats at home and sells them from a store she owns next door, as well as distributes them to popular coffee houses thoughout the city. She has been running the business for 13 years and has many faithful clients.

Libertad is 50 years old, divorced, and has three children. She loves her business and would not want to be doing anything else. She is happy with all the friends she has maD. running a business and the self-confidence it has given her. Her children are now adults and live independently, but often help her out when they can.  

A member of the community bank Manos Unidos, Libertad is requesting a loan of s/ 1000 to be repaid over 6 months.  With this loan, she will purchase a new oven. One day, she hopes to open a small restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase of a new oven

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is a thirty-five year old married father of two daughters. Nixon has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over twelve years. Currently he sells mostly brake pads. The proceeds of this loan will allow him to purchase more products from overseas (US and Japan). In Ghana, there are no auto parts stores but there is a high demand for parts, as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. He sells his wares in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Nixon is a member of the lending group Not Yours. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Nixon would like to import more brake pads to sell.

loans.name: Radjab

texts.ru:
Radjab Khikmatovich Bobokhonov lives in Shahrinav district. He is 36 and married with four children. He has a high school education. Radjab has been making a living in agriculture for more than five years. He has a plot of land where he grows wheat. He uses part of the wheat to make flour for his own use, since ready-made bread products at the market are pricey. Radjab sells the remainder of his wheat to his neighbors, and at the market. In order to cultivate good wheat, he needs money to buy mineral fertalizer and flammable lubricant. Radjab has decided to take out a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Бобохонов Раджаб Хикматович проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст 36 лет, женат ,имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Раджаб занимается сельским хозяйством более 5 лет. Он выращивает пшеницу на своем земельном участке.Часть пшеницы он перемалывает в муку и использует в собственных целях. Так как готовая хлебо-булочная продукция на рынке стоит дорого. Оставшуюся часть пшеницы клиент продает соседям и на рынке. Для выращивания хорошей пшеницы клиенту нужны средства для миниральных удобрений и ГСМ. Раджаб решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and flammable lubricant

loans.name: Mégbéwé

texts.fr:
Born August 23rd, 1970 in Panalo in the Kozah prefecture, Mrs. Mégbéwé T. is married and the mother of two children who are going to school. Her main business activity is selling charcoal in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. Her primary suppliers are the villagers of Tsévié. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy 29 bags of wood charcoal.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 23 août 1970 à Panalo dans la préfecture de la Kozah, Dame T. Mégbéwé est mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui fréquentent. Elle a pour activité principale la vente du charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle a pour fournisseur principal les paysans du village de Tsévié. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 29 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.use: Purchase 29 bags of wood charcoal

loans.name: Fernando Santos

texts.es:
Fernando (33) has worked transporting passengers for some time, and he owns his own cycle-car. He is the father of one child who is still in school, and who is his reason for continuing to work hard. His wife Magrith has always supported him in everything that he decides to do. Fernando would like to be able to offer his son the education necessary for him to become a professional; rising out of the conditions that the now live in. For that reason, he works hard every day, both to economically support his family and to save to purchase a new cycle-car. Fernando will use this loan to have his cycle-car repaired so that he can continue to do his work and to continue to save to purchase a new cycle-car.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Fernando (33) se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace ya mucho tiempo, él es propietario de un motocarro. Es padre de 1 niño que aún está en el colegio, y es su razón de seguir adelante; su pareja, la señora Magrith siempre lo apoya mucho en todo lo que decide. Fernando quiere brindar a su hijo la educación necesaria para que en un futuro sea profesional y supere la condición en la que ahora se encuentran. Es por ello que trabaja duro y parejo, uno por el sustento económico de su familia y otro para ahorrar y comprar otro motocarro.El uso que daría Fernando al préstamo que solicita es para mandar a reparar su motocarro, poder trabajar tranquilo, y seguir ahorrado para un nuevo motocarro.

loans.use: Repair of his cycle-car which he uses daily to provide public transportation.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy I. is 51-years old married with nine children. She hails from Uromi town in Edo State. She sells gallons of oil in the local market and has been in this business since 1982. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more palm oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil to sell in the market

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Саламова Джумагуль жительница района Вахш. Возраст 28 лет, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Клиентка занимаеся выращиванием овощей. Она имеет небольшой участок земли на котором каждый год сеет овощи и зелень.Готовый урожай реализует на местном рынке. Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать  свою семью.В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить саженцы овощей.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jumagul S. lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 28 years old, is married and has 4 children. Jumagul grows vegetables. She has a small plot of land where she plants vegetables and greens every year. Jumagul sells her harvest at the local market. This business helps her to support her family. At the moment, Jumagul want to purchase vegetable seedlings. She will pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Mawuto

texts.fr: Mawuto A. est une revendeuse très connue dans son quartier qui prend son affaire au sérieux et jouissait d’une bonne réputation par sa cuisine à Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Agée de 38 ans, Mawuto est mariée et mère de quatre enfants et a acquis une expérience très riche en cuisine et de service de qualité ce qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle ne fait pas de doute que son travail lui procurait de la joie mais il lui faut encore une cuisinière et autres choses pour assurer un service prompt et efficace et des relations aimables avec les clients. Elle espère par cette opportunité, tirer des profits etn charges des besoins de la famille. Elle est la personne située à l'extrème gauche
texts.en:
Mawuto A. (far-left on the picture) is a very well-known reseller in her neighborhood. She takes her business very seriously, and her cooking is very well regarded in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Mawuto, age 38, is married and the mother of four children. Over five years, she's acquired a very rich experience in cooking and quality service. There's no doubt she's enjoying her job, but she needs a new stove and other things to ensure a fast and efficient service and good relationship with her clients. With this opportunity, she hopes to make a profit to support her family needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new stove and other items for her restaurant

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mr. Thon C. lives in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. He is a petrol seller who buys from others gas stations. Mr. Thon is requesting a loan of $375 so he can purchase more petrol at one time, and increase his earnings. His wife, Mrs. Yoen Muntha, is a banana seller who buys from others people. Mr. Thon C. is 37years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase more petrol and increase earnings

loans.name: Mul

texts.en: Mrs. Mul M. is 40 years old and lives in Ta Ny village in Kampong Cham Province and is a housewife. She is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, two others attend the local school and the rest are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Soer Tho, cultivates vegetables and he is shown on the right of the photo. He now wants to grow cassavas but he does not have enough money to plant it. Thus, Mul decided to ask for a loan to cultivate cassavas. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Mul would like to cultivate cassavas.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of thirteen people who live in Trapang Samroung village in Kampong Chhnang province. The group members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Vanna K., the village bank president, sells fish. Since this business is doing well, she wants to expand I., so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to resell to reach her customers. Her husband, Mr. Meach Sout, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Vanna K. is 45 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the remaining two attend the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These eight members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term ( EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because I. is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. I. allows them to repay portions of principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Atisso

texts.fr: Atisso Akpédzé est âgé de 29 ans, père de 3 enfants dont un en apprentissage. Il vit depuis  des années à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce  crédit  consolider son fond de commerce pouvant lui permettre de renouveler dans la mesure du possible son stock de marchandises étant une particulier commerçant d’alimentation générale. Les gains issus du business permettront à monsieur de  réaliser plus de bénéfice et  de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Atisso Akpédzé is 29 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is in an apprenticeship. For years now, he has lived in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to consolidate his working capital, so that he may renew to the extent possible his stock of merchandise, he being a grocer. The gains derived from his business will enable him to realize more profit and to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop

loans.name: Tinh

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Tĩnh năm nay 29 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho việc buôn bán thịt lợn. Hiện nay hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua lợn thịt về giết mổ còn chị cung cấp thịt lợn cho bà con địa phương tại chợ . Công việc kinh doanh buôn bán phát triển thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Tinh is 29 yrs old. Her family has 2 young children. In 2006 she joined TYM fund and borrowed a loan to invest in a pork-selling business. Currently, her husband would purchase the pigs to slaughter daily, and she would then sell the meat to the community at the market. The business is profitable bringing in 233 USD per month for her family. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to continue investment in the pork-selling business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Namulesa Twekembe Group

texts.en:
Sarah’s hair salon has been in business for 10 years and is well known in the community. Sarah often employs someone to help her since she tries to stay open at all times and her other responsibilities do not allow her to always be at the salon.

Sarah is looking for a loan of $550 to buy more products for her salon. Because Sarah mostly does women's hair, she will be buying hair-treatment chemicals, braids, and weaves.

Sarah continues to try to expand her business because she has four children of her own and six orphans to support. Although Sarah does have a husband, she says he is not helpful financially and thus the burden of providing for all ten children falls on her. All of the children she cares for are school-aged and so she has large school-fee bills each year.

With the profits that Sarah made with her last loan, she was able to start a second business running a calling station in front of her salon. Community members use this calling station to make calls if they do not have phones of their own. She hopes that this loan will be able to make her profits grow even more now that she has this second business.

loans.use: Purchasing hair-treatment chemicals, braids, and weaves

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фариде 27 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее младший ребенок еще маленький и поэтому она сидит дома. Ее муж работает в колхозе, но заработок очень маленький. Чтобы поддержать мужа Фарида смотрит дома за скотом. Каждые 2-3 месяца можно справить какие-либо расходы семьи за счет прибыли от продажи скота. Фарида обратилась  в МикроИнвест за получением займа.
texts.en:
Farida is 27 years old, married, and has two children. Her younger child is still small, and consequently she stays home. Her husband works on a collective farm, but he earns very little. To help her husband, Farida looks after the cattle at home. Every two to three months they can pay some family bills by using the profit from cattle sales. Farida has asked MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Orsa

texts.es: Orsa, de 39 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su esposo, quien trabajador dependiente. Desde hace 3 años se  dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos en un ambiente que acondicionó dentro de su casa. Orsa se preocupa por criar a sus pollos adecuadamente, y que los mismos  estén con un peso y tamaño exacto, al gusto al cliente.
