Ella considera que su negocio es rentable porque cada 35 días sus aves están listas para la venta. Lo difícil de esta labor, para ella, es no contar con un galpón adecuado, ya que cría sus pollos dentro de su casa. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque le da la oportunidad de salir adelante y existe mucha comprensión entre sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá comprando pollos bebés y alimento necesario para criarlos.
texts.en:
Orsa is 39 years old, has 5 children, and lives with her husband. For the last 3 years Orsa has worked raising and selling chickens in a conditioned environment inside her home. Orsa is concerned with raising her chickens properly, and sees that they are an exact size and weight to suit her customer. Orsa believes that her business is profitable because every 35 days her birds are ready for sale. The difficulty of this work for Orsa is that she does not have an appropriate warehouse, and therefore must raise the chickens in her home. This is the first time Orsa will take a loan with Microfinazas Prisma. She likes to work with her community bank, as it gives her the chance to succeed, and there is sympathy among her peers. Orsa will spend the money she receives to buy baby chicks and the feed to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baby chicks, and chick-feed

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs. She is an active LAPO client. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Abraham

texts.fr: Abraham S. est un jeune qui exploit un taxi clando sur la ligne Ziguinchor-Cap Skiring. Avec la saison touristique il arrive à faire de bonnes affaires. Avec son taxi il soutient sa famille restée au village. Il demande un crédit pour relooker son véhicule et offrir des servicves de qualité à sa clientéle.
texts.en:
Abraham S. is a young man who has an independent taxi run on the Ziguinchor-Cap Skiring line. In the tourist season, he manages to do quite well. With his taxi, he supports the members of his family who stayed in the village. He is asking for a loan to overhaul his vehicle so as to offer quality service to his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: overhauling his vehicle

loans.name: Adulfo

texts.es:
El señor Adulfo es albañil independiente al igual que su hijo quien contribuye al ingreso familiar.
La esposa de don Adulfo se encarga del hogar y trabaja en una empresa como operadora en el área de producción.
Juntos como la familia unida que son están tramitando este crédito para realizar  la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casa para mayor  independencia y seguridad del hogar.
texts.en:
Adulfo is an independent bricklayer, along with his son who also contributes to this family business. Adulfo’s wife takes care of their home and works as a production operator for a local company. They are a united and close-knit family who are asking for this loan in order to build a fence in front of their home, to create more privacy and security for their home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security fence

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old and a single mother of a 12-year-old and a 9-year-old. She is a wholesaler of Irish potatoes. She hires a lorry (truck) to transport the potatoes to a local outdoor market in Kisumu.

Beatrice will use her loan to purchase more potatoes. Her hope is that her loan will help her improve her living standards, which she defined as “having more food, and meeting basic needs”.

loans.use: buying more potatoes to wholesale

loans.name: Nubia Lisseth

texts.es:
La señora Nubia V. se dedica a la actividad agrícola en el municipio de Telica dedicándose esencialmente a la actividad de siembra de ajonjolí y de maíz por lo que actualmente requiere invertir en esta actividad para preparar el suelo, dar lugar al arado y a la siembra utilizando los insumos agrícolas.

Es por esta razón que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertir en esto y así obtener una abundante cosecha de ajonjolí y de maíz para su propio desarrollo y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Nubia V. makes a living in agriculture in the municipality of Telica, devoting herself essentially to planting sesame and corn. Currently she needs to invest in this activity to prepare the soil and lead the plowing and sowing using her materials. It's for this reason she has turned to Kiva partner Ceprodel, requesting a loan to invest in her land and thus obtain an abundant harvest of sesame and corn to help her own development and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the sowing of sesame and corn

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: coumba M. est societaire de la caisse de baye laye depuis fevrier 2008.elle a deja beneficie de deux(02)prets au sein de l'institution .actuellement elle sollicite un credit de deux cent cinquante mille(250 000)frs pour renforcer son capital au niveau de la commercialisation de legumes secteur dans le lequel il evolue depuis quelques annees.son objectif est de subvenir a ses besios familliaux avec l'augmentation de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Coumba M. has been a member of the Baye Laye bank since February 2008. She already benefited from 2 loans from this institution. She's now seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 to bolster her capital. For a few years, she's been selling vegetables. Her goal is to increase her income in order to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capital

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est spécialisé dans la vente des téléphones portables et de leurs accessoires. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2002 à Lomé dans son quartier Attiégou. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant. Pour avoir un nouveau stock de téléphones portables ainsi que des accessoires, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter  20 téléphones portables, 15 batteries d'alimentation ainsi que d’autres accessoires. Ce monsieur n’est pas marié
texts.en:
This gentleman is a specialist at selling mobile phone and the accessories for them.  He has been in this business since 2002 in Lomé in his district of Attiégou.  This business enables him to provide for his child.  To obtain a new stock of mobile phones, as well as accessories, he's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 20 mobile phones, 15 batteries, and other accessories.  This gentleman is not married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories for them

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en:
Kisa G. (0) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitoloa. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Kisa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Kisa has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

Kisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. Kisa is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Kisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahmasharif

texts.en:
S. Mahmasharif is married and has 4 children. He runs a small grocery business. His place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Mahmasharif has been in this business for over 5 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business. Mahmasharif is requesting a loan for 3000 Somoni to increase the assortment of his selling inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Mahmasharif's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuff for increasing the range of selling goods.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. sells smoked fish at Elmina near Ankanfu.  Theresa has received junior high education.  She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a trader. Theresa has been selling since 1998. She supports the husband in the paying of bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to smoke by way of processing. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.
To smoke her fish, she goes to the sea shore to buy fresh fish form the sea men. She comes home with the fishes cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally make oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to smoke by way of processing.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina A. is from the village of Dalapang Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Melodina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Melodina plants & harvests cassava for sale. Melodina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Melodina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melodina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Melodina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melodina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Pom B., 20, is married and lives with her young child in Takeo province. She makes rice wine and raises pigs, making around US$10 in revenue each day, while her husband works as a moto-taxi driver. Her husband makes about US$4 each day, however they must also support her mother at home. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also been a factor in making the price of rice very high. Pom B. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more rice to make rice wine and raise pigs. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Anne  Wanjiru

texts.en:
Ann is married to Jackson and they have two children named Claire and Clive.

Ann was introduced to KADET by existing clients and is now asking for her second loan. She sells clothes in an open air market in the Eastlands area of Nairobi, something she has been doing for eight years now. Her other source of income is hairdressing at the same place. The market is normally very busy and she has applied for a loan to add more merchandise like skirts which will tremendously boost her business. With the extra profits she intends to own her own salon thus increasing her income base. She describes herself as hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase stock of ladies skirts in the open air market.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 37 years old and married with 5 children, 4 of whom are still in school. He runs a kiosk selling general food stuffs. He's been in business for 11 years. He requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 to buy merchandise for his business.

He describes himself as hardworking and determined to progress. He says that since he became a member of Faulu he has learned about business management and saving methods. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land for his family and build a house for them. In his business, he would like to expand to wholesale supply.

loans.use: To add stock to his food kiosk.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa D. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and son. Her son is 6 years old and goes to a local secondary school. Bayarmaa's husband is a herder with a dozen livestock, including sheep, goats and cattle.

Bayarmaa runs a small barber shop in the local town. She rents a small place and cuts locals' hair. She has been in the haircutting business since 2007 and she has already gained some loyal customers who like getting haircuts from her shop. Since her start in 2007, her business capital has increased from 80,000 MNT to 200,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). This certainly says that her business has been going great.

She requests a loan to purchase necessary equipment to upgrade her business and get ready for the busy season.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment for her barber shop

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente ya lleva varios prestamos el cual esta agradecido por que el apoyo que se le da lo ha aprovechado muy bien. El desde hace 4 años que fue pensionado opto por vender ropa usada para poder mantener a su familia. En este momento el quiere comprar mas mercancía por el cambio de clima que se aproxima para no estar desprevenido y así tener mas ganancias para su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardo has proven to be an excellent client; he has had several loans already for which he is grateful because he has used them well. Four years ago, when he was laid off from work, he opted to sell used clothing to support his family. At the present time he wants to buy more merchandise now that the season is about to change with the weather. He wants to be prepared so that his profits will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Di

texts.es: La señora Rosa Di L. V. nació en El Jícaro Nueva Segovia, hace cuarenta y cinco años, es madre de 4 hijos donde 4 de los mayores viven de manera independiente y el último sobrevive gracias a la señora Rosa, está casada y su marido trabaja en CCN como mecánico industrial, siendo uno de los principales sustentos económicos de la familia, su mayor aspiración es el terminar de construir su vivienda, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, la mayor de las dificultades que ha tenido es que las personas a las que les vende al crédito no les han pagado de tal manera  que  no ha podido recuperar el 100% del capital invertido, ella considera que una nueva inversión de dinero le traerá nuevos productos tales como zapatos y ropa a ofertar y podrá conseguir de nuevos clientes bajo nuevas medidas de pago, esto le ayudará a su economía y le brindara mejores condiciones para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Di L. V. was born in El Jícaro Nueva Segovia, 45 years ago; she is the mother of 4 children, the adult children are living independently and the youngest is supported by Mrs. Rosa. She is married and her husband works in CCN as an industrial mechanic; his job being the principal source of economic support for the family. Her major aspiration is to finish building her house. She sells clothes and shoes; the major problem she has had is that the people that bought on credit from her have not paid, and she has not been able to recover 100% of the capital invested. She believes that a new investment of money will bring her new products such as shoes and clothes to offer, and she will be able to gain new customers under new payment agreements; this will help her finances and will bring a better quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda Y. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, making and sewing curtains (per order). At the same time she is selling cellphone electronic loads in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Z. Naimjon is 21 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. After he finished his education he started to work with his mother. They have a trade business and sell jeans wear. Two years ago he decided to do the same business alone and opened clothing shop on one of the main market of Khujand. Although he has his own business now Naimjon still continues to help his mother in her business in supplying and delivering. To enlarge the range of clothes that he sells Naimjon wants to supply some sporting clothes and needs a loan of $1500 USD. Naimjon is counting on your help. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing for selling.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es: La señora Cándida Rosa M., tiene un tramo de productos varios en el mercado ubicado del almacén mundo elegante 75 vrs al norte sobre la acera tiene 35 años de tener su negocio ella alquila y su negocio lo empezo con C$20,000.00 ahorro  propio, tiene cinco hijos solo dos dependen de ella actualmente estudian en la universidad. La señora M. solicito el crédito para surtir con productos de verano aprovechando que ya viene la semana santa lo cual ella espera tener mejores ventas, es una señora luchadora que poco a poco a sacado adelante a sus hijos ha sido madre y padre para sus hijos, desde las siete de la mañana ya esta vendiendo hasta las seis de la tarde diario, sus hijas le ayudan a ver su negocio tiene varias trabajadoras tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel con once créditos de los cuales les ha sacado buen provecho por que los sabe administrar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candida Rosa Mendez has an array of various products in the market located 63 meters north of the Almacen Mundo elegante on the sidewalk. She has had her business for 35 years. She rents and her business started with C$20,000.00 of her own savings. She has five children, and presently only two are dependent on her; they are in college. Mrs. Mendez asked for a loan to offer summer products to take advantage of the fact that Holy Week is near and she hopes to have more sales. She is a fighter and little by little she has been able to get her children ahead. She has been both mother and father to her children. She sells from seven in the morning until seven in the evening every day. Her daughters help her tend to her business; she has several workers. She has been working with Ceprodel for three years with eleven loans. They have benefitted her becasue she knows how to manage them.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for my business: pools, sandals, summer clothing, shoes, notebooks.

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Erlinda A. M., es casada y su marido es jubilado, le apoya económicamente y su hijo estudia el primer año de secundaria tiene 36 años, dentro de sus grandes prioridades esta la legalización de los terrenos de su hogar, y terminar la construcción de la misma.

Ella se dedica a la venta de carne y ropa de segundo uso, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de verano y aprovechar la temporada, esta inversión le apoyaría económicamente para conseguir sus objetivos que se ha planteado años atrás, espera que se le brinde ayuda y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Erlinda A. M. is married and her husband is retired, he support economically and her son is in the first year of middle school. She is 36 years old, and one of her greatest priorities is to legalize the land of her house and to finish building it.

She sells meat and second-hand garments for a living. She requests a loan to buy clothes for summer and take advantage of the season. This investment will help her economically to reach her goals which she planned years ago. She hopes to receive support and thus improve the life quality of her familiy.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase second-hand clothing

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La señora Luz I. Valladarez tiene 35 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Pompilio Ayala quien se dedica a la fotografia,  tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos, dos estan en el colegio. Luz se dedica 
a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años y nos dijo que le a ido bien y a luchado por sacar 
adelante a su familia, el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar de maiz, leña, cal. desea almacenar maiz para cuando este caro y tambien comprar leña para el invierno, ademas vende charamuscas, paletas y con esto obtiene un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz I. Valladarez is 35 years old and lives with her partner Pompilio Ayala, who is a photographer. They have three dependent children, two of whom are in high school. Luz has made and sold tortillas for 15 years. Things have gone well for her and she has struggled to improve her family's situation. She will use this loan to purchase corn, firewood, and lime. She would like to stock up on corn in case it becomes expensive and to purchase firewood for the winter. She also sells ribbon candy and lollipops to supplement her income.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, and lime

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
38-year-old Edelyn A.’ intention for joining ASHI is to sustain her small fish-selling business by supporting her husband’s fishing activity. Revenue from her business is her family’s financial source for supporting their daily needs. Edelyn has three children to support and attend to. While they are still young (they are between 7 and 13 years old), she wants to put up a savings fund for their future education in college.

Through ASHI, Edelyn is requesting a loan to purchase a small fishing boat that will be operated manually by her husband. In her mind, once her husband has his own fishing boat, he can go fishing as often as he wants, rather than just borrowing a fishing boat from a neighbor or joining others in fishing in which case he would only receive a small share of the catch. 

Since Edelyn now has access to a loan, she hopes that her family’s standard of living will improve.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Sonia es casada, tiene 31 años y 6 hijos, Sonia junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de flores, papa, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono.
Sonia sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia, 31, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is married and has 6 children. She and her husband grow flowers and potatoes that they sell in the city's wholesale foodstuff market. Sonia needs a 1000 sol loan to buy manure. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: María Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: María Alicia del Carmen B. D. M. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, ella es una persona muy responsable, alegre y trabajadora, la cual cuenta con una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, lugar el cual vive junto a sus dos nietos D. 10 y 5 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y quienes están al total cuidado D. ella, debido a que la madre resiD. en Los Estados Unidos, por lo que la señora María es la que vela por el bienestar D. los pequeños. Es por esta razón, que el negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación ya que le permite poder cuidar a sus nietos y así mismo obtener el dinero necesario para llevar el sustento diario hasta su mesa. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir la tienda, comprando productos comestibles como, arroz, frijoles, huevos, pan y otros más, así mismo comprar detergentes, bebidas y otros productos, los cuales son D. primera necesidad, María posee muchos deseos D. salir adelante y poder brindarle una vida mejor a sus nietos.
texts.en:
María Alicia del Carmen B. D. M. is 60 years old and resides in the town of Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She is a responsible, cheerful, and hardworking person who has a store where she sells basic necessities. María operates her business out of her home, where she lives with her two grandchildren (ages 10 and 5) who are in school. She is taking care of them since their mother lives in the United States. Sra. María is always looking after the welfare of the little ones. Having her business in her home enables her to watch them and still generate the necessary income to proviD. for their daily needs.

María is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store. She will buy food products such as rice, beans, eggs, bread, and other items. In addition, María will purchase detergents, soft drinks, and other products considered to be basic necessities. She has tremendous desire to succeed and proviD. a better life for her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy S., 26, is single and resides with her sister in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. and her sister are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of about USD 2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to raise pigs.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. (in flowered red shirt) appears in the photograph with her younger sister.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to use to commute to work

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria vive con su esposo y su dos hijos en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Ana Maria es Profesora en una Unidad Educativa de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de contención que estabilizara su vivienda construida en pendiente.
Esta es la novena  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria lives with her husband and their two children in her own house in the Llojeta area on the western side of the city of La Paz. Ana Maria is a teacher in a school in this school and her earnings supports the family. The loan that she is requesting is to build a retaining wall on a sloping lot that will allow her house to be stable. This is the ninth time that she is asking for a loan and her credit standing qualifies her favorably for one.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Jorge David

texts.es:
Jorge de 34 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una tienda de víveres desde hace años atrás. 

Por la falta de oportunidades profesionales el comenzó a vender víveres en su casa con ayuda de sus padres, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar una vitrina para su local, hasta que comenzó a completar dinero para su local, ahora el trabajn desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00pm todos los dias. 

Para continuar con su tienda el quiere comprar con el prestamo arroz, azucar y bebidas y asi surtirlo mas, en el futuro el quiere ampliar fisicamente su tienda.
texts.en:
Jorge, 34, lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urbanized area where the majority of the residents run some kind of small business). He has a grocery store that he started four years ago. Due to the lack of professional opportunities he began to sell groceries out of his home with his parents’ help. With effort he gradually was able to come up with the money to buy a display case and set up his shop. He now works from 6 in the morning until 11 at night every day of the week. In order to maintain his store he wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar and drinks and thus expand his product line. In the future he wants to enlarge his store premises.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and drinks

loans.name: Hairrat

texts.en:
Nassibmbwa Hairrat is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  She has a business of selling food like matooke (steamed green plantain) and sweet potatoes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Hairrat has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more matooke and sweet potatoes to sell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hairrat hopes to generate greater profits and help to pay school fees for herself so as to complete her studies.  In the future, she hopes to study up to the university level.    

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: to buy more matooke and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Seutatia

texts.en:
Seutatia L. is 29 and married with four children. She plants and harvests taamu (a large root vegetable like taro) for sale. Seutatia has three years of experience in this business. 

Seutatia needs a loan of 1,500 Samoan talas to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or about $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Seutatia joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Seutatia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en: Genelie Q. is from the village of Tampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Genelie is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Genelie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells both food and daily-use products and also buys and sells ocean-caught fish. Genelie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Genelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Genelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yeth's Group

texts.en:
Yeth S. is a 33-year-old married woman who was selected as the village bank president by the members, located in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province. The members of this village bank will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Yeth S. and her husband, Mr. Soeung Kimsong, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetables, rosemary and herbs for a living. They lack money to support the farm. Thus, Yeth S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables, herbs, aromatic plants, basil, etc. This couple has three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables, herbs, aromatic plants, basil, etc.

loans.name: Nansikombi

texts.en: Nansikombi S. began her pub business 12 years ago in Bugembe-Jinja with savings from a rental business. It is a business undertaking which, to say the least, has been worthwhile to her in terms of accrued profits over the years. Her first business was retailing. In a week, her profits add up to shillings 70,000. S. is married and has 4 sparkling kids. With this loan she is anticipating the purchase of more crates of beer, spirits and wines for resale at her pub.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of beer, spirits and wines for resale at her pub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Work Tool Maintenance

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José pertenece al banco comunal “La Hermandad” de la comuna de Maipú. Él tiene un puesto de  bazar y útiles de aseo, en una feria de su comuna, desde hace  11 años. Además fabrica pintura para el piso, oficio que le enseñó su cuñado. Comparte la mitad del puesto con su esposa, quien también trabaja con Fondo Esperanza y  confecciona, para vender, ropa de Barbie y ropa para el hogar, como por ejemplo sábanas, cortinas y manteles. Ambos trabajan todos los días de la semana en la misma feria,  pero en diferentes lugares de la comuna, ya que ésta va rotando. 
Con este préstamo, José comprará los materiales para fabricar pintura para piso y mercadería en general. Su sueño es arrendar un local establecido y  tener un vehículo, el cual le facilite el transporte de su mercadería, ya que ahora solo cuenta con un triciclo. 
José está muy agradecido de Fondo Esperanza, ya que gracias a los préstamos ha logrado adquirir más mercadería y aumentar sus ventas.
Maipú es una comuna ubicada al este de Santiago, capital de Chile. Designada como la comuna más grande de Chile es llamada Cuna de la Patria debido a importantes hechos históricos ocurridos en esas tierras durante la época de la Independencia.
texts.en:
José is a member of the “La Hermandad” (The Brotherhood) communal bank in Maipú.  He has had a stand selling house wares and cleaning supplies in a market in his commune for the last 11 years.  Besides, he also has a floor paint factory, an occupation his brother-in-law taught him.  He shares half the stand with his wife, who also collaborates with Fondo Esperanza; she makes clothes for Barbie dolls as well as items for the home like sheets, drapes and tablecloths.  Both work in the market every day but in different parts of the commune since the market rotates among them.

José will use this loan to buy materials to make floor paint and general merchandise.  His dream is to lease a fixed locale and have a vehicle which will ease merchandise transport because he currently only has a three wheel vehicle.

José is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza because thanks to the loans he has been able to acquire more merchandise and increase sales.

Maipú is a commune in the east of Santiago, capital of Chile.  It is the largest commune in Chile and known as the Birthplace of the Nation due to the important historical events that happened there during the Independence Era.

loans.use: For merchandise.

loans.name: Erdenetuul

texts.en:
Erdenetuul U. is 32 years old and lives with her husband, three daughters and son in Bayanhongor province in Mongolia. All six members of the family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her older two children both attend a local secondary school.

Erdentuul and her husband work in the family’s traditional shoemaking business out of their home. She began her own business in 1998 after assisting two people to make a variety of traditional boots in 1996. After many years of owning this business, she has gained significant experience as a shoemaker. For the future, she plans to expand her business and have her own work place. She is a hardworking person and is requesting a 120,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more materials to make boots.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Eugenia Raquel

texts.es:
Eugenia es una mujer  emprendedora, tiene la edad de 29 años, madre de tres hijos, se dedica al comercio de venta de prendas de plata, ropa nueva. El cual lleva varios años vendiendo y es su medio de ingreso.
Tiene el apoyo de su esposo, el cual labora como fontanero, lo que le ha permitido hacer mejora a su vivienda.
Con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de ropa variada de dama y caballeros, prenda de plata entre otros productos de cosmetico y ropa interior.
Como planes es poder seguir incrementado su negocio, que atreves de Afodenic se hace posible esta inversión.
texts.en: Eugenia is an ambitious 29-year-old woman and mother of three children. She works selling silver jewelry and new clothing. She has be doing this work for several years now and this is how she makes her living. She has the support of her husband, who works as a plumber, which has allowed her to make certain home improvements. She will use this funding to invest in the purchase of a variety of women's and men's clothing, silver jewelry and other products such as cosmetics and underwear. She plans to continue growing her business, thanks to the investment made possible by AFODENIC.

loans.use: Purchase of new women's and men's clothing and silver jewelry

loans.name: Twisungane Bahinzi Group

texts.fr: Emmanuel M. est commerçant des récoltes, et il est un membre du groupe Twisingane Bahinzi.  Il est marié, il a fini 6 ans d’école primaire, et il a 3 enfants entre 6 ans et 12 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des récoltes, puis vente des récoltes.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire et d’acheter et vendre directement des récoltes, et aussi ajouter agriculture et élevage pour augmenter la capital.  Il voudrait avoir beaucoup capacité d’autofinancement.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait payer les minervaux de ses enfants facilement, et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Emmanuel M. is a crop merchant, and he is a member of the Twisingane Bahinzi group. He is married, has finished 6 years of primary schooling, and has 3 children whose ages range between 6 and 12 years. One of his children attends school. He is going to use his loan to buy crops and then re-sell them. His strategy to increase his sales is to buy the crops directly, and also to add agricultural and animal-rearing activities to raise his capital. He would like to generate lots of auto-financing capacity. For his family, he would like to pay his children's school fees easily and satisfy the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell crops

loans.name: Jarin Yariel

texts.es:
El Senor Jarin Z., tiene 26 anos de edad, actualmente soltero, sin hijos, habita en la Comarca El Rodeo, de Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. Se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando Tomates y Maiz.
Esta actividad la ha realizado desde muy pequeno, el indica que mas bien es por tradicion, ya que todos sus antepasados se han dedicado a la agricultura.
El recuerda que desde la edad de 12 anos, se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos basicos y hortalizas; cuando ya estaba un poco mas adolesente, viajo a Costa Rica, fue a trabajar y recogio una cantidad de dinero, la cual vino a invertr a su pais.
Para diversificar un poco sus actividades tambien se dedica un poco a la ganaderia.
Realizo este credito para la siembra de Tomate y Maiz, y la compra de insumos agricolas.
Dentro de sus metas esta crecer con la siembra de estos productos y comprar maquinaria mas capacitada para producir mejor.
texts.en: Mr Jarin Z., age 26, is currently single and has no children. He lives in the Comarca El Rodeo, Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. he works in agriculture, sowing tomatoes and corn. He has done this work from a very young age. He says that this is tradition, and that all of his ancestors have worked in agriculture. He remembers that from the age of 12 he has sown basic grains and vegetables; when he was a little older, he traveled to Costa Rica to work and made some money, which he invested in his country. In order to diversify his activities a little he has also worked in livestock. He is taking out this loan to sow tomatoes and corn, and to purchase agricultural tools. Part of his goals is to expand his sowing and purchase better machinery for better production.

loans.use: the sowing of tomatoes and corn

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Desde niña Gloria Elena S. T. descubrió que tenía grandes habilidades para lo relacionado con la belleza, con el paso de los años supo que además de dedicarse a esta actividad deseaba ser independiente, pues además de tener la posibilidad de trabajar desde su casa así tendría la posibilidad de aportar con sus ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar conformado por su esposo y sus 2 hijas.

Tener su propia peluquería en un local amplio y con la capacidad de ofrecer diversos servicios para satisfacer a sus clientes es el sueño de Gloria, que por ahora trabaja fuertemente para lograrlo y que además necesita de un préstamo para adquirir implementos como plancha para el cabello, cepillos, secador, máquina para motilar, entre otros artículos necesarios para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
As a girl, Gloria Elena S. T. discovered she had great talent when it comes to beauty. In addition to pursuing this activity as a profession over the years, she learned that she wanted to be independent. This has given her the opportunity to work from home and use her earnings to contribute toward the household expenses accumulated by her husband and their two daughters.

Gloria has her own beauty salon set up in an ample location. Being able to offer different services to satisfy her customers has been Gloria’s dream and is now working hard to achieve it. She needs a loan to acquire equipment such as a curling iron, brushes, hair dryers, clippers, and other items for improving her business.

loans.use: Purchase a curling iron, brushes, hair dryers, clippers, and other items

loans.name: Edit

texts.es:
Edit vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 30 años, tiene una hija llamada Daniela de 2 años. Edit trabaja como psicóloga por las mañanas en el centro de salud de Belempampa los días lunes, miércoles y viernes desde las 8am hasta las 2:30pm. Edit tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa interior de marca LEONISA y UNIQUE, ellas ofrece a sus amigas y familiares los productos mediante un catalogo. Edit forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos. Edit se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Edit lives in the city of Cusco, is 30 years old, and has a two-year-old daughter named Daniela. Edit works as a psychologist at the Belempampa Health Center on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 8 am until 2:30 pm. She also has a small business selling LEONISA and UNIQUE brand underwear. She sells these products to her friends and family members through a catalog. Edit is part of the "Inti" Communal Bank, part of the Arariwa Assocation. She needs this loan in order to purchase more products. Edit is thankful for this opportunity being afforded her and commits to making her payments according to schedule. 

(Inti is a word from the Quechua language which translates to the word Sun in English)

loans.use: To buy more products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is from the village of Olingan. She is 54 years old, is widowed, and has two adult children and one school-aged child.

Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase feed for her pigs.

Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fresh fish to sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena O. is from Mayor's Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Nena is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a motor transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Nena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Duo Creciendo En Fe Dos Group

texts.es:
Duo Creciendo en Fe Dos: Este duo esta conformado por dos señoras,
Esta Doña Sonia Tiene 53 años de edad es casada tiene 10 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años tiene venta de articulos de sonsumo diario,el sueño mas grande de ella a corto plazo es invertir mas y surtir mas la tienda para poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos le agradece a Dios la oportunidad de poder salir adelante dia dia.El crdito lo solicita para compra de productos comestibles para su tienda.
Tambien esta Doña Marleny Tiene 40 años de edad,casada tiene 4 hijos ella tiene negocio de costureria,cosmeticos,y ahora a iniciado vendiendo Comida, ella Solicita a Fape un credito para poder invertir mas en compra de productos comestibles para elavorar comida,y asi seguir con su venta.
texts.en:
This community bank, Duo Creciendo en Fe Dos, has two members, both women.
Dona Sonia, 53, is married and has 10 children, 2 of whom still live with her.  She started the business 8 years ago, selling everyday grocery items.  Her main short-term goal is to invest in her business and, in turn, provide a better future for her children.  She is grateful to God for being able to support herself from day to day.  She will use this loan to stock her store.
Dona Marleny, 40, is married and has 4 children.  She operates a business selling sewing products, cosmetics, etc. and now she's starting a prepared foods business.  She is applying for a FAPE loan to raise the money to invest in the supplies she needs to establish the business and make the foods she will sell.

loans.use: Compra de productos comestibles,y compra de productos comestibles para elavorar comida.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: José Gabriel tiene 30 años, es casado y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Vive en el barrio Andrés Zapata. Su comunidad es emergente y pequeña y solo cuenta con ciertos  servicios básicos. Desde hace más de 3 años, gana su vida brindando servicios de bicicletas, repara las llantas, pintura de bicicletas, cambio de asientos, cadenas entre otras cosas. Realiza esta actividad durante todos los días. Este es su primer crédito que será destinado para la compra de llantas, herramientas, repuestos, cadenas, pinturas, calcomanías entre otras cosas. Le dará mayores ingresos y por consiguiente le permitirá solventar más sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
José Gabriel is 30 years old, married, and has one child in his care.  He lives in Andrés Zapata neighborhood.  His is a small and emerging community which only has access to some basic services.  For three years, Jośe has been earning a living providing a bicycle repair business.  He repairs tires, paints bikes, changes seats, changes chains, etc.  He carries out this business every day.

This is José's first loan and he will use it to buy tires, tools, spare parts, chains, paints, decals and other products.  This will make him more income and allow him to do a better job of covering his family expenses.

loans.use: to buy tires, tools, spare parts, chains, paints, decals and other products

loans.name: Ney

texts.es:
Ney tiene 40 años D. edad. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia,  que está ubicada en el caserío Peñarol  en el distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia D. Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural D. este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos D. agua y energía eléctrica. 

Ney se dedica a la crianza D. ovinos y vacunos así como aves D. corral como pavos y gallinas, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desD. hace más D. 6 años en la parte posterior D. su casa. El destino del crédito será para la compra D. alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. los ovinos, vacunos y aves D. corral, para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal para venderlos a un mejor precio. Con esta inversión, Ney podrá seguir creciendo en su negocio y aumentando sus ingresos. Con sus ganancias, Ney ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia. Agradece a los prestamistas D. Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ney is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in her own home which is located in the village of Peñarol, in TambogranD. district.  This is an agricultural area of Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.  Ney lives in the rural part of this district where they do not have access to basic services of water and electricity.

Ney's business is raising sheep and cows, and also poultry such as turkeys and hens.  She raises and fattens the animals and then sells them in the local market.  She has been in this business for more than six years and raises the animals in an area behind her home. 

Ney will use this loan to buy balanced feed to fatten her sheep, cows and poultry so that they reach an ideal size and weight.  She will then be able to sell them for a better price.  Through this investment, Ney will be able to continue growing in her business and increasing her income.  She uses her profits to help her husband to financially support their family.

Ney is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they give her in growing her business and providing her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her livestock

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es:
El señor Uriel Pérez Hernández vive en la Ribera llano Grande  Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con la señora Evodía Patricio Pérez y con quien procreo dos hijas keli Virgilia de ocho años y Dilieni  de dos años.

    El solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de madera para   fabricar muebles y luego venderlo, en  esta actividad lleva  cinco años y está contento porque le va bien  ya que con ello a estado sacando adelante su familia.

   Comenta que por su propia creatividad inicio a elaborarlos ya que tenía un tío  quien se dedicaba a esta actividad fue como le gusto y comenzó a practicarlo y gracias a adiós  con ellos está trabajando y obteniendo ingresos en su hogar.

     Su más grande deseo  es  mejorar su actividad, como mejor sea sus ganancias para darle lo más necesario a su familia que es lo más importante para él.
texts.en:
Uriel Pérez Hernández lives in La Ribera Llano Grande, in Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  He lives with his partner Evodía Patricio Pérez and they have two daughters: 8 year-old Keli Virgilia and 2 year-old Dilieni.

Uriel requested this loan to invest in buying wood to make furniture to sell.  He has been in this business for five years and he is happy because it is doing well.  Through his business, he is getting his family ahead in life.

Uriel comments that he started making furniture through his own creativity since he had an uncle who was in this business   He enjoyed it and started to make furniture himself.  Thanks to God he is working and making income for his household.

Uriel's biggest desire is to improve his business and his profits so that he can provide for his family's basic needs which is the most important thing for him.

loans.use: to pay for the wood that he uses to make furniture

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 26 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, trigo y papas. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de  material para trabajar. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa y comprar carro.

Le gusta escuchar música y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 26, is married living with his wife and children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has 4 children.

The “NUCANCHI KAWSAY” communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda canton 25 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  The members are in a variety of occupations like: farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

Luis is a corn, wheat and potato farmer.  Purchases take place in Guaranda’s market and sales happen at the wholesale market in that same city.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for work.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and variations in the weather.  His dream is to have a house and to buy a car.

He enjoys listening to music and watching television.

loans.use: to buy supplies for work.

loans.name: Sara Luz

texts.es: Sara  vive en el municipio de Soledad y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 24 años con los que sueña tengan un futuro exitoso y esta es su gran motivación,  por la cual trabaja persistentemente en su negocio de vender mercancia variada,  entre ropa, calzado toallas, jeanes y otros articulos; en esta ocasión  planea  comprar  mercancia especialmente para hombres, a propósito de la temporada del dia del padre que se acerca y genera un gran despliegue comercia que impacta las ventas de su negocio.  Sara inició su experiencia  de trabajo independiente,  vendiendo queso, en la medida en que aumetaron sus clientes, tomó esta  base de datos como referencia potencial,  para adicionar a su negocio la venta de mercancia    promocionandola entre ellos mismos  y cuando realizaron su negociociación con Sara  le recomendó nuevos compradores. En su negocio vende ropa, prendas de plata, sabanas, toallas, jeanes y muchos articulos mas,  dependiendo de lo que solicite su cliente. Sus ventas la realiza a credito y algunas de contado y sus compra a proveedores las hace en la medida en que recupera su inversión, esta es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domino para  aumentar su capital de trabajo y con su credikiva comprar  una vitrina, ropa, toallas, jean encargados. Su sueño es adquirir  su vivienda y todos los dias se levanta aportandole a este propósito mucho trabajo, para finalmente poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Sara lives in the town of Soledad and has two children aged 22 and 24.  She dreams of her children having a successful future.  This is her great motivation and why she works persistently in her business selling a variety of merchandise: clothes, footwear, towels, jeans and other items.

On this occasion, Sara is planning to buy merchandise aimed at men as Fathers Day is approaching and this great commercial opportunity positively impacts her sales.  

Sara started out in business selling cheese.  As she increased her number of customers, she added the sale of more goods to her business, promoting them to her customers.  As a result, they recommended new buyers to her.

In her business, Sara sells clothes, silver jewelry, sheets, towels, jeans and lots of other goods, depending on what her customers request.  She makes most of her sales on credit and some for cash.  She buys more products from her suppliers as she recoups her investment.  This is why she is approaching Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that she can increase her working capital and use her Kiva loan to buy a display case, clothes, towels, jeans and also fill orders.  Her dream is to buy her own home.  Every day she wakes up and puts a lot of work into this, so that she can finally achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and merchandise which she has orders for such as clothes, towels and jeans

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan is a 31-year-old woman who has her own small business selling various kinds of goods in front of her house. She has been in this business since 2004. She sells items such as pure drinking water, cosmetics, cooking ingredients, plastic goods, and other essential items. She is able to generate an average income of US$5 a day. She has a life partner in her husband, who is working in construction. He employs others to provide these services. Mrs. Lan is seeking a loan for her husband to use as working capital to broaden his business size.

loans.use: to use as working capital for her husband to broaden his business size.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía es natural de Chupaca, es viuda y en la actualidad vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace más de 2 años posee una tienda, siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, en un inicio tenía un restaurante, que se encontraba en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, sin embargo tuvo que cerrarla porque no le generaba las ganancias suficientes. Ahora con éste nuevo negocio, que instaló en su misma casa, vende productos de primera necesidad, así como también refrescos y gaseosas, para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, pues cuenta con mesas y sillas para que ellos tranquilamente puedan consumir algún producto. Sus hijos la ayudan en la atención hacía los clientes, pero lo que más prioriza es poder implementarla de más productos, que sean de mayor demanda de sus compradores. En adelante piensa retomar nuevamente el negocio de venta de comida. Fue invitada por una de sus vecinas que conforma un grupo solidario a formar parte de ese equipo con MFP y lo ve como una gran oportunidad para mejorar su negocio de las cuales esta muy agradecida y por tanto se compromete a responder puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en abarrotes.
texts.en: Sofía is a native of Chupaca. She's a widow and she currently lives with her 2 children in her own house, which she inherited from her parents. For more than 2 years, she has been running a grocery store. She has always been in business, and in the beginning she had a restaurant in the central district of the city. However, she had to close this because it did not generate enough income. Now, with this new business, which is located right in her house, she sells grocery staples along with soft drinks and sodas. To make her customers comfortable she has tables and chairs so that the can sit and consume any of her products in peace. Her sons help her to serve the customers, but what she most wants is to have more products that are in demand by her customers. For the future, she is thinking of opening a restaurant again. She was invited by one of her neighbors to join this loan group within the microfinance organization MFP and it seemed to her to be a great opportunity to improve her business and she is very grateful for this and so she is committed to making her repayments on time. She will use the money she is requesting to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy staple goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchase of chicken feed.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed to start a poultry business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed to start a poultry business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vive con sus dos hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad, tiene 8 años de dedicarse al negocio y ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante por medio del negocio.
Ella necesita compra frutas y verduras para ofrecer en el negocio, por lo tanto solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en manzanas, papayas, sandia, papas, güisquiles, plátanos y mas mercadería, con esta compra será mejor la atención que brindara a los clientes.
Para María el tener su propio local algún día, ha sido su mayor deseo, contando con clientela y ofreciendo lo mejor en frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
María sells fruit and vegetables.  She lives with her two children who are 20 and 25 years old.  She’s been in this business for 8 years and has managed to raise her children thanks to it.

She needs to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in the business so is asking for a loan to buy apples, papayas, watermelons, potatoes, chayote, bananas and other merchandise.  With this purchase customer service will be better.

For María, having her own locale one day with regular clientele to sell the best fruit and vegetables to has been her greatest wish.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Kabetou

texts.fr:
Kabétou est une femme  âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon. Elle a 2 enfants, dont un à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 4 ans.  
Kabétou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine, bassines et seaux pour toutes personnes dans un marché local de Lomé. Elle est la seule impliquée dans son activité. 
Kabétou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ustensiles de cuisine, des bassines et des seaux. Elle veut réinvestir dans son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kabétou voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer la vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kabétou, a woman of 33, is married to a mason and has two children; one of them goes to school. The older is 8 and the younger 4 years old. 

Kabétou has been working as a retailer since 2005. She sells kitchen utensils, basins, and buckets to all comers in a local market in Lomé. She is the only person involved in her business. 
 
Kabétou requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy kitchen utensils, basins and buckets. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Kabétou would like to grow her business. She says that with the profits she intends to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, basis, and buckets.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Después de quedar viuda, Carmen se dedicó a la venta de mercancía desde su casa, inició con artículos para el hogar y actualmente también vende zapatos. A sus 60 años de edad esta emprendedora se siente bendecida pues gracias a su trabajo genera sus propios ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. 

Con el tiempo espera tener un punto de venta propio en el que pueda ofrecer sus productos. Actualmente necesita de un crédito para comprar mercancía y así abastecerse para el fin de año y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
After becoming a widow, Carmen started selling merchandise from her home.  She started out selling household goods and now sells shoes as well.  At 60 years of age, this entrepreneur feels blessed because, thanks to her work, she makes her own income with which she covers her basic needs.

Over time, Carmen hopes to have her own sales location where she can sell her products.  She currently needs a loan to buy merchandise so that she can stock up for the end of the year and make more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en:
Saltanat is the leader of this borrower group. She is 46 and married to an electrician. She and her husband have two daughters and a son.  Her son and older daughter are employed, and her younger daughter is a student.  In order to earn money, Saltanat breeds cattle and sells dairy products.  In this way she contributes 6,000 soms to her family's budget. With money received from this loan Saltanat wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding.  If she is able to profit enough from her business, she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 33 años, es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y responsable; es casada y madre de tres hijos de 14, 12 y 06 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, lugar donde comparten la alegría de estar día a día juntos y sobre todo el sueño de tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida, actividad que empieza desde muy temprano, donde se dirige al mercado para comprar los productos frescos e insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos. Ya luego se establece en una agencia de transporte terrestre, en donde expende sus platillos, pues en estos dos años de trabajo ha logrado ganarse clientes, quienes son pasajeros y trabajadores de dicha agencia. Ella espera mantener en su negocio, pues sueña con algún día tener su propio restaurante. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien con sus compañeros de su grupo. Con el monto solicitado, montará un nuevo negocio, como es la venta de ropa, pues considera un negocio rentable; asimismo comprará utensilios nuevos.
texts.en:
Mery is 33 years old.  She is a cheerful, hard-working and responsible woman.  She is married and has three children aged 14, 12 and 6.  They live in their own home where they share the joy of being together day by day and, above all, their dream of enjoying a better quality of life.

Mery's business is selling meals.  She starts her work very early in the morning, heading to the market to buy fresh produce and supplies for making her food.  She sells her meals at a transport agency.  Over the two years she has been in this business, she has managed to gain customers: both passengers and people who work for the agency.  She hopes to keep working in her business as she dreams of some day owning her own restaurant.

This will be Mery's third loan from MFP and, up to now, she has got along really well with her fellow group members.  Mery will use the sum she has requested to set up a new business selling clothes.  She considers this to be a profitable business.  She will also buy new utensils.

loans.use: to buy new utensils and clothes

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Mrs. Ut is a 31-year-old married woman living with her humble husband. They have given birth to two children who are living under their care; they are attending school. Mrs. Ut is a borrower who comes from Ornlong Veng district, where she has lived with her husband for many years. She now works as a local construction worker alongside her husband. From this business activity, this couple can earn approximately $5 for each day. 

To upgrade their living and make a better quality of life, this modest couple would like to purchase a motorbike, but they are lacking some money, thus, they are seeking a loan from HKL, a partner with Kiva. They are hoping that this loan will help their family meet happiness and prosperity, and send their children to get a good education and a university degree. 

She and her husband are very thankful to all the kind lenders that help her family. This is the first loan for her with HKL and Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has for the last five years earned a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
Shirley es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Nueva Luz, tiene 23 años de edad es casada y madre de un niño de 4 años, su esposo trabaja en una finca Bananera cercana y su salario es muy bajo, por ello Shirley decidió iniciar su pequeño negocio, para colaborar con los gastos familiares y poder pagarse sus estudios, ya que solo pudo ir a la primaria. 
Este es el primer crédito que solicita a Fundación Mujer y se integró al grupo de mujeres ya que su madre que tiene muchos años en el grupo la motivó a integrarse. 
El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros y alimentos, para el cuido de los animales cuenta con la ayuda y el apoyo de su esposo y su madre.
Este crédito va ser de gran ayuda para Shirley, ya que le permitirá generar ingresos para aportar al hogar y tiene como meta seguir estudiando, al igual que darle estudio a su hijo.
