She has been in this business for some time and she has the support of her brother-in-law. This loan of $200 is to be used for the purchase of a refrigerator. She hopes that this purchase will help her to preserve the meat and other products which spoil quickly when they are at room temperature.

As regards the businesses of the other members of the association, they are: stove selling, a restaurant, neighborhood stores, a driver and a guest house.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Armando Lorenco

texts.pt:
Armando Lourenço L. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de filhos já maiores de idade. Fez somente 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo em missão de serviço, nessa altura veio sozinho. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de refeições e bebidas ha mais de 20 anos, não tem empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos (PROCREDIT), conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, vinho, ovos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

O seu maior sonho é construir uma mercearia. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro crédito para poder realizar seu sonho.
texts.en:
Armando Lourenço L. was born in Manjacaze District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has adult children.  Armando only finished fourth grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties.  He lives in his own house with his family and supports two grandchildren who live with him.

He left Manjacaze to go to Maputo on a work assignment, and at that time he came alone.  For more than 20 years he has had his own business selling meals and drinks.  He has no employees and earns about 5,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses.  He also saves some money in his bank account.

Armando had loans before with other banks (ProCredit).  He learned about Hluvuku through his neighbor, who is also a customer of this institution.  This is Armando's first loan with Hluvuku.  He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (beer, soft drinks, wine, eggs and other items) to increase the amount of stock he has.

His greatest dream is to build a grocery store.  Armando is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another to make his dream come true.

loans.use: Buy products (beer, soft drinks, wine, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man with four children .He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of opening up a boutique for brand new clothing and in the process transforming his second-hand clothing boutique which he is operating. He also dreams of educating his children so that they can have a better future. 

Amos wants a loan to purchase second-hand clothes to sell at his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothes to sell at his shop

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar G. M. tiene 43 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar G. M. is 43 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 7 children.

The 'El Batan' solidarity group is located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group has 21 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing cacao, cassava and corn.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Julio has been growing cacao, cassava and corn for a long time.  He buys his products in Bucay canton and sells them in Chillanes market and in the district.

Julio is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cacao crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to continue working. 

He likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sulochana

texts.en:
Mrs. Sulochana K. is 42 years old and lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores. Her son works in his own grocery store and her daughter works in a private office. 

Mrs. K. makes different varieties of pickles. It took her three months to train for this job. She sells her products in grocery stores and department stores. 

She is requesting for her fourth loan of RS 25000.00 to buy food material for her work.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Chok's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people living in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province are forming this village bank loan. The members of this village loan selected Mr. Chok O. as the village bank president.  The members will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mr. Chok O. is 39 years old.   He is a single man who works very hard on his farm to make a living. He is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land which he uses to cultivate rice and vegetables.  

He does not have enough money to operate this farm, so  he decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers to plow his farm and grow the crops.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es empleado, vive en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 34 años de edad, su familia está conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, tienen casa propia pero no está en buenas condiciones, Julio trabaja como motorista pero su sueldo no le alcanza para poder ahorrar y trabajar por mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar láminas y madera para construir una champa, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar las instalaciones  y la vistosidad de su vivienda, ya que lo que busca el hacer un corredor.
Su objetivo es mejorar económicamente para cubrir sus necesidades básicas de una forma más constante y poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Julio is employed and lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department. He is 34 years old and his family is comprised of his wife and two children ages 7 and 4. They own a house, but it is not in good condition. Julio works as a motorist, but his wages are not enough for him to save for home improvement.

At this time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase metal sheets and lumber to build a hut. This loan will help him improve the look and condition of his house since he is looking to make a corridor.

His goal is to improve financially in order to cover his basic necessities in a more stable manner, and to be able to help his children with their studies.

loans.use: Purchase metal sheets and lumber

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oñondivepa” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas y preparación de comidas rápidas.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Mirta es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la ventas de comidas y bebidas.
En fin, realiza varias actividades, es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos.
Ella tiene una familia muy unida y su marido también se dedica al comercio.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Mirta solicita el crédito para ampliar su copetín y poder comprar mas mercaderías.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee is made up of a group of neighbors from the town of Mariano Roque Alonso.

All the members of this committee carry out independent business activities such as selling and preparing fast food.  They are a very united group who are also able to carry out activities as a group that strengthen their camaraderie.

Mirta is one of the committee's members.  She sells meals and drinks.  She actually carries out several business activities as she is a very creative lady and her customers are always very impressed with her work.  She has a very close family and her husband also sells things.

Mirta is very happy with her business and the training that she receives as a member of her group.  She is requesting this loan to expand her small café and to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: To extend the small café (kiosk) where she works

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en: Valerie is 36 years old and she has 6 children. The eldest is 15 years while the youngest is 5 months. Valerie adopted 3 of the children. Valerie sells locally made beer, which is made out of sorghum. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more sorghum and hence make more profits. With the profits Valerie plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Buying sorghum.

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Iliana; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros su tienda se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa ella lo abre desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:0pm también vende otros  productos como golosinas,gaseosas,fideos,aceite entre otros, la socia a la vez vende tickets de bus a la ciudad de Puno, Arequipa y Puerto Maldonado ella tiene un stand en el terminal terrestre de Cusco ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes y así poder tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is Mrs. Iliana.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  She owns a grocery store where she sells essential items like rice, sugar and milk, among others.  Her store is located in her house.  She is open from 6:00am until 9:00pm.  She also sells other products like snacks, sodas, pastas, oil, etc.  At the same time, she also sells bus tickets to Puno, Arequipa and Puerto Maldonado.  She has a stand in the bus terminal in Cusco.  She is a very happy person with a lot of desire to move forward. 

She asks for the loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store so that she can offer her customers greater variety.  

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery store and be able to offer her customers more variety

loans.name: Reina De La Paz Group

texts.es:
El comité "Reina D. la paz" se formo con la unión D. varias señoras D. la localidad D. Santaní.
Todas las integrantes desarrollan actividades independientes relacionadas con la cría D. animales menores.
Las integrantes formaron  un grupo muy unidos y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalezen sus compañerismo, ahora ya están en su 2do ciclo.
La sra. Irma se dedica a la cría D. chanchos, para luego venderlos a precios considerablemente económicos pero que le dejan un margen D. ganancia, ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar más cerdos a modo D. criarlos y venderlos en cantidades mayores, a fin D. conseguir mayores ingresos a través D. la carne D. estos y la grasa que poseen.
texts.en:
The committee "Reina D. la paz" formed when several women from Santaní came together.  All of the members have individual businesses related to small-animal husbandry.  The members of the group are very united and together are capable of carrying out activities that strengthen their commitment, now that they are in their second loan cycle.

Mrs. Irma raises pigs, which she later sells at very affordable prices, but which still give her a margin of profit.  She asks for this loan to be able to buy more pigs so that she can raise and sell them in greater quantities. Her goal is to create more income from the meat and fat of these pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo  “LA BUENA AMISTAD”  esta formado  por 10 socias una D. las integrantes es Olga tiene 45 años y 03 hijos, ella vive en los Olivos, el negocio que tiene  lleva por nombre SERVICIOS D. CONFECCIONES RAVE, viene trabajando  en su taller mas D. 5 años ella presta servicios a diferentes negocios D. costura que le traen diferentes confecciones empezó solo con una maquina  poco a poco ha aumentado su capital y su mayor inversión en la actualidad son las 10 maquinas que tiene,  también ha podido construir su casa y darle a sus hijos una buena educación, Olga quiere tener su propia línea D. ropa juvenil y también exportar al exterior, su préstamo lo usara para la compra D. otra maquina para poder abastecer los servicios que le piden  sus clientes.

   * Olga es la tercera D. las paradas viste blusa morada con blanco.
texts.en:
The “La Buena Amistad" (Good Friendship) group is maD. up of 10 women.  One of the members is Olga.  She is 45 years old and has three children.  Olga lives in Los Olivos and her business is called 'Servicios D. Confecciones Rave' (Rave Dressmaking Services).  She has been working in her workshop for more than five years.  Olga provides services to different sewing businesses who bring her different garments to make.  She started out with only one sewing machine but has gradually increased her capital and her biggest investments to date are the 10 machines that she now owns.  She has also been able to build a house and proviD. her children with a good education.  Olga would like to have her own line of children's clothes and export her products.  She will use her loan to buy another sewing machine so that she can supply the services that her customers are requesting.

*In the photo, Olga is the third person along amongst the members who are standing.  She is wearing a purple and white blouse.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en: Susanita, who works hard to support her family, is married and has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years now. She is requesting a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for fishing boat repairs and more fish to sell. In the future, Susanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing boat repairs and more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroelectrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Maria Del Rosario L., ella tiene la edad de 24 años, estudio hasta es tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor jorge que trabaja en las torres de alta tension con el cual tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad.

Doña rosario nos platica que hace un poco mas de tres años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, un dia la invitaron a vender comida en el recreo en la escuela primaria de la comunidad y acepto desde entonces trabaja ahi vendiendo antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, tacos dorados, tostadas, tortas, gorditas y enchiladas), ella ademas de vender en la escuela vende en su casa por las tardes cena los fines de semana, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora ya que nos dijo "a mi no me gusta estar sentada esperando que el dinero caiga del cielo, a mi me gusta trabajar duro para sacar a delante a mi familia".

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de tomates, chliles, cebolla, maiz, carne, tortillas, papas, huevos, frijol,platanos, gas y aceite para la elaboracion de sus antojitos y despues venderlos.

ella espera qe con esta inversion su negocio prospere y deje buena ganancias ya que desea que en un futuro sus hijos estudien una carrera y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec, which has a large lake which provides abundant fishing and work each year.  It’s also known for the presence of the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam.

Maria Del Rosario L. lives in this community.  She is 24 years old, has a three- year high school education, and is married to Jorge who works on high tension power lines.  They have two children who attend the local elementary school.

Ms. Rosario tells us that she felt the need to go to work three years ago in order to help her husband with the household expenses and to help pay for their children’s education.  One day she was invited to sell food during the local elementary school recess and she accepted.  She’s been working there since then, selling Mexican food (empanadas, crunchy tacos, tostadas, sandwiches, gorditas, and enchiladas).  She also sells dinner from her home in the evenings on weekends.  She is a very hard working woman and tells us, “I don’t like to sit around waiting for money to fall from the sky.  I like working hard to get my family ahead.”

She needs this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, corn, meat, tortillas, potatoes, eggs, beans, bananas, gas, and cooking oil to make her food and then sell it.

She expects that this investment in her business will bring her good earnings.  She also wants to give her children a good life and for them to go to school and have good careers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, corn and meat.

loans.name: Fidel Ernesto

texts.es: Como todo padre de familia responsable, el señor Fidel Ernesto se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y para ello ha echado a andar su meta de mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellos por medio del mejoramiento de su vivienda en la realización de un porche para dar una mejora imagen a su casa y para que esté más protegida de cualquier situación adversa. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena cemento, bloque, hierro, estribo y clavos con la finalidad de iniciar con la labor de construcción en su localidad.
texts.en: Like all responsible parents, Mr. Fidel Ernesto is worried about the well being of his children and for them he has begun working on his goal of improving their living conditions. He wants to make home improvements by building a porch to make his home more attractive and secure. He is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, concrete block, iron rods, brackets, nails and also to pay labor costs.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies such as sand and concrete blocks to build a porch.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio, tiene la edad de 31 años, está casado y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El lo que pretende es realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia del maíz y el frijol que tiene sembrados. El cuenta con el terreno y la experiencia de los cultivos sembrados y lo que quiere es aumentar la producción asistiéndolos para así obtener mejores ganancias  y poder seguir adelante con el proyecto de granos básicos, creciendo como un agricultor de la zona y así poderle dar a su familia un mejor bienestar de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 31, is married and lives with his two children and his wife who are his main priorities.  He intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies to enhance his bean and corn crops.  He has the land and the experience farming and what he wants is to increase production by enhancing his planting to increase production and earn higher profits and thus be able to continue with his basic grains project growing as a farmer in the area and providing his family with better wellbeing.


This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 43 years old, is a gruel seller. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $11 per day. They have five children, 24, 20, 17, 15, and 13 years old. Two of them are still in school and the others are working in the factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $35 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees of her children, and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy wood to repair her house. This loan will help her family to have a proper house to live in, and the rest of the money she will use for her business to make more income for her family. She plans to enlarge her business to get more profit to enable her children to study till they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw materials to produce gara textiles

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Nueva Esperanza se conformo con la iniciativa D. la señora Isabel que se mostro muy interesada por el programa. Se informó y luego D. esto motivo a sus amigas y parientes y formaron el grupo. Este comité se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, Actualmente cuentan con 12 integrantes,culminaron el primer ciclo sin inconvenientes,han demostrado union y solidaridad entre las compañeras.
Ellas están muy contentas D. trabajar juntas, ya que saben que la unión hace la fuerza, y que por medio D. esa fuerza podrán llevar un poco mas D. ingresos a sus casas, con lo cual podrán vivir decorosamente.
La Sra Isabel se dedica a la cría y venta D. animales, desD. hace ya unos cuantos años. Comenta que esto le ha servido para poder paliar los gastos D. la casa.Sabe que todo su sacrificio algún día dará sus frutos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. mas animales, y ademas D. eso para la compra D. alimentos para los animales que cría y venD.. DesD. ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The  “Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] committee was formed on the initiative of Isabel, who was very interested in the program. She became informed and then motivated her friends and relatives and they formed the group. This committee is in its second cycle. At present, they have 12 members. They finished their first cycle with no problems and have shown themselves to be united and supportive as members. 

They are very happy to work together, since they know that united they are strong. With their strength, they will be able to bring a little more income home, and live decent lives. Isabel has raised and sold animals for several years. She remarks that this has maD. her able to help pay expenses in her home. She knows that her sacrifice will one day have results.
 
She is asking for the loan to buy more animals as well as to buy feed for the animals she raises and sells. She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunities it gives.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Scolastick

texts.en:
Scolastick is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

She has been in farming for 10 straight years, producing milk and vegetables.

She has made a loan request of 31,200 KES, her second with Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide milk for the family as well as more money to take children to better schools. 

She aspires to venture into the transport business.

She sees water insecurity as the source of challenges bedeviling the farming industry. She is very happy with Juhudi's services

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Martha Florencia

texts.es: Doña Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes lleva 11 años en su negocio y ha tenido avances, poco a poco a mejorado el aspecto del negocio en base a sus ventas, por ejemplo inicio con un pequeño local vediendo cosas basicas y poco a poco ha ido mejorando, ya vende mas mercancia y tiene fe en que sí empieza a vender productos que no vende le pueda ir mejor, sus sueños son poder tener una tienda mas grande y tener un segundo piso con mas productos que vender y en gran cantidad, ella quiere tener cajeros y vender ropa de buena calidad, zapatos, chamarras y productos de belleza, los desafios que doña Martha a enfrentado es que no se le gana mucho a los productos, como ella lo compra ya reevendidos es por esa razon que la ganancia va siendo menos, por ahora no tiene otra forma de conseguir mas barata la mercancia para su negocio, tambien nos menciona que si hay competencia y eso tambien afecta mucho, doña Martha tiene 4 hijos pero ya no tiene hijos menores de edad, sus 4 hijos son casados, ella tiene 35 años de ser casada y 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia  y su esposo no trabaja mas que en el campo.
texts.en: Doña Martha has run a general store for the past 11 years and has seen her business grow gradually over time.  She started with a very small store and has steadily added new products and items as more of her stock turned over with greater sales.  She seeks to expand her store and one day to even add a 2nd floor annex.  She hopes also to employ cashiers and to sell high quality clothing, shoes, jackets and beauty products.  Her profit margins are slim as she finds it hard to obtain her merchandise at wholesale prices.  Martha has competition in her region and this is also a challenge.  She supports 4 children, all of whom are adults and independent.  She has been married for 35 years and her age is 49.  She lives in her own house and her husband no longer works in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy inventory for a general store

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass, aged 38, is married, and has three children aged seven, five and four. In 1992, Abass established his readymade jeans business. He began his business because he wanted to be self employed and to earn his livelihood for his family. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Abass would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to add to his business, by purchasing sports shoes, men's jeans and short pants. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Abass plans to educate his children to the higher levels and he is very excited about his future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sports shoes, men's jeans and short pants

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 46 years old and married. He has a 20-year-old child.

Edwin is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He owns the land that he tills to plant rice crops. Edwin sells his harvest to rice traders. He said he earns about 9,000 PHP per month from farming.

Edwin requested this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.en:
Nurjamal is a resident of Kerben, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 35 and together with her husband, who is a taxi driver, she is bringing up four sons. The two older sons are at school and the other two sons are preschool age (under seven). 

A year ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Nurjamal started to sell fruits and vegetables. In this way she earns 4,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, with the profits gained from the trade, Nurjamal wants to purchase furniture to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Teofila Magpulong's Group

texts.en:
Teofila is married with four children. Teofila is 58 years old and lives in Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City.

Teofila sells hotcakes and puto to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending.

Teofila has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Teofila hopes to hopes to expand her snack vending. Teofila is the leader of a five-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Hassna

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 58 years old, a widow, and a mother to two children who work; they live with six family members. 

Hassna has been a tailor since 1980; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats, and trousers for women and kids. She has more than twenty years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is  well known in the surrounding areas. 

She is requesting a $2000 loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine, a generator, and to add more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread. She aims to make more money to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine, a generator, and to add more materials as buttons, zippers, and thread.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Edna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and gasoline per liter. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and gasoline. Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and gasoline

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo de 42 años vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad y se dedica a  vender accesorios para motocicletas. Su negocio inicó hace 13 años, cuando procedente de la ciudad de Bucaramanga, en el departamento de Santander, llegó a Barranquilla en busca de oportunidades de trabajo; fue así como decidió emprender un negocio con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos. Sus principales clientes, lo constituyen personas que trabaja transportando a través de  motocicletas, mercado  que cada día   aumenta especialmente en los municipios alrededor de la ciudad y al sur de la misma, así mismo propietarios de motocicletas que la usan para su uso personal.
Su meta es lograr un crecimiento empresarial, que le permita un mayor bienestar familiar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cascos, chalecos y otros accesorios. Su gran sueño es tener un local bien posicionado donde sea reconocido en toda la ciudad.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, 42, lives in the city of Barranquilla.  He has an 8-year-old son and works selling motorcycle accessories.  

He started his business 13 years ago, when he arrived looking for work from the city of Bucaramanga, in the department of Santander.  This was how he decided to undertake a business with the goal of generating his own income.  

His main customers are people who work transporting by motorcycle, a market that grows every day, especially in the towns around the city and to the south.  Motorcycle owners also buy for their personal use.

Gonzalo's goal is to achieve business growth, which would allow greater well-being for his family.  This is why he is requesting his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

He will buy helmets, jackets, and other accessories.

His big dream is to have a well-positioned place in which he will be recognized throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy helmets, vests, and other accessories

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 34 years old and is married with three children aged between six and twelve years old and she takes care of one child who is 25 years old. Violette owns a business selling wedding clothes.  This is her first successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7am until 8.30pm every day except on the weekend.  She currently employs one person to help her.

Violette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding more wedding clothes for sale.  With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, will reinvest in her business and she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding more wedding clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
Mme Maguette  est une dame de 31 ans  qui exerce le commerce depuis 10 ans .Elle est divorcée et n’a aucune charge. 
Elle vend de la friperie .Elle a fait parti d’un groupement ou elle a bénéficier d’un crédit de cent mille francs.
Avec le crédit elle veut acheter une balle de friperie.
Mme Maguette espère et souhaite agrandir son activité et ouvrir un magasin avec les bénéfices  acquis.
texts.en: Mrs Maguette is a 31 year olds woman who has been in the second-hand clothing business for 10 years. She is divorced and does not have responsibility for any other persons. She is a member of a loan group and has an individual loan of 100,000 francs. With this credit she hopes to purchase a bigger bag of second-hand clothes to re-sell. She hopes to, in the future, increase her activity and open a shop/stand with the profits from her sales.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is aged 29 years. She is a single mother of three children, living in Hoima, Uganda. She buys and sells charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She is faced with the challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. Her business goal is to expand to new markets and her personal goal is to educate her children to obtain a degree.
Beatrace needs a loan to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Lolita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Simukai Madzimai Group

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Juliet from Harare, Zimbabwe. She is married and has six children. She also cares for six dependents. 

Juliet runs a services business of tailoring table clothes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge she faces is electricity, which is in short supply. 

Juliet has requested a loan of $400 to buy fabric and tailoring materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to help in supporting the family. In the future Juliet plans to own a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring material.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Matekela Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 62-year-old married man with five children, one of whom attends secondary school. He is a hardworking farmer who has produced cassava, beans, maize and coffee for over 33 years. He has agricultural problems due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.
Joseph is requesting a loan for working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. His vision for the next five years is to expand his scale of production from 8 to 17 acres so that he can generate more income to pay for school fees, medical expenses and repairs to the family home.
In the photograph there are 17 members of the group, but only 14 members have taken a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 45-year-old married mother of seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. With a personal goal of educating her children, Grace operates a produce business and  is now requesting a loan to buy beans and ground nuts for resale. Despite the major hardships of price fluctuations and inflation, she has a vision of expanding her business into new markets and diversifying to include crop production.

loans.use: to buy  beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Emma is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Emma makes and sells ice cream. Emma has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 16,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Emma joined GDMPC. Emma is requesting a loan of 30,000 which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Keep Smile Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thùy is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years.
Thùy lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Thùy faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.
In 2013, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thùy has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Keep smile" group, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Thùy hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tailoring business.

loans.name: Salum

texts.en:
Salum is married with one child. He lives in Vituka in the Temeke District of Dar es Salam. Salum sells maize in retail. He buys the maize in large quantities from nearby regions, stocks it and resells it in retail.

Salum thanks all lenders for his first loan with Kiva. He is now requesting a second loan. With this loan he is planning to improve his business by having enough stock of maize, especially in the beginning of the rainy season. Because roads to up country are not easily passable during the rainy season, it is better to have enough stock now.

Extra stock demands some more packaging materials, carriage costs and storage costs. To make his plan work Salum is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Buh Margaret

texts.en:
Born on 05 June 1959, Margaret, a mother of five children, faces difficulties in raising income to take care of her children's education and health problems. Having received training in craft work she has already borrowed and repaid one loan amounting to $40. She plans to provide handicrafts such as dolls to the immediate community around her.

Given a loan of $400, Margaret will buy cloth, fibers, straw, and paint. She plans to repay this loan over a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, fibers, straw, and paint.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. C., 42 years old, weaves traditional Mayan woman’s clothing, including belts called fajas, exquisite tops called huilpiles and head dressings called cintas. One huilpil can take up to two months to make depending on the design, and sells for up to US$200. Some of the designs tell a story of the region and others are unique designs created by the artist. A hair piece called a cinta can take up to 15 days to create and can sell for US$35. As with all traditional women's clothing in the mountains of Guatemala, the special designs signify what village a woman comes from.

This loan will be used to buy more yarn for weaving. Before joining Friendship Bridge Maria had no access to credit and it was difficult to make money weaving just because the yarn was so expensive, costing up to US$40 for the yarn to make a huipil.

Maria´s husband died a couple of years ago when he got drunk and drowned in a lake nearby. With a total of seven children, she must now raise the five youngest by herself. The two teenage daughters who still live at home are also weavers and help support the family. They attend school on the weekends so they can work during the week. All the school age children attend school, something Maria never had the opportunity to do. She never learned to read or write, speaks just a little bit of Spanish, and signs her name with a thumbprint impression. Her native language is Ixil.

Maria's adobe home has a dirt floor and has electricity and water but the water must be boiled before consuming.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase yarn for her weaving

loans.name: Erdulfa

texts.es:
Erdulfa is 67 years old and she is a widow. She has had her grocery store for more than 30 years. It was one of the first grocery stores in her area. It is well located right next to a textile factory. She has three children, all of legal age and professionals, thanks to the work of their mom. Now, she lives with a 16-year-old granddaughter who helps her with the business and Erdulfa pays for her studies. She needs the loan to buy a freezer that will be very uselful during the summer to sell cold drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Erdulfa tiene 67 años, es viuda, tiene su despensa hace más de 30 años es una de las primeras de su barrio está bien ubicado, al costado de una fábrica textil. Tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, y profesionales gracias al trabajo de su mamá, con ella vive ahora una nieta de 16 años quien le ayuda en el negocio y ella le costea sus estudios. Necesita el crédito para la compra de un congelador que le será de mucha utilidad en el verano para la venta de bebidas frescas.

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Ndung Irene

texts.en:
Irene has suffered from an illness locally called "god fire," which manifests as burns on the skin. This illness, which is usually difficult to heal, drained her of almost all her finances. In addition, her husband abandoned her with four children.

Motivated by these problems, Irene became a GHAPE member. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to sell food which she cooks. It is her first loan, and she believes she will be able to repay it since she plans to sell the food near a school campus. The profit will help her provide basic needs for her children and buy medications for herself.

She plans to repay the loan in 12-15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase beans, potatoes, palm oil and corn

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
Mrs. R. is a member of the microfinance group “Cruz de Motupe II.” She is a street vendor who sells groceries on Thursdays and Saturdays in Jr. Caraz, Huaraz province of the Ancash department.

With this loan of 500.00 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 monhts, she will purchase detergent, 2 cases of soap, rice, and sugar.

She is 38 years of age and has 3 children. Her income allows her to provide for her children’s schooling and to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cruz de Motupe II”, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor, ella es ambulante, vende los días de feria (jueves y sábados) en el Jr. Caraz, provincia Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 01 paquetes de detergente, 2 cajas de jabón bolívar, un saco de arroz, y un saco de azúcar.

Ella tiene 38 años de edad y 3 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos y solventar los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Talmit

texts.es:
Talmit is a 39-year-old single mother with two daughters, Diana and Claudia; these girls have become her reason for being and for progressing. She has a small hardware store located in a very strategic zone in her city. She also sells gas to households so she can improve her family’s quality of life. Her responsibilities as both father and mother to her girls do not impede her progress. On the contrary, she has progressed much in these last few years thanks to her hard work and drive. She wishes to expand her businesses selling hardware and gas, and to do this she needs a loan that will make it so she can reach her objective in an unthinkably short amount of time. With your help, Mrs. Talmit can bring her daughters an education and well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Talmit, es madre soltera de 39 años, tiene dos hijas Diana y Claudia, niñas que se han convertido en su razón de ser y progreso, ella tiene una pequeña ferretería ubicada en una zona muy estratégica de su ciudad, también vende gas a domicilio de manera adicional con el fin de incrementar el nivel de vida de su familia.Su responsabilidad como padre y madre para sus hijas no le impiden progresar, al contrario ha progresado mucho en estos últimos años gracias a su esfuerzo y empeño: desea ampliar su negocio de ventas de artículos ferreteros y la venta de gas, y para ello estima de un capital que hará cumplir su objetivo en el tiempo menos pensado. Con tu ayuda la señora Talmit podrá brindarles a sus hijas educación y bienestar.

loans.use: Cash for the consolidation of her two small businesses.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat N., 24, is the mother of two little children; a son aged 4 years and a daughter aged 1. During the day she works making wine and raising pigs and can generally make around $3 each day in income. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver (a trailer attached to a motor-bike to transport passengers or goods) and can typically make around $7 each day in income.

Mrs. Khat N. hopes to use this loan to repair her husband's motor-bike and its trailer, which doesn’t work properly now. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Khat N. was not available.)

loans.use: To repair her husband's motor-bike that he uses for his business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
With the help of her beloved husband, Norma works providing transportation services with her own vehicle. Her daily work has allowed her to improve her family's economic situation and to save money for the nobel goal of purchasing another automobile. However, due to rising costs, Norma is seeking a loan to be able to afford the vehicle and achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Norma, con la ayuda de su querido esposo se dedica a trabajar brindando servicios de movilidad a su querida comunidad con su vehículo. Su desempeño diario le ha permito mejorar la situación económica de su hogar y le ha dado la oportunidad de ahorrar también, con el noble deseo de adquirir una herramienta de trabajo más; debido a que el costo de este inmueble se ha elevado solicita una cantidad de dinero como préstamo a fin de completar la suma y alcanzar su deseo.

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a forty-seven-year old married mother of four children. She sells maize and plantains in Accra’s busy Agblogbloshie market. She purchases her products through suppliers and then sells them to local hotels, restaurants, and streetside vendors in Accra.

She will use the loan to expand her inventory of maize and plantains and guard against price hikes. She hopes to use the proceeds of her increased sales to build a house some day.

Joyce is a member of the "Awurade Kae Me" (Remember Me, God) lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and plantains

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married and the mother of two children. She is a garden eggs farmer and also a retailer of the produce. It is now time for the farming season to begin and therefore she wants a loan to buy more seedlings and also buy more bags of garden eggs to increase her crop yield and sales. She believes this loan would help her expand her farming operations, to add more crops or vegetables during the next farming season. She also hopes to start saving for her children’s education. Beatrice is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garden eggs and seedlings for the planting season

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun P., 60, and her husband, Mr. Sen Van, 62, live across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1971 and have eight children--one son and seven daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. The remaining three children live at home. Two of the children weave silk at home, and the other child is in school.

Mrs. P. has been a silk weaver for two years. This is a skill that she learned from her daughters. She sells her finished products to a man from the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Van is a carpenter. Before starting this business, the couple grew rice and vegetables on their farm.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
The town of Cocani – Puno, is the hometown of Melina, a young mother who is humble but very hardworking. Ever since she got married, she decided to live with her family in the city of Juliaca. She started out weaving clothing by hand, but after much effort and many hardships, she managed to purchase her indispensable work tool—her power loom. She and her husband started the business, but for years, they were able to get only sporadic work. As a result, many times their household budget was affected. Nevertheless, they have managed to notably improve their living conditions little by little, which is why their clothing production has been continuously increasing. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to purchase wool so that she can continue manufacturing apparel, thus filling her customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El centro poblado de Cocani – Puno es el pueblo natal de Melina, joven madre que proviene de un hogar humilde pero muy trabajador, desde que contrajo matrimonio decidió radicar junto a su familia en la ciudad de Juliaca, se inició tejiendo prendas de vestir manualmente, pero con esfuerzo y algunas privaciones logró comprar su indispensable herramienta de trabajo, su maquina de tejer. Iniciaron esta actividad con su esposo y durante años sólo lograron tener trabajos eventuales y muchas veces la economía de su hogar se vio afectada. Pero poco a poco, lograron mejorar notablemente su condición de vida es por ello que continuamente viene aumentando el volumen de producción de sus distintivas prendas de vestir. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de lana para continuar con la fabricación de sus prendas y terminara sus pedidos.

loans.use: Purchase wool to make clothing

loans.name: Sohibjamol

texts.ru:
Sohibjamol A. lives in one of the far off villages of Yavan. She is a widow, who was left with 8 children to raise by herself. Sohibjamol needed to support them on her own. Her eldest son has grown and left to work in Russia, the rest of the children are still small and Sohibjamol and her son are the only earners in the family. Sohibjamol raises livestock. She raises cattle, fattens them and sells them to the butchers at the market.

Sohibjamol would like to take out an 8 month loan to purchase one more calf. This will increase her cattle headcount and allow her to earn more money.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Аминова Сохибджамол жительница одного из дальних кишлаков Явана. Вдова , оставшаяся с восемью детьми на руках. Одна поднимает их на ноги. Старший сын подрос и уехал на заработки в Россию. Остальные дети еще маленькие. Таким образом она и сын являются единственными кормильцами. Сама Сохибджамол занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков , откармливает ипродает на рынке , мясникам. Хочеи получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев для покупки еще одного бычка. Это увеличит поголовье скота и даст возможность заработать больше

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica B. vive en la calle Sgto de Munaypata  de la zona villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto, junto a sus padres y su marido quien actualmente esta prestando el servicio militar. Verónica se dedica a la compra de ovejas en el área rural, las cuales ella vende en las ferias semanales. Por lo que requiere crédito para comprar más ganado. Es su segundo crédito en Impro, pueden confiar plenamente en ella.
texts.en:
Verónica B. lives on the Sgto de Munaypata Street in the Cooperativa neighborhood of the city of El Alto together with her parents and her husband who is currently serving in the military. Verónica works purchasing sheep in the rural area, which she sells at the weekly markets. She requires a loan to purchase more livestock. This is her second loan with Impro and you can trust fully in her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Amah A. est revendeuse de friperies depuis plus de 2 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 39 ans, A. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants enfant. Elle souhaite par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant des habits à la mode afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante. Ses ventes lui permettront de se faire plus de profits pour satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
For more than two years, Amah A. has been a retail vendor of secondhand clothing in Lomé, the capital of Togo. The 39-year-old Amah is married and the mother of three children. With this loan she hopes to increase her trade by purchasing fashionable clothing to meet the needs of her growing clientele. Its sale would bring in more profit, enabling her to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of secondhand clothing for retail sale

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn H., 56, is a widow with six children, four sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside of the family home.  The other three children are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Simorn has been selling fruit for twenty years. She purchases fruit from her villagers and sells tH. at a market in Phnom Penh. Currently, she needs to build a  new staircase for her house because the old one is broken.  Since she lacks the money, she is requesting a loan of $500.

loans.use: To build new staircase for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fishnets and pig food

loans.name: Mrs. Yab Loeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yab L. is the village bank president for ten people who all live in Krang Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members will use the loan which they have obtained for different purpose. For instance, Mrs. Yab L. is requesting a loan to buy pig feed since her pigs are getting bigger and bigger and she hopes to provide enough food to her pigs so she can sell thE. for a better price.

Her husband, Mr. Chhin Thim, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. Mrs. Yab L. is 47 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

This is a village bank loan consisting of partially end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig feed to fatten her pigs for sale

loans.name: Mischel

texts.en: Mrs. Mischel S., 24 years of age, is married with two kids and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. With their simple abode, she works hard to support her family by buying and selling fish and other seafood products. Her husband also catches fish to add to her income. She wanted to make a good daily earning out from fish vending. She sells to a nearby town of Calamba and Plaridel market. Strong family ties are what motivates her to survive and be strong for her children. She greatest wish is to send all her children to school.

loans.use: Additional Capital for fish vending

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en Jr. Raimondi N° 948 de la ciudad de Pucallpa, Distrito de Callería, tiene 45 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, ella vende bebidas y productos variados en su casa, es socia de Manuelas Ramos 02 años. 
	
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró gaseosas, golosinas, una vitrina chica para mostrar sus golosinas y otR. productos como limones, plátanos, tomates, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,100.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una vitrina grande, golosinas, gaseosas, agua mineral, verduras, frutas, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.

Esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y no la defraudara.
texts.en:
Miss Gladis, belongs to the Communal Bank called "Las triunfadoras", located in Raimondi N ° 948 of the city of Pucallpa, District of Callería. She is 45 years old and she has 2 children. Her husband is a taxi driver and she sells drinks and different products at her house. She has been partner of Manuelas Ramos (Kiva's partner) for 2 years. With first loan of 300.00 Nuevos soles ($90) she bought soda drinks, sweets, a small display cabinet to show her sweets and other products like lemons, bananas, tomatoes, etc. With this loan of 1,100.00 Nuevos Soles ($350), she will buy a big display cabinet, sweets, sodas, mineral water, vegetables, fruits. She gets up quite early to serve her clients. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her and she will not disappoint them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a big display cabinet, sweets, soda drinks, mineral water, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi M., 30, is single with four children. She has four years of experience in producing and selling Samoan handicrafts and souvenirs. She sells to the Fugalei market customers five days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

SPBD loans are Naomi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. To improve her business and also her home, and to support her kids' school fees, she really needs this future financial support so that her family will improve their way of living.

loans.use: Purchase tools to use for her crafts

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es casada tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 7 años, los tres últimos están en la escuela estatal. 
Milagros tiene su negocio de  “eventos Jams, cuando se caso su esposo trabajaba animando fiestas, en eventos, ella desde entonces lo ha apoyado en todo y gracias a Dios están surgiendo tiene.
Milagros necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la compra de un  pawer, luces y hacer mantenimiento a sus equipos. 
Desde que esta en Finca, ha recibido orientación de cómo administrar mejor su negocio, ella lo comparte con su esposo, también gracias a los prestamos han podido invertir y comprar una filmadora, parlantes. 
El sueño de Milagros es tener una empresa de eventos.
texts.en:
Milagros is married, and is 39 Years old. She has four children. They are 18, 16, 12, and 7 years old. The youngest of the three go to a public school. Milagros has a business called “Jam’s events”, in which her husband is the MC at events. He supports the family, and thanks to god they are getting by. Milagros needs a loan $975 (3000 Soles), for the purchase of a generator, lights and the maintenance costs for their equipment. Ever since she joined Finca, she has received guidance of how to better administer this business, she shares the information with her husband, and also thanks to the loans they have been able to invest and buy a video camera and loudspeakers. Milagros' dream is to have an event organizing company.

(Translated by Nigel of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milagros needs a loan $975 (3000 Soles), for the purchase of a generator, lights and the maintenance costs for their equipment.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
T. Vũ is a 50 year-old female living in the town of T. Hoá. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined TYM Fund (a Kiva partner) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to build shelter for her livestock. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To build shelter for her livestock

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 52 year old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Nadia has been working as a hairdresser from her house for twenty years. She also does makeup for her customers. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase makeup for her salon. This is the first time that Nadia has requested a loan. 
Nadia is special in her work because she does it well and knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her work, she didn’t face difficulties. Nadia decided on this type of work because of her experience, and she also like the contact she has with her clients. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by purchasing a hairdressing shop.

loans.use: To purchase makeup for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky A., a 36-year-old mother of four children, lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. Her husband works as a farmer on their own small parcel of land, growing a variety of bananas, while Vicky operates a variety store that sells goods such as sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

She is now requesting a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) of Php 11,000.00 to purchase additional items for her business. With this money, she will be able to meet customer demand and generate a higher income that will provide the family with a more comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her store.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 042 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Tuyên N. Thị (100) is a 55-year-old female who lives in Thanh Hoá. Tuyên is the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 042 - Quảng Hưng (18.01.042 ).

Tuyên is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Tuyên owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling river-caught fish in the local community. Tuyên has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1800000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Tuyên joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 1963500 VND which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be Tuyên's second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyên successfully repaid a previous loan of 1626900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She used the previous loan to buy more fish to sell. Tuyên plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement the family''s income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

  • C. Thị Hà (101) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 1963500 VND loan to support her general store.
  • Vũ Thị Nhâm (102) is a 67-year-old female who is requesting a 1963500 VND loan to support her general store.
  • N. Thị Hoàn (103) is a 60-year-old female who is requesting a 1963500 VND loan to support her livestock business.
  • N. Thị Tú (111) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 1963500 VND loan to support herservice-based business.
  • T. Thị Hoa (105) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 1963500 VND loan to support her general store.

About the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Tuyên N. Thị (100) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Tuyên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 042 - Quảng Hưng (18.01.042 ). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch and bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở sông trong cộng đồng địa phương. Tuyên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyên kiếm được khoảng 1800000 VND. Vào 2008, Tuyên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Tuyên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,626,900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua cá bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1,963,500 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. C. Thị Hà (101) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1963500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. Vũ Thị Nhâm (102) là 67 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1963500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 3. N. Thị Hoàn (103) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1963500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. N. Thị Tú (111) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1963500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 5. T. Thị Hoa (105) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1963500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả and giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng and chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: G. Josephine est née vers 1959 à Affanmè dans la Commune de Dangbo dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Josephine est mariée à GODONOU Fulbert employé dans une boulangerie de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Josephine est mère de cinq enfants dont encore trois à sa charge. C’est les fruits que Josephine vend de façon ambulante à Cotonou. Josephine fait ses provisions de fruits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Josephine a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé ; et Josephine rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients, Josephine sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Josephine was born around 1959 in Affanmè in the community of Dangbo, in Ouémé county in southern Benin. She is married to GODONOU Fulbert, employed in a bakery in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Josephine is the mother of five children, of whom three are still in her care. Fruit is what Josephine sells door-to-door in Cotonou. She gets her provisions of fruit at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She has already benefited from three loans with Alidé and has always repaid them without any difficulties at all. To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more, she is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pineapples, papayas, mangos, and avocados

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora  Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estado civil casada, y es madre de 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Estación Chimu.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la elaboración de artesanías en totora (planta de la zona). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material quesana y chillihua, con ello Julia va a elaborar sus artesanías en totora, también quesanas (tejas o calaminas).

Su deseo es seguir trabajando, y más adelante poner una tienda de abarrotes en la comunidad.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones  y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the Las Totoritas Community Bank, which is located in the Chimu community, Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 36, married, and she has three children. She has a third grade education. She lives in the Estación Chimu neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN in making handicrafts from “totora” (a regional plant). She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy material called “quesana” (rush) and “chillihua” (wood), which she will use to make her totora reed handicrafts. She will also make “quesanas” (a type of rush mat).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy quesana (rush) and chillihua (wood) to make her handicrafts

loans.name: William Genaro

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años, en el municipio de Telica y en su propia casa de habitación el señor William C. se dedica a su actividad pecuaria por medio de la crianza de cerdos los cuales son alimentados por él mismo y criados con el propósito de sacarles el máximo provecho.

La crianza la realiza en su localidad y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de la inversión en la actividad por medio de la compra de un cerdo para la crianza. Es por este motivo que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para proceder a la compra del cerdo y así continuar en el mejoramiento de vida en conjunto con su familia.
texts.en:
For 15 years William C. has been raising livestock at his house, which is in the Telica municipality. He raises pigs. He feeds them and takes care of them in order to get the best price for them. He raises them in his town. He now comes to Ceprodel because he needs a loan to buy a pig to raise. That is why he hopes that Ceprodel will give him the loan to buy the pig. That way he can continue improving his life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pig

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El grupo “Guadalupe” esta representado por la señora Carmen Silvia y conformado por 16 socias las cuales van cursando ya su S. ciclo demostrando honestidad, responsabilidad y  sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante; la mayoría D. sus miembros se dedican a la venta D. comida, pan, empanadas, verduras, colchones abarrote y a actividades como la atención en centros D. estética, transporte D. pasajeros y al servicio D. limpieza. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo adquiriendo mercaderías, insumos y materiales para seguir generando mejores ingresos que cada día se traducen en mejores oportunidades para sus familias, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas con la institución.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe Group, represented by Ms. Carmen Silvia, is comprised of 16 members who are currently in their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated honesty, responsibility, and above all, the desire to get ahead. The majority of the group members sell bread, empanadas (stuffed pastry), vegetables, mattresses, and groceries. Other members work at a beauty salon, or proviD. cleaning or transportation services. Competition is high, but the members have lots of experience and they know how to move their businesses forward by offering a variety of high quality products. They need this loan in order to increase their working capital to purchase merchandise, supplies, and materials so that they can keep generating better profits, which translates into better opportunities for their families. For this reason, they are very grateful for the trust they have been given to keep working with the institution more vigorously.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn A. is a 36-year-old mother and a rice grower. She has two children, who are her inspiration to work hard. Her dream is that some day she will have a well-established business which would provide all the funds she needs to pay for her children's college education. Roselyn started her business in 1990 and she says that her investment has been tears, sweat, hard work, patience and a small amount of savings. She maintains that it has been worth it because her rice farm income has been very helpful in meeting her family's daily needs.

Roselyn plans to buy fertilizers and seeds with her loan of 15,000 PHP, making it truly worthwhile. She is hopeful for a better yield this time, especially since her children's needs are growing in number. Roselyn says that she likes CEVI's services because it charges the lowest interest rate, currently 2 per cent a month, making a loan very affordable to repay.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline U. is 28 years old an is married with one child, 12 years old. She also has one dependent little child, 1 year old.
