Jacqueline has been in the business of selling clothes for one year, working almost ten hours a day and creating a job for one employee. But the profit is still low and, for that reason, Jacqueline is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company to expand her business through purchasing more clothes to sell.

By using this new loan in her business, Jacqueline hopes to earn more profit than before. Through accessing this new loan, Jacqueline has a hope for the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary H., 54 (shown in the picture with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Yet Prum, 61, have been married since 1975 and have six children - four sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, one son is a construction worker, one daughter works in a garment factory and another son is a driver. They are living in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sary and her husband are farmers. To earn extra income to support the family, Sary started a new business selling meal in her village. She is applying for a loan of US $300 to use for this new business.

loans.use: To use for her new business selling meal.

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en:
This is Habibu B.. Habibu is seeking his very first loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. He wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to help pay school fees for his children and to buy house-building materials. 

Habibu is now 35 and married with five children. Habibu’s children are attending schools: three are in secondary school and two are in primary school.

loans.use: Pay school fees and buy house-building materials

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas P., age 56, lives in the province of Pursat, which is the best territory for farming. She is a married woman who has given birth to one child who is married and has already started a new home.

Meas P. and her husband own a big farm that they inherited from their grandmother. They grow various crops as well as raise many pigs on it.

Meas P. hopes to have cow for her farming business but she doesn't have enough money to buy one. So she decided to request a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to be used to buy a cow for plowing their land. She will use the rest of the loan for pig-raising.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing her land and to use for pig-raising

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose sells sarongs and lace fabrics at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is a hard-working woman. She is 30 years old and single, without children. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and lace to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more sales during this season. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and lace to sell

loans.name: Holga

texts.es:
La socia HOLGA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su picantería (tradicional restaurante donde se sirven comida y bebidas en especial la chicha de jora). Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para y aumentar el capital del negocio de la picantería comprando utensilios de cocina, sillas y mesas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ms. Holga is a humble mother who belongs to the Virgen Purificada -Angostura Community Bank. She is 25 years old, lives with her husband and has two children. She lives in the district of San Jeronimo in the community of Angostura, which is located south of Cusco. Along with her househould duties, she runs a traditional restaurant. They serve food and drinks, especially chicha de jora, a traditional Peruvian drink. She has run this business for several years and she has done well thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. Our partner, Holga is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother that wants to improve her family's condition. She wants a loan for her restaurant business so she can buy kitchen utensils, chairs, and tables. Holga is thankful for the opportunity offered by the bank ,and she promises to fulfill the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils, chairs, and tables

loans.name: Zainab Ali

texts.en: For the last six years, Zainab has been selling charcoal to frequent customers.  She has one employee and faces the business challenge of unreliable transportation of charcoal.  Her business is at Makongeni Phase 4, a semi-urban area near the town of Thika.  She will be using the requested loan of KES40,000 to buy more charcoal.  In addition, she sells clothes, such as jackets.  In the future, she wants to expand her business and own a car which she will use for transportation.  Zainab is divorced and has two children.  She describes herself as hardworking, jovial and innovative.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Doris Judith

texts.es:
La señora Doris Judith,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.  

Doris Judith, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que ejerce. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la línea: Esika, Unique y Avon y ya lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad.
En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada. Doris Judith, vende sus productos de belleza al contado y al crédito, con pagos de manera diaria, semanal, quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00, comprará productos de belleza como: colonias refrescantes, perfumes para damas y caballeros, billuteria como aretes, collares y anillos. Anhela implementar más su negocio y contar con una buena cantidad de productos de belleza en stock, de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes fijos.

Doris Judith, sueña con crecer en el negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Doris Judith belongs to the communal bank Las Abejitas, in the district of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martin. She is 41 years old, single and the mother of one son that she supports. Doris Judith is a woman who is very dedicated to her family, happy and charismatic—qualities that help in her business. She sells cosmetics from various lines: Esika, Unique, Avon. She has already been doing this for several years and has a loyal clientele. She sells these beauty products for cash or credit with payments on a daily, weekly, biweekly or monthly basis. With this loan of 3000 PEN she will buy beauty products such as scented deodorants, women’s perfumes, and men’s cologne. She will also by jewelry to sell: earrings, necklaces, and rings. She longs to increase her business and have a large inventory of beauty products for sale, thus satisfying her regular customers. Doris Judith dreams of growing her business and becoming a star in sales. She would like to thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to develop personally and professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Don

texts.en: Don has a full-time job working with the United States Government. He was also looking for a way to create a stream of extra income and become his own boss, so he researched possible businesses. He discovered an ATM (Automated Teller Machine) franchising opportunity which met his criteria. By placing and maintaining ATMs at hotels and other travel businesses in the Washington D.C. area, Don earns part of the convenience fee busy travelers pay. Don’s ACCION USA loan will allow him to expand by adding another ATM placement. He plans to continue growing his business, hoping to eventually hire staff. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To add another ATM placement

loans.name: Albertine Kossiba

texts.fr: Née en 1967 à Abomey Calavi au Bénin, B. Albertine Kossiba est mariée à CADJA Eugène, un mécanicien. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a 18 ans environs que Albertine Kossiba s'est installée au quartier Gbodjè dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Albertine Kossiba n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses différents besoins, Albertine Kossiba vend des condiments (tomates fraîches, piments, oignons, etc.) et divers autres produits (huile de palme, boîtes de lait, sucre, poissons fumés, etc.) dans une barraque size à son domicile. Albertine Kossiba s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Albertine Kossiba mène cette activité depuis 8 ans, et a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé et qui lui a permis d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. La clientèle de Albertine Kossiba s'agrandit au jour le jour et elle n'arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients, compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. C'est pour cette raison que Albertine Kossiba sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in the town of Abomey Calavi in Benin, B. Albertine Kossiba is married to Cadja Eugene, a mechanic. The couple has five children in their care, four of whom are their own children. Some of the children are attending school. For the past 18 years, Albertine Kossiba has lived in the neighborhood of Gbodjè in the town of Abomey Calavi, where she lives with her husband and their children. Together, the couple takes care of the needs of the family. Albertine Kossiba was not able to attend school. In order to handle her clients' varying needs, Albertine Kossiba sells condiments (fresh tomatoes, hot peppers, onions, etc.) and various other products (palm oil, cans of milk, sugar, smoked fish, etc.) in a booth in her house. Albertine Kossiba supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Albertine Kossiba has been doing this business for 8 years and has already had one loan with Alidé, a loan which was fully repaid and which enabled her to increase her sales. Albertine Kossiba's clientèle is growing everyday and she cannot satisfy all of her clients, given the small financial means she has at her disposal. It is for this reason that Albertine Kossiba is requesting a second loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 crates of tomatoes, 2 crates of onions and hot peppers, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 29 years old and is married with three children aged 3, 5 and 7. He lives with his family in the Northern Province of Rwanda, Musanze district, in the village called Gashaki.

It is in Gashaki where Janvier’s salon business is located. He has been an entrepreneur for many years but, although he is experienced in this service, his profit is too low to expand his business meaningfully.

Janvier is requesting his loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing new equipment, including electric hair trimmers, modern chairs and so on. With these materials he hopes to earn more profits.

Janvier has been in the salon business for twelve years and employs three people from his community. Once the profits increase, Janvier expects to grow his number of employees. The hours of his salon are 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day, even on the weekend, working in shifts so that he satisfies his customers. His business has been well organized for a long time.

loans.use: To buy electric trimmers and modern equipment

loans.name: Sam Ang's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Ang C. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Pred Ta Keo village, in Kandal province. She is the leader of a group loan, consisting of 4 people offered by AMK. The members of this loan will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items for different businesses.  Mrs. Sam Ang C. makes snacks for consuming with alcoholic beverages. Her husband, Mr. Rattana Yun, is a chef. In this business they now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their business. Thus, Mrs. Sam Ang C. is requesting for 200,000 Riels to buy extra food for her snacks business. Mrs. Sam Ang C. is a mother of two children who all are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy extra food for snack business.

loans.name: Tederlita

texts.en:
Tederlita T. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Tederlita is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Tederlita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Tederlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tederlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tederlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. 

Tederlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Tederlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Esperanza (Women of Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Felicia’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Felicia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cleaning products and women's underwear by purchasing more merchandise in the main markets and then reselling them in her community.

Felicia will use the profits to invest in her home by repairing the roof as well as saving towards her dream of opening a pawn shop. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bras, women's underwear and cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Lemeria Ole

texts.en:
Lemeria Ole K. is 54 years old. He is married to Naramat K. and he is the father of eight children. 

Lemeria is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last fourteen years.

Lemeria learned about KADET from a friend who is already a KADET registered client. This will be Lemeria’s first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 on maize and 20,000 on wheat farming.

With the profits Lemeria hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize and wheat production. He also hopes to buy some livestock and start livestock farming.

Lemeria’s future dream is that he will be able to practice large-scale farming for both wheat and maize. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To plant maize and wheat

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita P. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 49 and married with eight school-aged children.  Merlita has a tailoring business providing general  alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase a transport vehicle for her business. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her childrens' tuition fees. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Lux

texts.en:
Lux K., 23, is married and resides with her husband and young child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. K. is employed at a golf club for an income of USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is an equipment operator at the gold club, earning an income of about USD 3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase piglets to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, D. 34 años, es una madre D. familia muy laboriosa, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores en su casa propia.Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. diferentes tipos D. comidas. Todos los días, desD. muy temprano,  prepara diversos platos típicos peruanos (chanfainita, arroz  con pollo, tallarines, ají D. gallina, seco a la huachana, entre otros). Y con su carreta transporta sus ollas, bien cubiertas a  7 cuadras D. su casa, hasta un ovalo que es muy concurrido por cantidad D. personas. Sus comensales son los chóferes D. los buses y motocarros, quienes gustan D. su sazón. Ella se inició con la venta D. uno a dos platos, y en la actualidad ofrece  variedad y cantidad D. D. comidas, que sus comensales le sugieren que prepare.  Además se siente muy complacida por su actividad, y ya lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad, también comenta que su mayor anhelo es construir su casa D. material noble, para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos.Este es el onceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, para D. ese modo no perjudicar  a sus compañeras D. su grupo, quienes la apoyaron en sus inicios.Maribel tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. cantidad D.  mercadería en comestibles (al por mayor)  y también quiere  renovar su carreta D. trabajo, que le es indispensable para su negocio, pues quiere continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Maribel, 34, is the mother of a very hard-working family. She lives with her husband and their three young children in a house that they own. She prepares and sells different types of food. Every day, starting early in the morning, she prepares various typical Peruvian dishes (chanfainita, chicken with rice, tallarines [noodles], hen chili, and seco a la huachana [beef stew flavored with cilantro], among others). She covers her pots well and uses her cart to transport them seven blocks from her house, to a traffic circle that is crowded with many people. Her customers are the drivers of the buses and motorcars, who like the seasoning of her dishes. She started her business selling just one or two dishes, and now she sells many different foods, based on what her customers suggest that she prepare. She feels very pleased with her work, and now that she's been doing it for 11 years, she also commented that her greatest dream is to build her house from more sturdy materials, in order to improve the quality of life for her children. This is the eleventh loan that she has taken out through Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to be punctual with her repayments, and in this way, she will not negatively affect the other members of her communal bank, who have supported her in her efforts. Maribel has planned to invest the money she is requesting in the wholesale purchase of ingredients. She would also like to make repairs to her cart, which is indispensable for her business and therefore she wants to keep up on its maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients for her business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 47 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que sale a vender sus productos, ya se levanta muy temprano a trabajar desde las 5 de la mañana a las 7 de la noche que llega a su humilde vivienda, Maria tiene 1 hijo de 16 años a su cargo ella dio inicio a esta actividad con sus propios ahorros, es que ha logrado establecer este negocio es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como perfumes, cremas, ropa interior, calzado y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 47 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. She wakes up early at 5am to begin her work and then returns to her modest home at 7pm. María has a 16 year old son who is under her care.

She started her business using her own savings and has succeeded in keeping it stable. María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes, crèmes, undergarments, shoes, and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, undergarments, shoes, and clothing

loans.name: Luganda Kulya Group-Kampala

texts.en: The trend now in Uganda is to do business and get wealthy with time. It is a sharp contrast with the emphasis that was laid on education by most people in the 1970s and 1980s. The situation today favors business undertakings rather than white collar jobs, which are hard to come by. In keeping with this stream of thought, 35-year-old N. Aisha made a decision to start her own tailoring business five years ago. With 100,000 and 400,000 shillings as weekly and monthly profits respectively, she is one happy woman. All of her five children are doing well at school and she is proud of the fact that she is paying their fees. With this loan, Namirima wants to buy more cloth to make more clothes to sell on a large scale. She hopes this will enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Math A., 54, is a widowed mother blessed with four children: two are single and two are married and live separately. Math A. currently buys and sells used goods to earn a living. One of her single children assists her in operating the business. Math A. owns a trailer that she currently uses to transport the used goods, but it is too small side and unable to carry all of the items. Thus, she proposes to use her loan money to purchase another trailer, which will allow her to transport more used goods. Math A. intends to use the rest of the loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer and to increase her business capital

loans.name: Germina

texts.en:
Germina N. lives in the Mengo Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has seven children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren).
Germina has a business selling passion fruits. She has been in this business for less than a year, and she works six days a week. Germina sells her products at the market on a retail basis. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy sacks of passion fruits. She also generates additional income through her rental rooms.
The main business challenges for Germina are seasonality and thieves. Her goal and aspiration for the business is to sell wholesale only. Germina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding her family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of passion fruits

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en: Ponciana P. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 46 years old. Ponciana is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ponciana raises pigs for breeding. Ponciana has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ponciana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ponciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Ponciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Ponciana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $163 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es: La señora Ivania F. M., tiene la edad de 41 años, habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casada, y su esposo labora como conductor, apoyando a los gastos del hogar, tiene 2 hijos uno es pequeño de 4 años y el otros de 14 años, ellos estudian la escuela secundaria y el preescolar respectivamente, ella es administradora de su propio negocio de venta de productos domésticos, personales, abarrotes, ella comenzó su negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo propio, ella era maestra de primaria, y con sus ahorros y liquidación, inicio su negocio, ellos habitan en una humilde casa, y es para su hogar que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción  que permitan edificar un muro en la parte trasera de su hogar, que favorezca a la seguridad y comodidad del pequeño sobretodo por que el juega en esa zona de la casa.
texts.en:
Mrs Ivania F. M. is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is married and her husband works as a driver, supporting the household expenses. They have two children: one is only four years old and the other 14. They go respectively to pre-school and high school.

She runs her own business selling household products, personal items and groceries. She began her business through her own efforts; prior to that she was a schoolteacher and thanks to savings and her settlement was able to make a start.

They live in a humble house. It is for her home that she is seeking a loan: to buy construction materials and build a wall in the back of the home. This will provide more safety and comfort, particularly for the small one who plays in that area of the house.

loans.use: Construction of a wall in the back of her home

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis es mecánico, vive en el barrio 30 de marzo de la zona radial 10, dedica a este rubro desde hace tres años, él es una persona joven y muy responsable, es el segundo crédito que solicita para comprar un gato hidráulico y mas herramientas como: Llaves, que necesita para equipar el taller, el vive en casa con sus padres y contribuye a la economía del hogar. Quiere agrandar su taller porque ha aumentado en estos meses sus clientes que requieren sus servicios,  esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luis is a mechanic. He lives in the 30 de marzo neighborhood of radial zone 10, and has plied this trade for three years. He is a young and very responsible person. This is his second loan which he is applying for in order to purchase a hydraulic lift and other tools such as wrenches that he needs  to equip his workshop. He lives at home with his parents and contributes toward the household expenses. 

He wants to expand his workshop as the number of customers requiring his services has gone up in recent months. He is very grateful to the agency for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase a hydraulic lift and tools

loans.name: Yolamu

texts.en:
Yolamu, aged 38, is a married man with seven children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has operated a retail shop for the last seven years. He started with capital worth one hundred thousand which he had saved up from farming. He deals in buying and selling general domestic merchandise like sugar, toothpaste, soap, and cooking oil. He intends to start up a wholesale shop from his business proceeds in the near future. 

Yolamu wants the loan to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap to sell at his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap to sell at his shop

loans.name: Lorena Rubia

texts.es: Lorena Rubia C. D. P. D. 34 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos, todos menores D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas, negocio el cual en este país es muy rentable por el hecho que las tortillas son parte D. la dieta diaria D. las personas, razón por la cual se venden mucho. Lorena es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, la cual se esfuerza a diario por brindarles lo mejor y D. esta manera solventar los gastos del hogar y también pagar los estudios D. sus hijos, lo cual es D. mucha importancia para Lorena. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz D. manera que pueda contar con más materia prima para la elaboración D. su producto y así contar con más ganancias.
texts.en:
Lorena Rubia C. D. P. is 34 years old.  She is a very responsible and hard-working mother who works hard to get her 5 dependent children, who all study, ahead in life.

Lorena owns a tortilla business.  In this country this is a very profitable business because tortillas are a staple part of people's daily diet, so they sell really well.  Lorena is a very hard-working person and committed to her family.  She works hard every day to proviD. her family with the best, cover household expenses and pay for her children's education which is very important to her.  She is requesting a loan with which she can buy more corn so that she can have more ingredients for making her tortillas and, consequently, more profits.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, beans and fried pork rinds for making her tortillas and pupusas

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona 16 de julio. El trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa trufi 88 es socio propietario de una movilidad de transporte de pasajeros. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para refacción de su movilidad.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in his parents' home which is located in the '16 de julio' district of the city of El Alto.  He works as a member of the Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 transport syndicate.  He owns his own vehicle for transporting passengers.  This is the main source of income for supporting himself.  He does not have children and lives with his parents.

His loan will be used to refurbish his vehicle.

This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: To service and refurbish his vehicle

loans.name: Ren Rathy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren R. is forty years old and a widow with a child who is a student in a local school. She also helps with her mother’s businesses. Ren was selected to be the village’s bank president and head of the twelve-member bank loan in Svay Ming village, Kandal province. Each member of this village will use their money to support their different purposes.

Ren owns a small shop from which she sells soup, noodles and coffee to the local villagers. Since her business is doing so well, Ren is asking for a loan to buy more noodles and coffee to expand her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more noodles and coffee

loans.name: Ivan Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES  UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Iván Mario; el tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero; el socio tiene su carrito una combi el  brinda el servicio urbano dentro de la ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y tardes siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento y espera tal vez mas adelante estudiar alguna carrera pero primero quiere capitalizarse un poco más para así poder estudiar algo en el futuro. El socio es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios para su carro y para realizar el mantenimiento de este.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Ivan Mario, 22, is a member of the MUJERES UNIDAS community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sr. Ivan Mario is single.  He owns a small vehicle called a combi that he uses to taxi passengers around the city.  He works every day, mornings and afternoons, because the business is, for now, his only source of income.  He hopes to study for some career or other in the future, but he needs to save some money first to afford it.  He is an optimistic person with a strong desire to get ahead in the world.

Sr. Ivan Mario will use the loan to buy accessories for his vehicle and to make repairs to it.

Sr. Ivan Mario is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: Repair vehicle for taxi business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Doña Catalina, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en San Miguel donde vive con sus nietos de 9, 11, 14 y 16 años de edad, doña catalina se dedica a vender tortillas, cosméticos y lociones, este negocio lo inicio hace 29 años, trabajando todos los días de 5:00am a 2:00pm, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos de las cercanías al lugar.
Actualmente está necesitando un préstamo para comprar maíz, gas y leña, para la producción de las tortillas, este préstamo ayudara a mantener materiales abundantes y poder desarrollar sus ventas sin mayor problema.
Su aspiración es que su negocio se vuelva fuerte y pueda desarrollar capacidad para atender la demanda de los clientes, ganando más por las ventas y mejorando la condición de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Catalina is 56 years old and lives in San Miguel with her grandchildren ages 9, 11, 14 and 16.  She sells tortillas, cosmetics and lotions.  She began her business 29 years ago and works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends from the local area.

She currently needs a loan to buy corn, gas and firewood to make tortillas.  This loan will help her keep enough ingredients on hand so she can increase her sales without major problems.

Her dream is to grow her business enough to have sufficient capacity to attend to customer demand so she can increase sales and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy corn, gas and firewood

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Christopher Y., who is in his late thirties, is single with one child. He sells vegetables along Bagamoyo road. He has been in this business for one year. He works for 5 hours a week only, from 6am to 7am daily, and is able make a small monthly profit.

This will be Christopher's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to increase his stock of vegetables. He normally buys from farmers and sells to people who pass by his place.

Christopher will share this loan with the 15 members of the Becham group.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Christoper is in the middle, in a brown shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira lives with 6 members of her family: her husband (an engineer), her sister, her retired parents, and her two school-aged children.  Naira started her business since 2004.  She rents a stall and trades in fruits and vegetables.  Business is going well and there is demand for more of her produce. She has applied for a loan from SEF to acquire more inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more produce

loans.name: Duo Guiado Por Dios Group

texts.es: DUO GUIADO POR DIOS, MARLENA T. V.. TIENE 34 AÑOS  D. EDAD,TIENE DOS HIJAS PEQUEÑAS ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. ROPA TIPICA, PERO ELLA VEND. SU PRODUCTO AMBULANTE NO TIENE NINGUN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO NI EN SU CASA, ELLA DICE QUE NECESITA SU CREDITO, PARA COMPRA D. ROPA TIPICA. VIDALIA U., ELLA  TIENE 59 AÑOS D. EDAD ELLA TIENE VARIOS HIJOS, PERO LA MAYORIA SON CASADOS ELLA YA SOLO MANTIENE A TRES D. ELLOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES D. CONSUMO DIARIO, Y SU CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTO COMESTIBLE Y ASI PODER SURTIR SU NEGOCIO.PARA PODER AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA Y ESTAR BIEN ECONOMICAMENTE,
texts.en:
Marlena T. V. is 34 years old and has two young daughters.  Her business is selling traditional clothing.  She sells her products as an itinerant street trader.  She doesn't have a sales location either in the market or in her home.  She says that she needs this loan in order to buy traditional clothing.

Vidalia U. is 59 years old.  She has a number of children but most of them are married.  She currently only has three of them in her care.  Vidalia's business is selling essential food products and she needs this loan to buy more food products so that she can stock her business.  This will enable her to help her family and be in a good financial position.

loans.use: to buy food products and traditional clothing

location.town: Comunidad Carmen del Monte, Barcenas, Villa Nueva

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan Manuel Carrizales le está haciendo falta pintar y los detalles de los acabados. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder compra el material que necesita ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Don Juan Manuel pagara el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de exportación, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene, de su trabajo como empleada de una casa particular en limpieza. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan un lugar seguro y más cómodo para ellos ya que actual mente están estudiando.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Juan Manuel Carrizales is lacking paint and detailed finishes. He is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials so that he can complete these improvements during his time off from work.

Don Juan Manuel will repay the loan using the salary he receives from his job at an export company. His wife takes care of the family expenses with her income working as a housekeeper for a private household. Juan Manuel and his wife want their children to have a safe and comfortable place where they can focus on their studies.

loans.use: To finish the interior and exterior of his house.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Jean works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jean is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Jean has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream – to save enough money so she can send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Doña Hilda tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio hasta el tercer semetre de preparatoria, esta casada y tiene un hijo que asiste a la escuela en su comunidad, ella vive en una comunidad llamada El Jicaro que se encuentra en la carretera Tierrablanca-Joachin, esta comunidad se caracteriza por ser una region ganadera. 
Doña Hilda nos platica que ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual hace un par de años tenia una tienda de abarrotes la cual cerro porque no tenia los recursos economicos para invertir, ella nos dice que le gustaria volver a abrir su negocio pero ahora quiere vender diferentes cosas(pinturas de uñas, peines, diademas, juguetes, bolsas de mano, prendedores, lapices de colores, llaveros y carteras)ya que  ella piensa que sera un buen negocio ya que es lo que mas compran los jovenes.

Ella necesita este credito pra invertirlo enla compra de pinturas de uñas, peines, diademas, juguetes, bolsas de mano, prendedores, lapices de colores, llaveros y carteras para surtir su negocio e iniciar con su venta. 

Ella nos dice que espera que su negocio tenga exito y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo  y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Ella se enceuntra muy agradecida ya que con este cretido podra iniciar a tabajar en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda is 49 years old and completed a year and half of high school.  She’s married, has one son who attends the local school, and lives in the community of El Jicaro, located on the Tierrablanca-Joachin road.  This community is part of an agricultural region.

Hilda tells us that she has a space in her home where she used to run a grocery store but had to close it because she didn’t have the financial resources to invest.  She also tells us that she would like to reopen her business, but now she wants to sell different things (nail polish, combs, tiaras, toys, handbags, brooches, colored pencils, key chains, and wallets).  She believes that this will be a good business and these are the things that young people buy the most of.  She needs this loan to invest in merchandise to stock her business and expects her business to succeed and bring in a good income.  She wants to give a good life to her son and help her husband pay for the household expenses.

She is very grateful because this loan will allow her to begin working her own business.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cases of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, es una persona joven, viven en la comunidad de Thoqo Thaqo de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   tiene un hijo, al padre de su hijo tuvo que dejarlo por el mal trato que les daba a su hijo y a ella, ahora  ella sola tiene que mantener y alimentarlo a su  hijo.
     Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequia su pequeña parcela de cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba. 
     Juana es una persona joven  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijo  y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a su hijo, ella está solicitando el crédito para   comprar abono y semillas para mejorar sus cultivos  y aumentar su producción para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darle así una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y que  pueda asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a su hijo y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Juana is a young person living in the community of Thoqo Thaqo in Mizque Province, Cochabamba Department.  She has a son.  She had to leave the father of her son because of the poor way he treated her and their son.  Now, she must support and feed her son alone.

Because of the recent natural disaster (drought) her small onion crop did not mature well which led her to fail in obtaining the income she expected to.

Juana is a young, very well liked and respected person where she lives because of her dedication to her son and because of her work.  Sometimes she has to work as a day laborer in farming to earn a few pesos to support her son.

She is asking for a loan to buy manure and seeds to improve her crops and increase production to improve her income and provide a better quality of life for her son so that he can attend school in better condition.  The loan will help her and her son a lot in the hard work she does.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather and other materials for a shoemaking business.

loans.name: Lilevier

texts.en:
Lilevier works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 6 years.

Lilevier has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Neris

texts.es: Nery  trabaja con su madre y su hermana, (en la fotografía) en un negocio de su propiedad llamado  “Restaurante Mary”; ella vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Cartagena e inició en este negocio, cuando su madre se enfermó y debió asumir su liderazgo,  para continuar sosteniéndolo.  Como Nery y su familia trabajan diariamente por lograr el crecimiento de su negocio, están solicitando un aplanamiento financiero que les permita comprar mesas plásticas, sillas y una estufa industrial, para lograr mayor confort para sus clientes y mejorar los tiempos de trabajo de ellas tres. Este es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual planea hacer crecer su negocio.  Su sueño es tener un local bien ubicado, donde pueda organizar mejor su negocio y generar empleo para otros;  este es justamente su mayor desafío, pues cada día quiere tecnificarlo, con equipos y herramientas cada vez más modernas, con las cuales logre mayor eficiencia.  Mientras todo esto ocurre Neris trabaja con su familia, logrando una  rotación de  inventarios diaria, porque vende todo lo que cocinan; así mismo sus compras rotan con esta misma frecuencia y con ello incurre en gastos de transporte diarios,  que planea disminuir gradualmente, realizándolas en mayores volúmenes y espaciándolas cada vez más, para lograr ahorrar  un poco y aumentar sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Nery works with her mother and her sister (in the photograph) in her own business called “Restaurante Mary”.  She lives with her husband and their two children in the city of Cartagena.  She started in this business when her mother became ill and Nery had to assume the leadership in order to maintain the business.

As Nery and her family work every day to achieve the growth of her business, they are requesting financial assistance that will allow them to buy plastic tables, chairs, and an industrial stove.  They will do this in order to provide greater comfort for their customers and to improve the work shifts for the three of them.

That is the reason they request a Kiva loan.  It is their first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which they plan to make their business grow.

Her dream is to have a well located place where she is able to better organize her business and generate employment for others.  This is exactly her greatest challenge.  Every day she wants to use technology with equipment and tools that are more modern.  She could use those to achieve greater efficiency.  

While all of this is happening Neris works with her family, achieving a daily turnover of inventory because she sells everything they cook.  Her purchases turnover with the same frequency.  Therefore she incurs daily transportation expenses.  She plans to gradually decrease these expenses by purchasing in greater volume and buying less frequently.  She will do this in order to save a little and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables, chairs, and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista lives in Uganda. She is widowed and has eight children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).  Teopista has a business selling charcoal and bananas. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Teopista sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail. Teopista has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas.  Teopista earns additional income by selling mats and baskets.    The main business challenges for Teopista include defaulters, thieves, transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to buy a plot of land. Teopista lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity but does have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ferman

texts.es:
Ferman, es agricultor, vive en compañía de su esposa y un hijo de 18 años de edad, él desde joven se dedica  a cultivar el maíz y frijol, atiende las labores todos los días de la semana, de la producción agrícola depende su familia, pues la comercializan para generar ganancias.
El invertirá un préstamo en abono y pesticidas, estos pues para tratar el cultivo y poder fortalecer la plantación, permitiéndole desarrollarse y obtener una buena cosecha.
Para Ferman el propósito de su esfuerzo en la agricultura, es apoyar a su familia para contribuir con los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Ferman, a farmer, lives with his wife and 18 year old son. Since he was a young man he has planted corn and beans. He works every day of the week. His family depends on his farming production, and he sells it for income. 

He will invest the loan in fertilizer an pesticides to trat his crops and be able to strengthen the planting. This will allow him to develop and obtain a good harvest.  

For Ferman, the reason for his hard work in farming is to support his family and contribute paying the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Yendoubouam

texts.fr:
Yendoubouam est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée à un pompiste. Elle a 3 enfants, tous  à l’école. Le premier a 19 ans ans et le dernier a 6 ans.  
Yendoubouam travaille comme revendeuse de Gâteau depuis 2002. Elle vend des gateaux pour tout le monde dans sa maison. Elle travaille seule. 
Yendoubouam a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des farines de blé et de l’huile. Elle veut avec ce crédit relancer ses activités. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yendoubouam voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle  va contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille pour avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Yendoubouam is a 33 year old woman. She is married to a petrol pump attendant. She has three children who are all in school. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 6 years old.

Yendoubouam has been working as a cookie seller since 2002. She sells cookies to everyone from her house. She works alone.

Yendoubouam has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy wheat flour and oil. She wants to use this loan to revive her business.
Over the coming years, Yendoubouam would like to expand her business. She says that she will use the profits to contribute to her family expenses in order to have a happier family life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and oil.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: José Rolando tiene 60 años. Es un hombre muy responsable vive con su compañera de vida. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar servicio de transporte. Hace más de 13 años que inicio con este negocio cuando anteriormente trabaja en el ingenio santa rosa, fue así que inicialmente comenzó a trabajar. El solicita el financiamiento para la compra de llantas, focos, espejos, entre otros.
texts.en: José Rolando is 60 years old.  He is a very responsible man who lives with his life partner.  His business is providing a transport service.  He started this business 13 years ago, having previously worked in the Santa Rosa sugar refinery which is where he started his working life.  He is requesting this loan to buy tires, headlamps, mirrors, etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlamps, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 45 years old and is single. She believes that a smile is the best medicine. Despite the challenges in her life, Jenifer stands firm to face them. She also believes that there is a biggest God for a big challenge. She is a kind and helpful individual. 

Jenifer runs a hog raising business – primarily pigs for breeding. She has been in this business for almost eight years. Jenifer needs additional working capital of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vaccines for her piglets. She will manage her business well to maintain it and earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her piglets.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a 36-year-old married farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Ernesto grows rice on his land. He has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns about 12,000 PHP.

Ernesto has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. Ernesto hopes to provide a better quality of life to his family. He also hopes for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Barceliza

texts.en:
Barceliza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Barceliza has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay to sell.

Barceliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Barceliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing (ukay-ukay) to sell

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Nakali is 37 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 19, 16 and 9.  In 2001, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Nakali plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a "pasal", is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Jose Jorge

texts.es:
José Jorge tiene 31 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con la madre en el cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.
José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá mejorar la calidad del producto comprar los insumos y semillas sin ningún probL..
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir otro préstamo pero ya el monto más alto para comprar más terreno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Jose Jorge is 31 years old, single, with no children, and lives with his mother in Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” (Mount of Olives) communal bank is located in San Jose del Tambo parish, some 60 minutes from our office, and is composed of 14 members, male and female. Its members are dedicated to agricultural work on the short cycle. They sow corn, oranges and cacao.

Jose too is dedicated to agriculture. He plants corn, oranges, and cacao, and does his buying and selling in Chillanes canton. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer to maintain his plantings in good condition. The loan will be a great help because buying these inputs and seeds without problems will improve the quality of the harvest.

Challenges very frequently occur, including competition and crop plagues. Jose's dream is to continue working to be able to acquire another loan for a larger sum to obtain more land.

In his free time, Jose likes to practice sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs such as urea, herbicides fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Ngamilo Group

texts.en:
Stephen is the facilitator of the Ngamilo group. Stephen and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Stephen takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for the quality farm produce and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 23 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Stephen will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Ngamilo group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Stephen is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Mme Yacine est une jeune débutante dans le commerce car cela ne fait qu’un 1 an qu’elle s’est lancé. Elle est mariée .Son activité consiste à vendre des chaussures, des ventilateurs et tout autres produit qu’on lui commande
Avec le crédit Yacine veut renforcer son activité
Ces  bénéfices sont reversés dans l’ activité pour augmenter l’ offre.
texts.en:
A relative newcomer to business, Mme Yassin launched her activity one year ago. She is married. Her business consists of selling footwear, fans and any other products that customers may request
Yassin wants to use the loan to strengthen her business
Any profit will be reinvested into her business so that she can increase her product offering.

loans.use: to buy shoes and any other products likely to generate a profit

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 43 years old, a mother of four children and husband to Sylvanus. The family lives in the Murumba area of Kakamega .

Lydia operates a cereal-selling business in Murumba and has been doing this for the last two years. She joined KADET LTD when a need for micro credit arose, and is now taking her second, which she will use to buy maize cereal for sale.

She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business and also to support her family. Her dream is to get more funding to enable her to open a cereal outlet.

loans.use: to buy more maize cereals for sale.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Guillermo es grafico, trabaja como artesano en la elaboración de agendas, recibos y otros; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de Papel ya que se acerca fin de año y tiene varios pedidos de agendas, de tal manera que espera generar ingresos extras para Navidad. Guillermo es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona  de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Guillermo es cliente de Impro desde el año  2005 y esta será la tercera vez que desea que su crédito sea enviado a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sr. Guillermo is a graphic designer who produces agendas, receipts, and other documents. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy paper. The end of the year is approaching and he has many orders for agendas. He expects that this will generate extra income for Christmas. Guillermo is married and has two children. He lives in his own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Guillermo has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and this will be the third time that he wants his loan request sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy paper for fulfilling his year-end orders.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en: Zadock is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be a promising man. He operates a tailoring shop where he sells trousers, suits and materials. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of materials used for sewing. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase an overlock machine (serger). His business goal is to run a tailoring school within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is a 47-year-old divorced woman with eight children living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on her, and her dream is to see her children graduating. 

She deals in a second-hand clothes, a business she has done for 15 years. Her goals are educating her children and trading on a wholesale basis. 

Joselyne needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Y. Esther C.

texts.fr: Âgée de 21 ans, Y. Esther C. a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Y. Esther C. est célibataire sans enfant. Y. Esther C. vit seule, et assure toute seule ces besoins. Pour cette raison, Y. Esther C. vend divers produits et des sachets dans sa région depuis quatre ans environ. Y. Esther C. s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Y. Esther C. devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Y. Esther C. sollicite une première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits et des sachets.

loans.name: Aurora Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 48 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years.
Hà lives in Tinh Gia district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hà faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future..
This is Hà first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.en:
Yolande A., who is also called Yoyo, was born on March 25, 1977, in Badou (Wawa prefecture). Coming from a family of seven children, she left school very early because her parents, short on funds, had preferred to send the boys to school to the detriment of the girls. So she turned towards an apprenticeship in dressmaking. Unfortunately, since completing her apprenticeship five years ago, she lacked the money to open up her own shop. She worked outdoors at home using sewing machines she rents from friends and acquaintances. But with the quality of her work, she received a lot of orders that are filled late just because of a lack of machines available. Her customer base continued to grow and grow, so using the little money she saved, she decided to lease a shop of her own called «Yoyo Couture». But she still runs up against the problem of finances. Her husband, a furniture maker without a steady income, finds himself unable to help her despite his willingness to do so. A very level-headed and energetic young woman, Yolande needs financial support to make things work.

Yolande is requesting a loan of $950 to renovate her shop and to buy two sewing machines. Financing her means helping her improve the living condition of the four people she under her care, plus her parents weary with age.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mme A. Yolande dite « Yoyo » est née le 25 mars 1977 à Badou dans la préfecture de Wawa. Issue d’une famille de sept (07) enfants, elle abandonnant très tôt l’école car ses parents, ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens, avaient préféré scolariser les garçons au détriment des filles. Elle s’oriente alors vers l’apprentissage et s’est formée en couture. Malheureusement, depuis la fin de sa formation il y a cinq (05) ans, elle n’est pas arrivée à ouvrir son atelier par manque de moyens. Elle travaille à la maison en plein air avec les machines louées auprès de ses camarades ou connaissances. Mais avec la qualité de ses prestations, elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire à temps justement par manque de machines. Sa clientèle devant de plus en plus importante, elle décide d’ouvrir un atelier mais se heurte toujours aux moyens financiers. Son mari, un menuisier sans emploi fixe, se trouve lui aussi dans l’incapacité de lui venir en aide malgré sa bonne volonté. Avec sa petite économie réalisée, elle est arrivée à louer un local qui nécessite des aménagements et des équipements. Jeune femme très calme et dynamique, Yolande a besoin d’un appui financier pour pouvoir s’en sortir.

Yolande sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 qui servira à aménager son atelier et à acheter deux machines à coudre. Financer Mme A. Yolande c’est contribuer à améliorer les conditions de vie de quatre (04) personnes à sa charges et ses parents, aujourd’hui très fatigués par le poids de l’âge.

loans.use: To renovate her shop and buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Lem Jennet

texts.en:
Lem, popularly called Mama Koki, was born in 1968. She is married and has four children. Her major goal is to work hand-in-hand with her husband to get all her children through school. She has received training in marketing techniques, credit and other survival skills. With constant supervision and support from group and center members she took her first loan of $40 in 2006. From previous investments she succeeded in providing lunch to workers at construction and other job-sites.

With a loan of $200, she plans to increase her stock by buying beans, drum of oil and pig feed. She will continue to provide lunch to laborers at job-sites and families that are busy to cook for themselves or for ceremonies. She plans to pay her loan in 15 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Mobile Koki restaurant

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en: Farhod has been running his business for 7 years. He is married and has 3 children. His parents live with him. He is a very energetic and creative person. He started his business by trading soft drinks. When he heard about MicroInvest, he became a client and begain with a $100 loan. Gradually, he increased his loan and his business became sucessful gradually. He regularly repaid his loan on time. He opened two new locations with his partner Boimatov; they included a pharmacy and computer center. He also rented a bus stop and opened a location for drinks and ice cream. In the future, he plans to use his $1,000 loan for purchasing equipment for two new projects: production of windows and doors and processing of meat and milk products. He plans to engage 35-40 people for this project.

loans.use: Start two new projects: production of windows and doors and processing of meat and milk products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used apparel business

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen M. Matzir, age 54, has for many years sold bread by going house to house and currently has a spot on the sidewalk of Yepocapa where she sells fruits and vegetables.

Even though it is a little scary and has taken a lot of initiative, Maria is taking out this loan from Friendship Bridge to expand her business activities to selling bedspreads and ponchos. She will walk the streets with her products and sell them to interested buyers. She will continue selling bread, fruits and vegetables along with the new bedspreads and ponchos. The markup for these items is better than that for fruits and vegetables so she hopes to save a little to get ahead in life.

Maria is not married and has 8 children. The 3 youngest children live with her and attend school. Schooling is something Maria never had the opportunity to do. Like many of her peers, she cannot read and signs her name with a thumbprint impression. She is very proud to see her children better themselves through education as she betters herself by participating in the Friendship Bridge microfinance group. As a member of the women's group, Flor de Liz, she benefits from the informal education portions of each monthly meeting. Informal education for the clients is one of the missions that Friendship Bridge has incorporated as a key objective.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Solijon

texts.en:
J. Solijon is an experienced businessman. He has been engaged in the trade of electronic goods for over 8 years. His business is located in Ovchikalacha, in the district of Khujand. His wife is dead and he lives with his 4 children.

Solijon sells different kinds of goods. Every day, his sons help display and arrange his goods in his stall. He buys his goods from local workshops and sells them at his trading stall in the market. He spends the profit from his business on his family's daily needs and expenses. In the near future he wants to rent an additional trading stall for his son. He plans to use this loan to expand his assortment of goods.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Lolakovati

texts.en: Lolakovati is 29 years old. She is a mother and lives in Papaigalagala Center. She joined SPBD last year in October to start a pancake business. She is a hard-working mother, who delivers the pancakes she makes every day to the village primary school. She earns $400 WST ($160 USD) a week, and after all expenses she gets a profit of $150 WST ($60 USD). This money allows her to repay part of her loan every week. She is looking forward to future loans so she can continue to expand her business. She would also like to use some of the money to renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancake business and for home improvement

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeang P. and her husband have been married since 1973. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. Three of the children are employed full time, and the youngest one is studying in a local school. Yeang and her family live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1979. Beside weaving, she also buys silk products from a weaver to resell at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a teacher.

Yeang has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase silk products to resell at a market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase silk products to resell

loans.name: Lik

texts.en: Mrs. Lik R., 24, is a housewife with one small child.  Her husband meanwhile works as a construction foreman, earning about $6 each day.  Mrs. Lik R. would like to use this loan to purchase her husband a motor-bike to commute to work. This will help the family economically because her husband spends much money every day using a motor-taxi service for his commute. ( her husband is pictured with her mother who is living with her)

loans.use: To purchase her husband a motor-bike to commute to work.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra belongs to the community bank “Las Triunfadoras”, located at 374 Bellavista Ave., in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and the mother of three children: her husband is a welder. With her first loan received from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles she decided to invest in a welding workshop.

Currently, she sells food and continues with her welding workshop: with the help of her children she prepares the food whilst her husband looks after the workshop.

With this loan of 3000 Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy materials for her workshop, tools and provisions for preparing her food dishes.

Mayra is very happy with the loans, as thanks to them she is managing to realize her ambitions and give her dear children the basic comforts in life.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mayra pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista 374, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años,es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es soldador. Ella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un taller de soldadura.

En la actualidad vende comida y continua con su taller de soldadura, con la ayuda de sus hijos prepara sus comidas, y su esposo se dedica a la atención de su taller de soldadura.
